H0175.d: High Priest living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0175.s: A high priest from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Exo.4.14; referred to as Aaron (אַהֲרֹן), or Aaron (Ἀαρών);  son of Amram and Jochebed; a brother of Moses and Miriam; husband of Elisheba;  father of Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
H0175.f: Moses' brother, first high priest of Israel
H0175.meaning: Hebrew אַהֲרוֹן (Aharon); etymology uncertain—possibly Egyptian, or from Hebrew 'mountaineer' or 'enlightened.' Not from a common Hebrew root; name predates Exodus. Hitchcock: a teacher; lofty; mountain of strength. BehindTheName: From Hebrew אַהֲרֹן (ʾAharon), most likely of unknown Egyptian origin. Other theories suggest 'high mountain' or 'exalted'.
H0175.significance: First high priest; establishes the Aaronic priesthood. Type of Christ as priest (Heb 5–7): offers sacrifice, mediates, bears the people’s names. His rod buds (Num 17)—life from death; his line endures.

H0005.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H0005.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Est.1.10; only referred to as Abagtha (אֲבַגְתָא).
H0005.f: One of King Ahasuerus' seven eunuchs
H0005.meaning: Persian name; not Hebrew. Likely related to Persian baga (god) + a theophoric element. One of seven eunuchs of Ahasuerus (Xerxes). Hitchcock: father of the wine-press
H0005.significance: Minor court official; represents the Gentile royal household in Esther. Eunuchs often gatekeepers of access to the king—ironic backdrop to Esther’s risk to approach.

H5653.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H5653.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.4.6; only referred to as Abda (עַבְדָּא);  father of Adoram.
H5653.f: Father of Adoram, who was over forced labor
H5653.meaning: From עָבַד (avad), to serve, work. Abda = servant. Father of Adoram (1 Ki 4:6), who was over forced labor. Hitchcock: a servant; servitude
H5653.significance: His name (servant) fits his son’s role: Adoram oversaw the corvée. The house of “servant” administers forced service—naming echoes function in the monarchy.

H5655.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5655.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at Jer.36.26; only referred to as Abdeel (עַבְדְּאֵל);  father of Shelemiah.
H5655.f: Father of Shelemiah, an official under King Jehoiakim
H5655.meaning: From עָבַד (avad), serve, + אֵל (el), God. Abdeel = servant of God. Hitchcock: a vapor; a cloud of God
H5655.significance: Father of Shelemiah (Jer 36:26); named in the context of Baruch’s scroll and the king’s rejection. “Servant of God” in a line that confronts the king.

H5660.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5660.s: A musician from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.6.44; only referred to as Abdi (עַבְדִּי); a son of Malluch;  father of Kishi.
H5660.f: A Levite, ancestor of Ethan the musician
H5660.meaning: From עָבַד (avad); Abdi = my servant. Levite, time of Hezekiah (2 Chr 29:12).
H5660.significance: Levite in temple restoration under Hezekiah. Name (servant) fits cultic service; part of the cohort that cleanses and consecrates the house.

H5661.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5661.s: A man from the tribe of Gad  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.5.15; only referred to as Abdiel (עַבְדִּיאֵל); a son of Guni;  father of Ahi.
H5661.meaning: From עֶבֶד (eved), servant, + אֵל (el), God. Abdiel = servant of God. BehindTheName: Means 'servant of God' in Hebrew, from עֶבֶד (ʿeveḏ) 'servant' and אֵל (ʾel) 'God'.
H5661.significance: Son of Guni, Gadite (1 Chr 5:15). In a genealogy of the Transjordan tribes; “servant of God” in a line that will face exile (1 Chr 5:26).

H5658.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5658.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.23; only referred to as Abdon (עַבְדּוֹן);  son of Shashak; a brother of Ishpan, Eber, Eliel, Zichri, Hanan, Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah, Iphdeiah and Penuel.
H5658.meaning: From עָבַד (avad); Abdon = servitude. Judge in Israel (Judg 12:13–15); had 40 sons, 30 grandsons—symbol of lineage and donkeys (status). Hitchcock: servant; cloud of judgment
H5658.significance: Minor judge; name suggests servitude—perhaps to God or to the people. His many sons and donkeys imply wealth; judgeship as service, not dynasty.

H1893.d: Man living at the time before the Flood
H1893.s: A man living at the time before the Flood, first mentioned at Gen.4.2; referred to as Abel (הֶ֫בֶל), or Abel (Ἄβελ);  son of Adam and Eve; a brother of Cain and Seth.
H1893.f: Adam and Eve's second son, killed by Cain
H1893.meaning: Hebrew הֶבֶל (hevel), breath, vapor, vanity. Same word as in Ecclesiastes—transitory, fleeting. Second son of Adam. Hitchcock: vanity; breath; vapor | a city; mourning. BehindTheName: From Hebrew הֶבֶל (Hevel) meaning 'breath'.
H1893.significance: First righteous sacrifice (Gen 4:4); first murder victim. Type of Christ: acceptable offering, innocent blood, “speaks” after death (Heb 11:4). Name (breath) echoes life cut short.

H0021.d: Woman living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0021.s: A woman living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.18.2; referred to as Abi (אֲבִי), or Abijah (אֲבִיָּה); a daughter of Zechariah; wife of Ahaz;  mother of Hezekiah and Maaseiah.
H0021.f: Mother of King Hezekiah of Judah
H0021.meaning: From אָב (av), father; Abi = my father, or fatherly. Short form; Hezekiah’s mother (2 Ki 18:2), daughter of Zechariah.
H0021.significance: Mother of a reforming king; Hezekiah’s devotion may reflect her influence. Name (fatherly) could point to lineage or character.

H0029.d: King living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0029.s: A king of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ki.14.31; referred to as Abijah (אֲבִיָּה), or Abijah (אֲבִיָּ֫הוּ), or Abijam (NIV= Abijah, KJV= Abia)  (אֲבִיָּם), or Abijah (Ἀβιά);  son of Rehoboam and Maacah; a brother of Attai, Ziza and Shelomith;  father of Asa;  half-brother of: Jeush, Shemariah and Zaham.
H0029.meaning: From אָב (av) + יָהּ (Yah). Abijah = father (worshipper) of Yah. Multiple bearers: king of Judah (1 Ki 14:31), priest, others. Hitchcock: the Lord is my father. BehindTheName: Means 'my father is Yahweh' in Hebrew, from אָב (ʾav) 'father' and יָהּ (yah) referring to God.
H0029.significance: Abijah king: walked in his father Rehoboam’s sins (1 Ki 14:22–24). Name confesses Yah, but life did not—name vs. deed tension.

H0045.d: Warrior living at the time of United Monarchy
H0045.s: A warrior living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.23.31; referred to as Abi-albon (אֲבִי־עַלְבוֹן), or Abiel (אֲבִיאֵל).
H0045.f: One of David's mighty men, an Arbathite
H0045.meaning: From אָב + strength (חַיִל or similar). Abi-albon = father of strength / valiant. One of David’s thirty (2 Sam 23:31). Hitchcock: most intelligent father
H0045.significance: Elite warrior under David; name (valiant) fits the Mighty Men. Part of the human “strength” that secures the kingdom.

H0054.d: High Priest living at the time of United Monarchy
H0054.s: A High Priest living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.22.20; referred to as Abiathar (אֶבְיָתָר), or Abiathar (Ἀβιαθάρ); a son of Ahimelech;  father of Ahimelech, Jonathan.
H0054.f: High priest during the reigns of David and Solomon
H0054.meaning: From אָב + יָתַר (yatar), abundance, remainder. Abiathar = father of abundance. Priest, house of Eli. Hitchcock: excellent father; father of the remnant
H0054.significance: Priest who fled Saul with the ephod; supported David, then backed Adonijah. Solomon removed him—fulfillment of word against Eli’s house (1 Ki 2:27). Name (abundance) contrasts with his line’s end.

H0028.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0028.s: A man of the Midianites living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.25.4; only referred to as Abida (אֲבִידָע);  son of Midian; a brother of Ephah, Epher, Hanoch and Eldaah.
H0028.f: Son of Midian, grandson of Abraham
H0028.meaning: From אָב + יָדַע (yada), know. Abida = father of knowledge. Son of Abraham by Keturah (Gen 25:4).
H0028.significance: Son of the covenant patriarch by a secondary wife; sent east (Gen 25:6). Name (knowledge) in a line outside the main promise—knowledge of God vs. separation.

H0027.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0027.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.1.11; only referred to as Abidan (אֲבִידָן); a son of Gideoni.
H0027.f: Leader of the tribe of Benjamin during the Exodus
H0027.meaning: From אָב + דִּין (din), judgment. Abidan = father of judgment. Prince of Benjamin at the census (Num 1:11, 2:22).
H0027.significance: Tribal representative in the wilderness; name (judgment) fits the judicial role of princes. Part of the ordered camp around the tabernacle.

H0022.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0022.s: A warrior from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.9.1; referred to as Abiel (אֲבִיאֵל), or Jeiel (=Qere. Ketiv=Jeuel, KJV= Jehiel) (יְעִיאֵל), or Ner (נֵר), or   founder of Gibeon (אֲבִי גִבְעוֹן); a son of Zeror; husband of Maacah;  father of Kish, Ner, Abdon, Zur, Baal, Nadab, Gedor, Ahio, Zecher and Mikloth; founder of Gibeon.
H0022.meaning: From אָב + אֵל (el), God. Abiel = father (possessor) of God, or God is father. Grandfather of Saul (1 Sam 9:1). Hitchcock: God my father
H0022.significance: Ancestor of Israel’s first king; name (God is father) contrasts with Saul’s later rejection. Line that began with a Godward name ends in loss of kingdom.

H0044.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0044.s: A man from the tribe of Manasseh living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.26.30; referred to as Abiezer or Abiezrite (אֲבִיעֶ֫זֶר), or Iezer (KJV= Jeezer)  (אִיעֶזֶר), or Abiezrite (אֲבִי הָעֶזְרִי), or Iezerite (KJV= Jeezerites)  (אִיעֶזְרִי);  son of Gilead; a brother of Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Shemida and Hepher.
H0044.meaning: From אָב + עֵזֶר (ezer), help. Abiezer = father of help. Manassehite; Gideon’s clan (Judg 6:11, 34).
H0044.significance: Gideon’s clan—the “least” in Manasseh (Judg 6:15). Name (father of help) fits God’s pattern: help from the weak. First of the muster (Num 26:30).

H0026.d: Woman living at the time of United Monarchy
H0026.s: A woman living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.17.25; referred to as Abigail (אֲבִיגַ֫יִל), or Abigal (KJV= Abigail)  (אֲבִיגַ֫ל);  daughter of Nahash and Nahash(?); a sister of David(?), Eliab(?), Abinadab(?), Shimeah(?), Nethanel(?), Raddai(?), Ozem(?), Zeruiah(?), and Elihu(?); wife of Jether;  mother of Amasa.
H0026.f: Sister of David; mother of Amasa
H0026.meaning: From אָב + גִּיל (gil), joy. Abigail = father (source) of joy. Wife of Nabal, then David (1 Sam 25). Hitchcock: the father's joy. BehindTheName: From Hebrew אֲבִיגָיִל (ʾAviḡayil) meaning 'my father is joy', from אָב (ʾav) 'father' and גִּיל (gil) 'joy'.
H0026.significance: Wise woman who prevents David from bloodguilt; “source of joy” to David. Type of the wise bride who restrains and counsels; mother of Chileab.

H0032.d: Woman living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0032.s: A woman from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ch.11.18; only referred to as Abihail (אֲבִיחַ֫יִל); a daughter of Eliab; wife of Jerimoth;  mother of Mahalath.
H0032.meaning: From אָב + חַיִל (chayil), might, valor. Abihail = father of might. Multiple bearers (male and female). Hitchcock: the father of strength. BehindTheName: Means 'my father is strength' in Hebrew, from אָב (ʾav) 'father' and חַיִל (ḥayil) 'strength'.
H0032.significance: One Abihail is mother of Esther (Est 2:15)—“father of might” for the woman who risks all before the king. Name and role align.

H0030.d: Priest living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0030.s: A priest from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Exo.6.23; only referred to as Abihu (אֲבִיהוּא);  son of Aaron and Elisheba; a brother of Nadab, Eleazar and Ithamar.
H0030.meaning: From אָב + הוּא (hu), he/him. Abihu = father (worshipper) of Him (God). Son of Aaron (Ex 6:23). Hitchcock: he is my father. BehindTheName: Means 'he is my father' in Hebrew, from אָב (ʾav) 'father' and הוּא (hu) 'he'.
H0030.significance: Priest who offered strange fire (Lev 10:1–2) and died. Name (worshipper of Him) vs. act—worship on man’s terms. Warning against unauthorized approach.

H0031.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0031.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.3; only referred to as Abihud (אֲבִיהוּד);  son of Bela; a brother of Ard, Naaman, Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, Iri, Addar, Gera, Abishua and Ahoah.
H0031.meaning: From אָב + הוֹד (hod), splendor, majesty. Abihud = father of splendor. In Saul’s genealogy (1 Chr 8:3). Hitchcock: father of praise; confession
H0031.significance: Benjaminite in the line of Saul; name (splendor) in a house that lost the kingdom. Ironic given Saul’s fall.

H0039.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0039.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.10.28; only referred to as Abimael (אֲבִימָאֵל);  son of Joktan; a brother of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah, Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah, Obal, Sheba, Ophir, Havilah and Jobab.
H0039.f: Descendant of Shem, son of Joktan
H0039.meaning: Hitchcock: a father sent from God
H0039.significance: Son of Joktan. Name (from H1 (אָב) and an elsewhere unused (probably foreign) word; father ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0040.s: A Judge living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jdg.8.31; only referred to as Abimelech (אֲבִימֶ֫לֶךְ);  son of Gideon; a brother of Jether and Jotham.
H0040.f: Son of Gideon, self-proclaimed king of Shechem
H0040.meaning: From אָב + מֶלֶךְ (melek), king. Abimelech = my father is king. Title or name of several Philistine/Gerar kings (Gen 20, 26; Judg 9). Hitchcock: father of the king. BehindTheName: Means 'my father is king' in Hebrew, from אָב (ʾav) 'father' and מֶלֶךְ (meleḵ) 'king'.
H0040.significance: Gideon’s son Abimelech (Judg 9) claims kingship by blood and kills brothers—name (father is king) becomes usurpation. Shechem’s folly and his end at Thebez.

H0041.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0041.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.14.49; referred to as Abinadab (אֲבִינָדָב), or Ishvi (KJV= Ishui)  (יִשְׁוִי);  son of Saul and Ahinoam; a brother of Jonathan, Malchi-shua, Merab and Michal;  half-brother of: Ish-bosheth, Armoni and Mephibosheth.
H0041.f: Son of King Saul, killed in battle
H0041.meaning: From אָב + נָדָב (nadav), willing, generous. Abinadab = father of willingness. Saul’s son (1 Sam 31:2); also the man in whose house the ark rested (1 Sam 7:1). Hitchcock: father of a vow, or of willingness
H0041.significance: Saul’s son died with him at Gilboa. Another Abinadab (Kiriath-jearim) housed the ark—same name, different fates: one death in battle, one honor of holding the ark.

H0042.s: A man living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jdg.4.6; only referred to as Abinoam (אֲבִינֹ֫עַם);  father of Barak.
H0042.f: Father of Barak, the Israelite commander
H0042.meaning: From אָב + נֹעַם (noam), pleasantness. Abinoam = father of pleasantness. Father of Barak (Judg 4:6). Hitchcock: father of beauty
H0042.significance: Father of the military leader Barak; “pleasantness” in a time of oppression. Name suggests favor—Barak’s victory is the Lord’s pleasant work.

H0048.d: Aaron's adversary living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0048.s: A man from the tribe of Reuben living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.16.1; only referred to as Abiram (אֲבִירָם);  son of Eliab; a brother of Dathan and Nemuel.
H0048.f: Reubenite who rebelled against Moses and Aaron
H0048.meaning: From אָב + רָם (ram), high, exalted. Abiram = my father is exalted. Reubenite; with Dathan and Korah (Num 16). Hitchcock: high father; father of deceit. BehindTheName: Means 'my father is exalted' in Hebrew, from אָב (ʾav) 'father' and רוּם (rum) 'to exalt'.
H0048.significance: Rebel against Moses and Aaron; earth swallows them (Num 16:32). Name (exalted father) vs. end—exaltation of self, not God. Type of presumption.

H0049.d: Woman living at the time of United Monarchy
H0049.s: A woman living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ki.1.3; only referred to as Abishag (אֲבִישַׁג).
H0049.f: Beautiful Shunammite who served King David
H0049.meaning: From אָב + שָׁגַג (shagag), err, stray. Abishag = father of error/wandering, or (alternately) source of ignorance. Young Shunammite who attended David (1 Ki 1:3–4). Hitchcock: ignorance of the father. BehindTheName: Means 'my father strays' in Hebrew, from אָב (ʾav) 'father' and שָׁגָה (shaḡa) 'to stray'.
H0049.significance: David’s attendant in old age; Adonijah’s request for her becomes his death sentence (1 Ki 2:17–25). She is the occasion of Solomon’s purge—innocent figure at the center of succession conflict.

H0052.d: David's warrior living at the time of United Monarchy
H0052.s: A warrior living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.26.6; only referred to as Abishai (אֲבִישַׁי); his mother was Zeruiah; a brother of Joab and Asahel.
H0052.f: David's nephew, one of his mighty men and commanders
H0052.meaning: From אָב + שַׁי (shay), gift, or from a root for present. Abishai = father of gift. Son of Zeruiah; David’s nephew, one of the three (2 Sam 23:18). Hitchcock: the present of my father. BehindTheName: Means 'my father is a gift' in Hebrew, from אָב (ʾav) 'father' and שַׁי (shai) 'gift'.
H0052.significance: Fierce warrior; often with David in crisis (e.g. 1 Sam 26:6–12). Wanted to strike Shimei (2 Sam 16:9)—loyalty and zeal, but David restrains. Name (gift) as the gift of fierce loyalty.

H0050.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0050.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.4; only referred to as Abishua (אֲבִישׁוּעַ);  son of Bela; a brother of Ard, Naaman, Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, Iri, Addar, Gera, Abihud and Ahoah.
H0050.f: Descendant of Benjamin, son of Bela
H0050.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1 (אָב) and H7771 (שׁוֹעַ); father of plenty (i.e. prosperous) Abishua, the name of two...

H0051.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0051.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.2.28; only referred to as Abishur (אֲבִישׁוּר);  son of Shammai; a brother of Nadab; husband of Abihail;  father of Ahban and Molid.
H0051.f: Son of Shammai, from the tribe of Judah
H0051.meaning: Hitchcock: father of the wall; father of uprightness
H0051.significance: Son of Shammai. Name (from H1 (אָב) and H7791 (שׁוּר); father of (the) wall (i.e. perhaps ma...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0037.d: Woman living at the time of United Monarchy
H0037.s: A woman living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.3.4; only referred to as Abital (אֲבִיטָ֑ל); wife of David;  mother of Shephatiah.
H0037.f: One of David's wives; mother of Shephatiah
H0037.meaning: Hitchcock: the father of the dew; or of the shadow. BehindTheName: Means 'my father is dew' in Hebrew, from אָב (ʾav) 'father' and טַל (ṭal) 'dew'.
H0037.significance: woman living at the time of united monarchy. Name meaning: from H1 (אָב) and H2919 (טַל); father of dew (i.e. fresh) Abital, a wi...

H0036.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0036.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.11; only referred to as Abitub (אֲבִיטוּב);  son of Shaharaim and Hushim; a brother of Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam, Jeuz, Sachia, Mirmah and Elpaal.
H0036.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1 (אָב) and H2898 (טוּב); father of goodness (i.e. good) Abitub, an Israelite

G0010.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
G0010.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Mat.1.13; only referred to as Abiud (Ἀβιούδ);  son of Zerubbabel;  father of Eliakim; a brother of Meshullam, Hananiah, Shelomith, Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, Jushab-hesed.
G0010.f: Son of Zerubbabel, ancestor of Jesus
G0010.significance: Son of Zerubbabel. Name (of Hebrew origin (H031) Abihud, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0074.d: David's compatriot living at the time of United Monarchy
H0074.s: A warrior from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.14.50; only referred to as Abner (אֲבִינֵר); a son of Ner;  father of Jaasiel.
H0074.f: Saul's cousin and commander of his army
H0074.meaning: From אָב (av) + נִיר (nir), light. Abner = father of light. Saul's cousin and army commander (1 Sam 14:50). BehindTheName: From Hebrew אַבְנֵר (ʾAvner) meaning 'my father is a light', from אָב (ʾav) 'father' and נֵר (ner) 'lamp, light'.
H0074.significance: Saul's general; after Saul's death supported Ish-bosheth, then defected to David. Joab killed him (2 Sam 3:27). Name (father of light) in a house that lost the kingdom.

H0085.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0085.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.11.26; referred to as Abraham (אַבְרָהָם), or Abram (אַבְרָם), or Abraham (Ἀβραάμ);  son of Terah; a brother of Nahor, Haran and Sarah; husband of Sarah, and had concubines Hagar and Keturah;  father of Ishmael, Isaac, Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak and Shuah.
H0085.meaning: From אָב (av) + הָמוֹן (hamon), multitude. Abraham = father of a multitude (Gen 17:5); earlier Abram = exalted father. Hitchcock: father of a great multitude. BehindTheName: From Hebrew אַבְרָהָם (ʾAvraham), meaning 'father of many' or contraction of Abram and הָמוֹן (hamon) 'multitude'.
H0085.significance: Covenant patriarch; father of the faithful (Rom 4). Name change marks covenant: from exalted father to father of many nations. Type of faith and of the promised seed (Gal 3:16).

H0053.d: David's son living at the time of United Monarchy
H0053.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.3.3; referred to as Absalom (אַבְשָׁלוֹם), or Abishalom (אֲבִישָׁלוֹם); a son of David and Maacah;  half-brother of: Amnon, Chileab, Adonijah, Shephatiah, Ithream, Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon, Ibhar, Elishua, Nepheg, Japhia, Elishama, Eliada, Eliphelet, Tamar, Elpelet, Nogah and Jerimoth;  father of Ta
H0053.f: David's rebellious son who tried to usurp the throne.
H0053.meaning: Hitchcock: father of peace. BehindTheName: From Hebrew אַבְשָׁלוֹם (ʾAvshalom) meaning 'father is peace', from אָב (ʾav) 'father' and שָׁלוֹם (shalom) 'peace'.
H0053.significance: David's son. Name (or (shortened) אַבְשָׁלוֹם ; from H1 (אָב) and H7965 (שָׁלוֹם); father...). Name in lineage or family context.

G0883.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0883.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at 1Co.16.17; only referred to as Achaicus (Ἀχαϊκός).
G0883.f: A Corinthian Christian who visited Paul.
G0883.meaning: Hitchcock: a native of Achaia; sorrowing; sad
G0883.significance: man living at the time of the new testament. Name meaning: from G882 (Ἀχαΐα) an Achaian; Achaicus, a Christian

H5912.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jos.7.1; referred to as Achan (עָכָן), or Achan (KJV= Achar)  (עָכָר); a son of Carmi.
H5912.f: An Israelite who stole devoted things, causing Israel's defeat.
H5912.meaning: From עָכַר (akar), trouble. Achan = troubler. Took devoted things at Jericho (Josh 7). Hitchcock: or Achar, he that troubleth. BehindTheName: Possibly from Hebrew עֲכָר (ʿaḵar) meaning 'trouble'.
H5912.significance: One man’s sin brought defeat at Ai; “troubler of Israel” (Josh 7:25). Name and deed identical—his name is his crime. Type of corporate consequence of hidden sin.

H5907.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5907.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.22.12; referred to as Achbor (עַכְבּוֹר), or Abdon (עַבְדּוֹן); a son of Micaiah;  father of Elnathan.
H5907.f: Official during the reign of King Josiah
H5907.significance: Son of Micaiah. Name (probably for H5909 (עַכְבָּר) Akbor, the name of an Idumaean and of tw...). Name in lineage or family context.

G0885.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
G0885.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Mat.1.14; only referred to as Achim (Ἀχείμ); a son of Zadok;  father of Eliud.
G0885.f: Ancestor of Jesus, son of Zadok (or 'Sadoc')
G0885.significance: Son of Zadok. Name (probably of Hebrew origin (compare H03137) Achim, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0397.d: King living at the time of United Monarchy
H0397.s: A king in Philistia living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.21.10; referred to as Achish (אָכִישׁ), or Abimelech (NIV= Abimelek)  (אֲבִימֶ֫לֶךְ); a son of Maoch.
H0397.f: Philistine king of Gath, gave refuge to David
H0397.meaning: Philistine name; possibly “angry” or “only.” Achish = king of Gath (1 Sam 21, 27–29). Hitchcock: thus it is; how is this
H0397.significance: David’s refuge when fleeing Saul; feigned madness before him. Achish trusted David; Philistine lords did not (1 Sam 29). Gentile king who unwittingly shelters the anointed.

H5915.d: Woman living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5915.s: A woman from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.49; only referred to as Achsah (עַכְסָה);  daughter of Caleb; a sister of Hur, Jesher, Shobab, Ardon, Mesha, Haran, Moza, Gazez, Sheber, Tirhanah, Regem(?), Jotham(?), Geshan(?), Pelet(?), Ephah(?), Shaaph(?), Shaaph and Sheva.
H5915.f: Daughter of Caleb, the son of Hur
H5915.meaning: Hitchcock: adorned; bursting the veil. BehindTheName: Means 'anklet, bangle' in Hebrew.
H5915.significance: Minor figure; name: feminine of H5914 (עֶכֶס); anklet Aksah, an Israelitess

H5711.d: Woman living at the time before the Flood
H5711.s: A woman living at the time before the Flood, first mentioned at Gen.26.34; referred to as Adah (עָדָה), or Basemath (KJV= Bashemath)  (בָּֽשְׂמַת); a daughter of Elon; wife of Esau;  mother of Eliphaz.
H5711.f: Hittite wife of Esau; mother of Eliphaz
H5711.meaning: From עָדָה (adah), adorn, pass. Adah = ornament. Wife of Lamech (Gen 4:19–20), mother of Jabal and Jubal. Hitchcock: an assembly. BehindTheName: Means 'adornment, ornament' in Hebrew.
H5711.significance: In the line of Cain; her sons found tent-dwelling and music (Gen 4:20–21). “Ornament” in a cursed line—culture and creativity apart from the covenant.

H5718.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5718.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.21; only referred to as Adaiah (עֲדָיָ֫הוּ);  son of Shimei; a brother of Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi, Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel, Beraiah and Shimrath.
H5718.meaning: Hitchcock: the witness of the Lord
H5718.significance: Minor figure; name: or עֲדָיָהוּ; from H5710 (עָדָה) and H3050 (יָהּ); Jah has adorned Adajah, the name of eight...

H0118.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H0118.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Est.9.8; only referred to as Adalia (אֲדַלְיָא);  son of Haman; a brother of Parshandatha, Dalphon, Aspatha, Poratha, Aridatha, Parmashta, Arisai, Aridai and Vaizatha.
H0118.f: Son of Haman, enemy of the Jews
H0118.meaning: of Persian derivation Adalja, a son of Haman
H0118.significance: Minor figure; name: of Persian derivation Adalja, a son of Haman

H0121.d: Man living at the time before the Flood
H0121.s: A man living at the time before the Flood, first mentioned at Gen.2.19; referred to as Adam (אָדָם), or Adam or "man" or "mankind" (KJV= Adam)  (הָאָדָם), or Adam (Ἀδάμ);  husband of Eve;  father of Cain, Abel and Seth.
H0121.meaning: Hebrew אָדָם (adam); from אֲדָמָה (adamah), ground. Adam = man, from the dust (Gen 2:7). Hitchcock: earthy; red. BehindTheName: Hebrew word for 'man', possibly from אדם (ʾaḏam) 'to be red' (ruddy skin) or Akkadian adamu 'to make'.
H0121.significance: First man; federal head of humanity. Type of Christ as head (Rom 5; 1 Cor 15:45–49): first Adam brought death, last Adam life. Name ties humanity to the ground and to the promise.

H0110.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0110.s: A man of the Arabs living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.25.13; only referred to as Adbeel (אַדְבְּאֵל);  son of Ishmael; a brother of Nebaioth, Kedar, Mibsam, Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, Kedemah and Mahalath.
H0110.f: Son of Ishmael, grandson of Abraham
H0110.meaning: Hitchcock: vapor, or cloud of God
H0110.significance: Son of Ishmael. Name (probably from H109 (אָדַב) (in the sense of chastisement) and H410 (אֵ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0146.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0146.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.3; only referred to as Addar (אַדָּר);  son of Bela; a brother of Ard, Naaman, Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, Iri, Gera, Abihud, Abishua and Ahoah.
H0146.meaning: intensive from H142 (אָדַר); ample Addar, a place in Palestine; also an Israelite
H0146.significance: Minor figure; name: intensive from H142 (אָדַר); ample Addar, a place in Palestine; also an Israelite

G0078.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
G0078.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Luk.3.28; only referred to as Addi (Ἀδδί); a son of Cosam;  father of Melchi.
G0078.significance: Son of Cosam. Name (probably of Hebrew origin (compare H05716) Addi, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H5717.d: Priest living at the time of Exile and Return
H5717.s: A priest from the tribe of Levi  living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at 1Ch.9.12; referred to as Adiel (עֲדִיאֵל), or Azarel (KJV= Azareel)  (עֲזַרְאֵל); a son of Jahzerah;  father of Maasai.
H5717.f: A priest in Jerusalem during Nehemiah's time
H5717.meaning: Hitchcock: the witness of the Lord
H5717.significance: Returned priest. Name (from H5716 (עֲדִי) and H410 (אֵל); ornament of God Adiel, the name of ...). Name fits cultic or priestly role.

H5720.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H5720.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.15; only referred to as Adin (עָדִין).
H5720.f: Jewish exile who returned to Jerusalem with Zerubbabel
H5720.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: the same as H5719 (עָדִין) Adin, the name of two Israelites

H5721.d: Warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5721.s: A warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.11.42; only referred to as Adina (עֲדִינָא); a son of Shiza.
H5721.f: One of David's mighty men, a Reubenite leader
H5721.meaning: from H5719 (עָדִין); effeminacy Adina, an Israelite
H5721.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5719 (עָדִין); effeminacy Adina, an Israelite

H5722.d: Warrior living at the time of United Monarchy
H5722.s: A warrior living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Sa.23.8; only referred to as Adino (עֲדִינוֹ).
H5722.f: Alternate name or description of Josheb-Basshebeth
H5722.meaning: probably from H5719 (עָדִין) in the original sense of slender (i.e. a spear) his spear
H5722.significance: Minor figure; name: probably from H5719 (עָדִין) in the original sense of slender (i.e. a spear) his spear

H5724.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5724.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.27.29; only referred to as Adlai (עַדְלָ֑י);  father of Shaphat.
H5724.f: Overseer of King David's herds in the valleys
H5724.significance: Father of Shaphat. Name (probably from an unused root of uncertain meaning Adlai, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0133.d: Prince living at the time of Exile and Return
H0133.s: A prince of Persia living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Est.1.14; only referred to as Admatha (אַדְמָתָא).
H0133.f: One of the seven princes of Persia and Media
H0133.meaning: Hitchcock: a cloud of death; a mortal vapor
H0133.significance: Minor figure; name: probably of Persian derivation Admatha, a Persian nobleman

H5733.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H5733.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Ezr.10.30; only referred to as Adna (עַדְנָא).
H5733.f: Israelite who married a foreign woman during the exile
H5733.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5727 (עָדַן); pleasure Adna, the name of two Israelites

H5734.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5734.s: A warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ch.17.14; only referred to as Adnah (עַדְנָה).
H5734.f: Commander of 300,000 troops under King Jehoshaphat
H5734.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5727 (עָדַן); pleasure Adnah, the name of two Israelites

H0137.s: A king living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jdg.1.5; only referred to as Adoni-bezek (אֲדֹנִי־בֶ֫זֶק).
H0137.f: Canaanite king captured and mutilated by Judah
H0137.meaning: From אָדוֹן + בֶּזֶק (bezeq), lightning or scatter. Adoni-bezek = lord of Bezek. Canaanite king (Judg 1:5–7). Hitchcock: the lightning of the Lord; the Lord of lightning
H0137.significance: Had cut off thumbs and big toes of 70 kings; same done to him—“as I did, so God has repaid me” (Judg 1:7). Type of lex talionis and of Gentile acknowledgment of divine justice.

H0138.d: David's son living at the time of United Monarchy
H0138.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.3.4; only referred to as Adonijah (אֲדֹנִיָּ֫הוּ); a son of David and Haggith;  half-brother of: Amnon, Chileab, Absalom, Shephatiah, Ithream, Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon, Ibhar, Elishua, Nepheg, Japhia, Elishama, Eliada, Eliphelet, Tamar, Elpelet, Nogah and Jerimoth.
H0138.f: Son of David who attempted to seize the throne
H0138.meaning: From אָדוֹן (adon), lord, + יָהּ. Adonijah = my lord is Yah. Fourth son of David (2 Sam 3:4). Hitchcock: the Lord is my master. BehindTheName: Means 'my lord is Yahweh' in Hebrew, from אָדוֹן (ʾaḏon) 'lord' and יָהּ (yah) referring to God.
H0138.significance: Sought the kingdom while David lived (1 Ki 1:5); later requested Abishag and was put to death (1 Ki 2:25). Name (Yah is lord) vs. acting as his own lord.

H0140.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H0140.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.13; only referred to as Adonikam (אֲדֹנִיקָם).
H0140.f: Jewish exile whose descendants returned to Jerusalem
H0140.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: from H113 (אָדוֹן) and H6965 (קוּם); lord of rising (i.e. high) Adonik...

H0139.s: A king living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jos.10.1; only referred to as Adoni-zedek (אֲדֹנִי־צֶ֫דֶק).
H0139.f: King of Jerusalem who fought against Joshua
H0139.meaning: From אָדוֹן + צֶדֶק (tzedek), righteousness. Adoni-zedek = lord of righteousness. King of Jerusalem (Josh 10:1). Hitchcock: justice of the Lord; lord of justice
H0139.significance: Led coalition against Gibeon; sun and moon “stand” at Joshua’s word (Josh 10:12–14). Canaanite “lord of righteousness” defeated by the true King’s captain.

H0151.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0151.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.20.24; referred to as Adoram (אֲדֹרָם), or Adoniram (אֲדֹנִירָם), or Hadoram (הֲדֹרָם); a son of Abda.
H0151.significance: Son of Abda. Name (contracted for H141 (אֲדֹנִירָם) Adoram (or Adoniram), an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0152.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0152.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.19.37; only referred to as Adrammelech (אַדְרַמֶּ֫לֶךְ);  son of Sennacherib; a brother of Sharezer and Esarhaddon.
H0152.f: Son of Sennacherib who murdered his father
H0152.meaning: From אָדְרַמֶּלֶךְ (Adrammelek); possibly “Adad is king” (Assyrian theophoric). Son of Sennacherib (2 Ki 19:37). Hitchcock: the cloak, glory, grandeur or power of the king
H0152.significance: With Sharezer, killed Sennacherib in the temple of Nisroch. Patricide after Assyria’s defeat; idol temple as scene of murder—fitting end for the house that defied the living God.

H5741.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H5741.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.18.19; only referred to as Adriel (עַדְרִיאֵל); a son of Barzillai; husband of Merab.
H5741.meaning: Hitchcock: the flock of God. BehindTheName: Means 'flock of God' in Hebrew, from עֵדֶר (ʿeḏer) 'flock' and אֵל (ʾel) 'God'.
H5741.significance: Saul's family. Name (from H5739 (עֵדֶר) and H410 (אֵל); flock of God Adriel, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

G0132.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0132.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.9.33; only referred to as Aeneas (Αἰνέας).
G0132.f: Paralyzed man in Lydda healed by Peter
G0132.meaning: Greek Αἰνέας (Aineas); from Greek αἰνέω (praise). Aeneas = praised. Paralytic at Lydda (Acts 9:33–34). Hitchcock: praised; praiseworthy
G0132.significance: Healed by Peter—“Jesus Christ heals you.” Name (praised) fits the response: Lydda and Sharon turned to the Lord (Acts 9:35).

G0013.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0013.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.11.28; only referred to as Agabus (Ἄγαβος).
G0013.f: Prophet who predicted famine and Paul's arrest
G0013.meaning: From Hebrew or Aramaic; possibly “locust” or “loved.” Agabus = prophet from Jerusalem (Acts 11:28, 21:10). Hitchcock: a locust; the father's joy or feast. BehindTheName: Greek form of Hagab.
G0013.significance: Prophesied famine (Acts 11:28) and Paul’s binding (Acts 21:10–11). Name less significant than function: prophet who speaks the Lord’s word to the church.

H0090.d: King living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0090.s: A king of Amalakites living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.24.7; only referred to as Agag (אֲגָג).
H0090.f: King mentioned in Balaam's oracle about Israel
H0090.meaning: From אֲגָג (Agag); Amalekite king (1 Sam 15). Name may mean “flame” or be a title. Hitchcock: roof; upper floor
H0090.significance: Saul spared him against the ban (1 Sam 15:9); Samuel killed him (1 Sam 15:33). Type of incomplete obedience—Saul’s mercy becomes his downfall. Amalek = enemy of the throne (Ex 17:16).

H0089.d: Warrior living at the time of United Monarchy
H0089.s: A warrior living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Sa.23.11; only referred to as Agee (אָגֵא);  father of Shammah.
H0089.f: Father of Shammah, one of David's mighty men
H0089.significance: Father of Shammah. Name (of uncertain derivation (compare H90 (אֲגַג)) Age, an Israelite). Name fits martial or military role.

G0067.d: Tetrarch living at the time of the New Testament
G0067.s: Tetrarch Herod Agrippa II over Judea living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.25.13; referred to as Agrippa (KJV, NIV= Agrippa) (Ἀγρίππας); a son of: Tetrarch Herod Agrippa I Male.
G0067.f: Tetrarch who heard Paul's defense in Caesarea
G0067.meaning: Greek Ἀγρίππας (Agrippas); Latin Agrippa, from “born with difficulty.” Herod Agrippa II (Acts 25–26). Hitchcock: one who causes great pain at his birth
G0067.significance: Hears Paul’s defense; “almost persuaded” (Acts 26:28). Judge who recognizes Paul’s innocence but does not free him. Name (difficult birth) and his dynasty’s troubled relation to the truth.

H0094.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0094.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at Pro.30.1; only referred to as Agur (אָגוּר); a son of Jakeh.
H0094.f: Author of Proverbs 30, son of Jakeh
H0094.significance: Minor figure; name: passive participle of H103 (אָגַר); gathered (i.e. received among the sages) Agur, a fanciful...

H0256.d: King living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0256.s: A king of Northern Israel, living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ki.16.28; only referred to as Ahab (אַחְאָב); a son of Omri; husband of Jezebel;  father of Joash, Ahaziah, Joram, Athaliah.
H0256.f: Wicked king of Israel; husband of Jezebel
H0256.meaning: From אָח (ach), brother, + אָב (av), father. Ahab = brother (or uncle) of father. King of Israel (1 Ki 16:29). Hitchcock: uncle, or father's brother. BehindTheName: Means 'uncle' in Hebrew, from אָח (ʾaḥ) 'brother' and אָב (ʾav) 'father'.
H0256.significance: Did more evil than all before him (1 Ki 16:30); married Jezebel, served Baal. Elijah’s antagonist. Name (father’s brother) in a dynasty that broke the brotherhood of Israel.

H0316.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0316.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.8; only referred to as Aharhel (אֲחַרְחֵל); a son of Harum.
H0316.f: Son of Harum, from the tribe of Judah
H0316.meaning: From אָח (ach), brother, + הָר (har), mountain, or from a root for following. Aharhel = brother of the mountain. In Judah’s genealogy (1 Chr 4:8). Hitchcock: another host; the last sorrow; a brother's sheep
H0316.significance: Minor genealogical figure; name may point to kinship or place. In the line of Judah, the royal tribe.

H0308.d: Warrior living at the time of United Monarchy
H0308.s: A warrior living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Sa.23.34; only referred to as Ahasbai (אֲחַסְבַּי);  father of Eliphelet.
H0308.f: Father of Eliphelet, one of David's mighty men
H0308.meaning: Hitchcock: trusting in me; a grown-up brother
H0308.significance: Father of warrior. Name (of uncertain derivation Achasbai, an Israelite). Name fits martial or military role.

H0325.d: Emperor Xerxes I, living at the time of Exile and Return
H0325.s: An emperor of Persia living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.4.6; referred to as Ahasuerus (=Qere. Ketiv= Ahaserus, NIV= Xerxes) (אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ); a son of Darius; husband of Vashti;  father of Artaxerxes and Darius; .
H0325.f: Persian Emperor (probably Xerxes I); husband of Esther
H0325.meaning: Hebrew form of Old Persian Khshayarsha (Xerxes). Ahasuerus = ruler. Emperor in Esther (Est 1:1). Hitchcock: prince; head; chief. BehindTheName: From Hebrew אֲחַשְׁוֵרוֹשׁ, from Old Persian Xšayarša (Xerxes).
H0325.significance: King who does not know the true King; his decrees threaten the Jews, but the story turns on providence and Esther. Type of the Gentile ruler used for God’s people’s deliverance.

H0271.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0271.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.8.35; only referred to as Ahaz (אָחָז);  son of Micah; a brother of Pithon, Melech and Tarea;  father of Jehoaddah.
H0271.meaning: From אָחַז (achaz), grasp, possess. Ahaz = he has grasped. King of Judah (2 Ki 16); made an altar like Damascus’s. Hitchcock: one that takes or possesses
H0271.significance: Did not do right (2 Ki 16:2); closed the house, sought Assyria. Isaiah’s sign of Immanuel is in his reign (Isa 7). Name (grasp) as grasping the wrong help.

H0274.d: King living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0274.s: A king of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.8.24; referred to as Ahaziah (אֲחַזְיָ֫הוּ), or Ahaziah (KJV= Azariah)  (עֲזַרְיָ֫הוּ), or Ahaziah (KJV= Jehoahaz) or Jehoahaz (יְהוֹאָחָז);  son of Jehoram and Athaliah; a brother of Jehosheba; husband of Zibiah;  father of Joash.
H0274.meaning: From אָחַז + יָהּ. Ahaziah = Yah has grasped. Two kings: Israel (1 Ki 22:51) and Judah (2 Ki 8:25). Hitchcock: seizure; vision of the Lord
H0274.significance: Ahaziah of Israel walked in Ahab’s ways; died from fall, consulted Baal-zebub (2 Ki 1). Ahaziah of Judah walked in Ahab’s house (2 Ki 8:27). Both names confess Yah, both lives contradict.

H0257.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0257.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.29; only referred to as Ahban (אַחְבָן);  son of Abishur and Abihail; a brother of Molid.
H0257.f: Son of Abishur, from the tribe of Judah
H0257.meaning: from H251 (אָח) and H995 (בִּין); brother (i.e. possessor) of understanding Achban, an Israelite
H0257.significance: Minor figure; name: from H251 (אָח) and H995 (בִּין); brother (i.e. possessor) of understanding Achban, an Israelite

H0313.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0313.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.12; only referred to as Aher (אַחֵר);  father of Hushim.
H0313.f: Son of Shemer, from the tribe of Asher
H0313.meaning: the same as H312 (אַחֵר) Acher, an Israelite
H0313.significance: Father of Hushim. Name (the same as H312 (אַחֵר) Acher, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0277.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0277.s: A man from the tribe of Asher living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.34; only referred to as Ahi (אֲחִי);  son of Shomer; a brother of Rohgah, Jehubbah and Aram.
H0277.f: Son of Shomer, from the tribe of Asher
H0277.significance: Minor figure; name: from H251 (אָח); brotherly Achi, the name of two Israelites

H0281.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0281.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.25; only referred to as Ahijah (אֲחִיָּ֫הוּ);  son of Jerahmeel; a brother of Ram, Bunah, Oren, Ozem and Onam.
H0281.f: Son of Jerahmeel, from the tribe of Judah
H0281.significance: Minor figure; name: or (prolonged) אֲחִיָּהוּ ; from H251 (אָח) and H3050 (יָהּ); brother (i.e. worshipper) of Jah...

H0279.d: Warrior living at the time of United Monarchy
H0279.s: A warrior living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.23.33; only referred to as Ahiam (אֲחִיאָם); a son of Sharar.
H0279.f: One of David's mighty men, son of Sharar
H0279.meaning: Hitchcock: mother's brother; brother of a nation
H0279.significance: David's warrior. Name (from H251 (אָח) and H517 (אֵם); brother of the mother (i.e. uncle) Ach...). Name fits martial or military role.

H0291.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0291.s: A man from the tribe of Manasseh living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.19; only referred to as Ahian (אַחְיָן);  son of Shemida; a brother of Shechem, Likhi and Aniam.
H0291.f: Son of Shemidah, from the tribe of Manasseh
H0291.significance: Minor figure; name: from H251 (אָח); brotherly Achjan, an Israelite

H0295.d: Warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0295.s: A warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.12.3; only referred to as Ahiezer (אֲחִיעֶ֫זֶר);  son of Shemaah; a brother of Joash.
H0295.f: Benjamite warrior who joined David at Ziklag
H0295.significance: Minor figure; name: from H251 (אָח) and H5828 (עֵזֶר); brother of help Achiezer, the name of two Israelites

H0284.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living before Israel's Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.7; only referred to as Ahihud (אֲחִיחֻד);  son of Ehud; a brother of Naaman, Ahijah, Gera and Uzza.
H0284.f: Son of Ehud, from the tribe of Benjamin
H0284.meaning: Hitchcock: brother of vanity, or of darkness, or of joy, or of praise; witty brother
H0284.significance: Minor figure; name: from H251 (אָח) and H2330 (חוּד); brother of a riddle (i.e. mysterious) Achichud, an Israelite

H0282.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0282.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.34.27; only referred to as Ahihud (אֲחִיהוּד); a son of Shelomi.
H0282.f: Leader from the tribe of Asher for land allocation
H0282.meaning: Hitchcock: brother of vanity, or of darkness, or of joy, or of praise; witty brother
H0282.significance: Minor figure; name: from H251 (אָח) and H1935 (הוֹד); brother (i.e. possessor) of renown Achihud, an Israelite

H0296.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0296.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.22.12; only referred to as Ahikam (אֲחִיקָם);  son of Shaphan; a brother of Elasah and Gemariah;  father of Gedaliah.
H0296.f: Son of Shaphan, protected Jeremiah from death
H0296.meaning: Hitchcock: a brother who raises up or avenges
H0296.significance: Son of Shaphan. Name (from H251 (אָח) and H6965 (קוּם); brother of rising (i.e. high) Achika...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0286.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0286.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.8.16; only referred to as Ahilud (אֲחִילוּד);  father of Jehoshaphat, Baana.
H0286.f: Father of Jehoshaphat and Baana, officials under David and Solomon
H0286.meaning: Hitchcock: a brother born, or begotten
H0286.significance: Father of Jehoshaphat. Name (from H251 (אָח) and H3205 (יָלַד); brother of one born Achilud, an Isr...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0290.d: Priest living at the time of United Monarchy
H0290.s: A priest from the tribe of Levi living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.15.27; only referred to as Ahimaaz (אֲחִימַ֫עַץ); a son of Zadok;  father of Azariah.
H0290.f: Son of Zadok the priest, a messenger for David
H0290.meaning: Hitchcock: a brother of the council
H0290.significance: A priest. Name (from H251 (אָח) and the equivalent of H4619 (מַעַץ); brother of anger ...). Name fits cultic or priestly role.

H0289.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0289.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.13.22; only referred to as Ahiman (אֲחִימַן);  son of Anak; a brother of Sheshai and Talmai.
H0289.f: One of the giant descendants of Anak in Hebron
H0289.meaning: Hitchcock: brother of the right hand
H0289.significance: Son of Anak. Name (or אֲחִימָן ; from H251 (אָח) and H4480 (מִן); brother of a portion (i...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0288.d: Priest living at the time of United Monarchy
H0288.s: A priest living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.8.17;  son of Abiathar (H0054);  brother of Jonathan (H3083I); called Ahimelech (אֲחִימֶ֫לֶךְ); or Ahimelech (KJV= Abimelech; NIV= Ahimelek)  (אֲבִימֶ֫לֶךְ)
H0288.f: Son of Abiathar, a priest during David's reign
H0288.meaning: From אָח (ach) + מֶלֶךְ (melek). Ahimelech = brother of the king. Priest at Nob (1 Sam 21:1). Hitchcock: my brother is a king; my king's brother
H0288.significance: Gave David showbread and Goliath's sword; Saul had him and the priests of Nob killed (1 Sam 22). Name (brother of the king) as the priest who served the anointed—and paid with his life.

H0287.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0287.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.6.25; referred to as Ahimoth (אֲחִימוֹת), or Mahath (מַ֫חַת); a son of Amasai;  father of Elkanah.
H0287.f: Levite descendant of Kohath, son of Elkanah
H0287.significance: Son of Amasai. Name (from H251 (אָח) and H4191 (מוּת); brother of death Achimoth, an Israel...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H0292.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0292.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.4.14; only referred to as Ahinadab (אֲחִינָדָב); a son of Iddo.
H0292.f: Son of Iddo, a governor under Solomon
H0292.meaning: Hitchcock: a willing brother; brother of a vow
H0292.significance: Minor figure; name: from H251 (אָח) and H5068 (נָדַב); brother of liberality Achinadab, an Israelite

H0293.d: Woman living at the time of United Monarchy
H0293.s: A woman living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Sa.14.50; only referred to as Ahinoam (אֲחִינֹ֫עַם); a daughter of Ahimaaz; wife of Saul;  mother of Jonathan, Abinadab, Malchi-shua, Merab, Ish-bosheth and Michal.
H0293.f: Wife of King Saul, daughter of Ahimaaz
H0293.meaning: Hitchcock: beauty of the brother; brother of motion. BehindTheName: Means 'my brother is pleasant' in Hebrew, from אָח (ʾaḥ) 'brother' and נָעַם (naʿam) 'to be pleasant'.
H0293.significance: Minor figure; name: from H251 (אָח) and H5278 (נֹעַם); brother of pleasantness Achinoam, the name of two Israelitesses

H0283.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0283.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.8.31; only referred to as Ahio (אַחְיוֹ);  son of Abiel and Maacah; a brother of Kish, Ner, Abdon, Zur, Baal, Nadab, Gedor, Zecher and Mikloth.
H0283.significance: Son of Abiel. Name (prolonged from H251 (אָח); brotherly Achio, the name of three Israelit...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0299.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0299.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.1.15; only referred to as Ahira (אֲחִירַע); a son of Enan.
H0299.f: Leader of the tribe of Naphtali during the Exodus
H0299.meaning: Hitchcock: brother of iniquity; brother of the shepherd
H0299.significance: Son of Enan. Name (from H251 (אָח) and H7451 (רַע); brother of wrong Achira, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0297.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0297.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.21; referred to as Ahiram (אֲחִירָם), or Ahiramite (אֲחִירָמִי), or Aharah (אַחְרַח), or Ehi (אֵחִי);  son of Benjamin; a brother of Bela, Becher, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, Ard and Jediael.
H0297.meaning: Hitchcock: brother of craft, or of protection
H0297.significance: man living at the time of egypt and wilderness. Name (from H251 (אָח) and H7311 (רוּם); brother of height (i.e. high) Achira...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0294.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0294.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Exo.31.6; only referred to as Ahisamach (אֲחִיסָמָךְ);  father of Oholiab.
H0294.f: Father of Oholiab, a skilled artisan for the tabernacle
H0294.significance: Father of Oholiab. Name (from H251 (אָח) and H5564 (סָמַךְ); brother of support Achisamak, an I...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0300.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0300.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.10; only referred to as Ahishahar (אֲחִישָׁ֑חַר);  son of Bilhan; a brother of Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan and Tarshish.
H0300.meaning: from H251 (אָח) and H7837 (שַׁחַר); brother of (the) dawn Achishachar, an Israelite
H0300.significance: Minor figure; name: from H251 (אָח) and H7837 (שַׁחַר); brother of (the) dawn Achishachar, an Israelite

H0301.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0301.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.4.6; only referred to as Ahishar (אֲחִישָׁר).
H0301.meaning: Hitchcock: brother of a prince; brother of a song
H0301.significance: Minor figure; name: from H251 (אָח) and H7891 (שִׁיר); brother of (the) singer Achishar, an Israelite

H0302.d: David's compatriot living at the time of United Monarchy
H0302.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.15.12; only referred to as Ahithophel (אֲחִיתֹ֫פֶל);  father of Eliam.
H0302.f: David's counselor who joined Absalom's rebellion, later committed suicide
H0302.meaning: From אָח (ach) + תֹּפֶל (tophel), folly. Ahithophel = brother of folly. David's counselor (2 Sam 15:12). Hitchcock: brother of ruin or folly
H0302.significance: Counselor who joined Absalom's rebellion; his advice was like the word of God (2 Sam 16:23). When rejected he hanged himself (2 Sam 17:23). Name (brother of folly) as wisdom turned to folly—type of the counselor who betrays.

H0285.d: High Priest living at the time of United Monarchy
H0285.s: A High Priest living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.14.3; only referred to as Ahitub (אֲחִיטוּב);  son of Phinehas; a brother of Ichabod;  father of Ahimelech.
H0285.f: Father of Ahimelech, High Priest at Nob killed by Saul
H0285.meaning: From אָח (ach) + טוּב (tuv), good. Ahitub = brother of goodness. High priest; father of Ahimelech (1 Sam 14:3).
H0285.significance: Priestly line of Eli; grandfather of Abiathar. Name (brother of goodness) in a house that will be cut off (1 Sam 2:31).

H0304.d: Woman living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0304.s: A woman from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.31; only referred to as Ahlai (אַחְלָ֑י); a daughter of Sheshan; wife of Jarha;  mother of Attai.
H0304.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H305 (אַחֲלַי); wishful Achlai, the name of an Israelitess and of an Israelite

H0265.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0265.s: A warrior from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at 2Sa.23.9; referred to as Ahoah (אֲחוֹחַ), or Ahohi (KJV, NIV= Ahohite) or Ahohite (אֲחוֹחִי);  son of Bela; a brother of Ard, Naaman, Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, Iri, Addar, Gera, Abihud and Abishua.
H0265.meaning: Hitchcock: a live brother; my thorn or thistle
H0265.significance: David's warrior. Name (by reduplication from H251 (אָח); brotherly Achoach, an Israelite). Name fits martial or military role.

H0267.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0267.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.2; only referred to as Ahumai (אֲחוּמַי);  son of Jahath; a brother of Lahad.
H0267.meaning: Hitchcock: a meadow of waters; a brother of waters
H0267.significance: Minor figure; name: perhaps from H251 (אָח) and H4325 (מַיִם); brother (i.e. neighbour) of water Achumai, an Israelite

H0275.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0275.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.6; only referred to as Ahuzzam (אֲחֻזָּם);  son of Ashhur and Naarah; a brother of Hepher, Temeni and Haahashtari;  half-brother of: Zereth, Izhar, Ethnan and Koz.
H0275.f: Son of Ashhur and Naarah, a Judahite
H0275.meaning: from H270 (אָחַז); seizure Achuzzam, an Israelite
H0275.significance: Minor figure; name: from H270 (אָחַז); seizure Achuzzam, an Israelite

H0276.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0276.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, only mentioned at Gen.26.26; only referred to as Ahuzzath (אֲחֻזַּת).
H0276.f: Friend and advisor of Abimelech, Philistine king of Gerar
H0276.meaning: a variation of H272 (אֲחֻזָּה); possession Achuzzath, a Philistine
H0276.significance: Minor figure; name: a variation of H272 (אֲחֻזָּה); possession Achuzzath, a Philistine

H0345.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0345.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.24; only referred to as Aiah (אַיָּה);  son of Zibeon; a brother of Anah.
H0345.f: Son of Zibeon the Hivite, brother of Anah
H0345.meaning: Hitchcock: vulture, raven; an isle; alas, where is it?
H0345.significance: Son of Zibeon. Name (the same as H344 (אַיָּה) Ajah, the name of two Israelites). Name in lineage or family context.

H3292.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H3292.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.27; referred to as Akan (יַעֲקָן), or Akan (עֲקָן);  son of Ezer; a brother of Bilhan and Zaavan.
H3292.f: Son of Ezer, a Horite chief in Seir
H3292.meaning: from the same as H6130 (עָקָן) Jaakan, an Idumaean
H3292.significance: Son of Ezer. Name (from the same as H6130 (עָקָן) Jaakan, an Idumaean). Name in lineage or family context.

H6126.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H6126.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.3.24; only referred to as Akkub (עַקּוּב);  son of Elioenai; a brother of Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Johanan, Delaiah and Anani.
H6126.f: Descendant of King Jehoiachin of Judah
H6126.significance: Minor figure; name: from H6117 (עָקַב); insidious Akkub, the name of five Israelites

H5964.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5964.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.8; only referred to as Alemeth (עָלֶ֫מֶת);  son of Becher; a brother of Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah and Anathoth.
H5964.meaning: Hitchcock: hiding; youth; worlds; upon the dead
H5964.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5956 (עָלַם); a covering Alemeth, the name of a place in Palestine and of two Israelites

G0223.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0223.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Mrk.15.21; only referred to as Alexander (Ἀλέξανδρος);  son of Simon; a brother of Rufus.
G0223.f: Son of Simon who carried the cross
G0223.meaning: Greek Ἀλέξανδρος (Alexandros); from ἀλέξω (ward off) + ἀνήρ (man). Alexander = defender of men. Several in NT. Hitchcock: one who assists men. BehindTheName: From Greek Ἀλέξανδρος (Alexandros) meaning 'defending men', from ἀλέξω (alexo) 'to defend' and ἀνήρ (aner) 'man'.
G0223.significance: One Alexander is a coppersmith who did Paul harm (2 Tim 4:14). Another in Acts 19:33 is pushed forward by Jews. Name (defender) vs. opposition to the gospel.

H0438.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0438.s: A man from the tribe of Simeon(?) living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.37; only referred to as Allon (אַלּוֹן); a son of Jedaiah;  father of Shiphi.
H0438.significance: Son of Jedaiah. Name (the same as H437 (אַלּוֹן) Allon, an Israelite, also a place in Palest...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0486.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0486.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.10.26; only referred to as Almodad (אַלְמוֹדָד);  son of Joktan; a brother of Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah, Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah, Obal, Abimael, Sheba, Ophir, Havilah and Jobab.
H0486.f: Son of Joktan, descendant of Shem
H0486.meaning: From אַלְמוֹדָד (Almodad); possibly “measure” or “God is friend.” Son of Joktan (Gen 10:26). Hitchcock: measure of God
H0486.significance: In the Table of Nations (Gen 10); Joktanite line in Arabia. Name in the genealogy that spreads after Babel—peoples and names without covenant.

G0256.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0256.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Mat.10.3; referred to as Alphaeus (Ἀλφαῖος), or Cleopas (Κλεόπας), or Clopas (KJV= Cleophas) (Κλωπᾶς);  son of Jacob (?); husband of Mary; a brother of: Joseph (?); father of James, Matthew and Joses.
G0256.meaning: Greek Ἀλφαῖος (Alphaios); from Hebrew or Aramaic. Alphaeus = father of James (one of the Twelve) and possibly of Matthew/Levi. BehindTheName: Greek form of a Hebrew name meaning 'exchange'.
G0256.significance: Father of James the son of Alphaeus (Mk 3:18); if same as Clopas, then husband of Mary at the cross (Jn 19:25). Name links to the circle of Jesus’ family and disciples.

H5933.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H5933.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.40; referred to as Alvah or Alvah (=Qere. Ketiv= Aliah, KJV= Aliah) (עַלְוָה).
H5933.meaning: Hitchcock: his rising up; his highness
H5933.significance: From Edom. Name meaning: or עַליָה; the same as H5932 (עַלְוָה) Alvah or Aljah, an Idumaean

H5935.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H5935.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.23; referred to as Alvan (עַלְיָן, עַלְוָן);  son of Shobal; a brother of Manahath, Ebal, Shepho and Onam.
H5935.meaning: or עַלְיָן; from H5927 (עָלָה); lofty Alvan or Aljan, an Idumaean
H5935.significance: Son of Shobal. Name (or עַלְיָן; from H5927 (עָלָה); lofty Alvan or Aljan, an Idumaean). Name in lineage or family context.

H6000.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H6000.s: A man from the tribe of Asher living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.35; only referred to as Amal (עָמָל);  son of Hotham; a brother of Zophah, Imna and Shelesh.
H6000.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H5999 (עָמָל) Amal, an Israelite

H6002.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H6002.s: A man of the Edomites living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.12; only referred to as Amalek (עֲמָלֵק);  son of Eliphaz and Timna; a brother of Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, Kenaz and Korah.
H6002.f: Grandson of Esau, ancestor of the Amalekites
H6002.meaning: From עֲמָלֵק (Amalek); possibly “people that lick” or “dweller in the valley.” Grandson of Esau (Gen 36:12). Hitchcock: a people that licks up
H6002.significance: Amalek attacks Israel at Rephidim (Ex 17:8); “war of YHWH against Amalek from generation to generation” (Ex 17:16). Type of persistent enemy of the throne; Agag (1 Sam 15) is his king.

H0568.d: Levite living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0568.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at 1Ch.23.19; only referred to as Amariah (אֲמַרְיָ֫הוּ);  son of Hebron; a brother of Jeriah, Jahaziel and Jekameam.
H0568.f: Levite, descendant of Hebron, during David's reign
H0568.meaning: From אָמַר (amar), say, + יָהּ. Amariah = Yah has said. Multiple priests and Levites. Hitchcock: the Lord says; the integrity of the Lord. BehindTheName: Means 'Yahweh has said' in Hebrew, from אָמַר (ʾamar) 'to say' and יָהּ (yah) referring to God.
H0568.significance: Priests named Amariah serve in reform (2 Chr 19:11, 31:15). Name (Yah has said) fits the word-bound office—they teach and judge by the law.

H6021.d: Ishmaelite living at the time of United Monarchy
H6021.s: A man of the Ishmaelites living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.17.25; only referred to as Amasa (עֲמָשָׂא); a son of Jether and Abigail.
H6021.f: Military commander, son of Abigail (David's sister), killed by Joab
H6021.meaning: From עָמַס (amas), load, carry. Amasa = burden. Nephew of David; Absalom’s general, then David’s (2 Sam 17:25, 19:13). Hitchcock: sparing the people
H6021.significance: Joab killed him (2 Sam 20:9–10)—rival to Joab. Name (burden) fits his role as commander and his death: he becomes a “burden” removed in the consolidation of power.

H6022.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H6022.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.6.25; only referred to as Amasai (עֲמָשַׂי); a son of Elkanah;  father of Ahimoth.
H6022.significance: Son of Elkanah. Name (from H6006 (עָמַס); burdensome Amasai, the name of three Israelites). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H6007.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H6007.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ch.17.16; only referred to as Amasiah (עֲמַסְיָה); a son of Zichri.
H6007.f: Commander who volunteered for God's service
H6007.meaning: from H6006 (עָמַס) and H3050 (יָהּ); Jah has loaded Amasjah, an Israelite
H6007.significance: Minor figure; name: from H6006 (עָמַס) and H3050 (יָהּ); Jah has loaded Amasjah, an Israelite

H0558.d: King living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0558.s: A king of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.12.21; referred to as Amaziah (KJV= Amaziah)  (אֲמַצְיָ֫הוּ); a son of Joash and Jehoaddan; husband of Jecoliah;  father of Uzziah.
H0558.f: King of Judah, son of Joash
H0558.meaning: Hitchcock: the strength of the Lord. BehindTheName: Means 'Yahweh strengthens' in Hebrew, from אָמֵץ (ʾamets) 'to strengthen' and יָהּ (yah) referring to God.
H0558.significance: King of Judah. Name (or אֲמַצְיָהוּ; from H553 (אָמַץ) and H3050 (יָהּ); strength of Jah Am...). Name in royal or ruling context.

H0532.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H0532.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.57; referred to as Ami (אָמִי), or Amon (אָמוֹן).
H0532.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: an abbreviated form for H526 (אָמוֹן) Ami, an Israelite

H0573.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0573.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.14.25; only referred to as Amittai (אֲמִתַּי);  father of Jonah.
H0573.significance: Father of Jonah. Name (from H571 (אֶמֶת); veracious Amittai, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H5988.d: Levite living at the time of United Monarchy
H5988.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.26.5; only referred to as Ammiel (עַמִּיאֵל);  son of Obed-edom; a brother of Shemaiah, Jehozabad, Joah, Sachar, Nethanel, Issachar and Peullethai.
H5988.meaning: Hitchcock: the people of God. BehindTheName: Means 'God is my kinsman' in Hebrew, from עַם (ʿam) 'people, kinsman' and אֵל (ʾel) 'God'.
H5988.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5971 (עַם) and H410 (אֵל); people of God Ammiel, the name of three or four Israelites

H5989.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5989.s: A man from the tribe of Ephraim living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.1.10; only referred to as Ammihud (עַמִּיהוּד); a son of Ladan;  father of Elishama.
H5989.f: Father of Elishama, leader of Ephraim
H5989.significance: Son of Ladan. Name (from H5971 (עַם) and H1935 (הוֹד); people of splendor Ammihud, the nam...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5992.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5992.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Exo.6.23; referred to as Amminadab (עַמִּינָדָב), or Amminadab (Ἀμιναδάβ); a son of Ram;  father of Elisheba and Nahshon.
H5992.f: Father-in-law of Aaron, ancestor of David
H5992.meaning: from H5971 (עַם) and H5068 (נָדַב); people of liberality Amminadab, the name of four Israelites
H5992.significance: Son of Ram. Name (from H5971 (עַם) and H5068 (נָדַב); people of liberality Amminadab, th...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5993.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H5993.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at Sng.6.12; only referred to as Amminadib (עַמִּי נָדִיב).
H5993.f: Noble mentioned in a love song
H5993.meaning: from H5971 (עַם) and H5081 (נָדִיב); my people (is) liberal Ammi-Nadib, probably an Israelite
H5993.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5971 (עַם) and H5081 (נָדִיב); my people (is) liberal Ammi-Nadib, probably an Israelite

H5996.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5996.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.1.12; only referred to as Ammishaddai (עַמִּישַׁדָּ֑י);  father of Ahiezer.
H5996.f: Father of Ahiezer, leader of Dan
H5996.meaning: Hitchcock: the people of the Almighty; the Almighty is with me
H5996.significance: Father of Ahiezer. Name (from H5971 (עַם) and H7706 (שַׁדַּי); people of (the) Almighty Ammisha...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5990.d: Warrior living at the time of United Monarchy
H5990.s: A warrior living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.27.6; only referred to as Ammizabad (עַמִּיזָבָד); a son of Benaiah.
H5990.f: Son of Benaiah, one of David's mighty men
H5990.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5971 (עַם) and H2064 (זָבַד); people of endowment Ammizabad, an Israelite

H0550.d: David's son living at the time of United Monarchy
H0550.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.3.2; only referred to as Amnon (אַמְנוֹן); a son of David and Ahinoam;  half-brother of: Chileab, Absalom, Adonijah, Shephatiah, Ithream, Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon, Ibhar, Elishua, Nepheg, Japhia, Elishama, Eliada, Eliphelet, Tamar, Elpelet, Nogah and Jerimoth.
H0550.f: David's firstborn son, killed by Absalom
H0550.meaning: Hitchcock: faithful and true; tutor. BehindTheName: Means 'faithful' in Hebrew.
H0550.significance: David's son. Name (or אֲמִינוֹן; from H539 (אָמַן); faithful Amnon (or Aminon), a son of ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5987.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H5987.s: A priest living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Neh.12.7; only referred to as Amok (עָמוֹק).
H5987.f: Priest who returned from Babylonian exile
H5987.significance: Returned priest. Name (from H6009 (עָמַק); deep Amok, an Israelite). Name fits cultic or priestly role.

H0526.d: King living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0526.s: A king of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.21.18; referred to as Amon (אָמוֹן), or Amon (Ἀμών), or Amos (Ἀμώς); a son of Manasseh and Meshullemeth; husband of Jedidah;  father of Josiah.
H0526.significance: King of Judah. Name (the same as H525 (אָמוֹן) Amon, the name of three Israelites). Name in royal or ruling context.

H0567.s: A person from Amor(?), first mentioned at Gen.10.16; only referred to as Amorites (אֱמֹרִי); descended from Canaan along with Sidon, Heth, Jebusites, Girgashites, Hivites, Arkites, Sinites, Arvadites, Zemarites and Hamathites.
H0567.f: Canaanite people group, enemies of Israel
H0567.meaning: probably a patronymic from an unused name derived from H559 (אָמַר) in the sense of publicity,...
H0567.significance: Canaanites. Name meaning: probably a patronymic from an unused name derived from H559 (אָמַר) in...

H5986.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5986.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at Amo.1.1; only referred to as Amos (עָמוֹס).
H5986.f: Prophet from Tekoa who prophesied to Israel
H5986.meaning: From עָמַס (amas), load, carry. Amos = burden. Prophet (Amos 1:1). Hitchcock: loading; weighty. BehindTheName: From Hebrew עָמַס (ʿamas) meaning 'load, burden'.
H5986.significance: Shepherd of Tekoa (Amos 1:1); “the Lord roars from Zion” (Amos 1:2). Name (burden) as the one who bore the burden of the word—judgment and the hope of the booth (Amos 9:11).

G0301.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
G0301.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Luk.3.25; only referred to as Amos (Ἀμώς); a son of Nahum;  father of Mattathias.
G0301.f: Son of Naum in Jesus' genealogy
G0301.meaning: Greek Ἄμως (Amos); from Hebrew Amos. Amos = burden. Prophet (Luke 3:25). Hitchcock: loading; weighty. BehindTheName: From Hebrew עָמַס (ʿamas) meaning 'load, burden'.
G0301.significance: In the genealogy of Jesus (Luke 3:25). Name (burden) in the line that leads to the one who bore the burden of the world.

H0531.d: Isaiah's father living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0531.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.19.2; only referred to as Amoz (אָמוֹץ);  father of Isaiah.
H0531.significance: Isaiah's father. Name meaning: from H553 (אָמַץ); strong Amots, an Israelite

G0291.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0291.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Rom.16.8; only referred to as Ampliatus (Ἀμπλίας).
G0291.f: Believer greeted by Paul in Rome
G0291.meaning: contracted for Latin ampliatus (enlarged) Amplias, a Roman Christian
G0291.significance: Minor figure; name: contracted for Latin ampliatus (enlarged) Amplias, a Roman Christian

H6019.d: Moses' father living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H6019.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Exo.6.18; referred to as Amram (עַמְרָם), or Amramite (עַמְרָמִי);  son of Kohath; a brother of Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel; husband of Jochebed;  father of Moses, Aaron and Miriam.
H6019.f: Father of Moses, Aaron, and Miriam
H6019.meaning: Hitchcock: an exalted people; their sheaves; handfuls of corn. BehindTheName: Means 'exalted nation' in Hebrew, from עַם (ʿam) 'people' and רוּם (rum) 'to exalt'.
H6019.significance: Moses' father. Name (probably from H5971 (עַם) and H7311 (רוּם); high people Amram, the nam...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0569.d: King living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0569.s: A king in Mesopotamia living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.14.1; only referred to as Amraphel (אַמְרָפֶל).
H0569.f: King of Shinar, ally of Chedorlaomer
H0569.meaning: Hitchcock: one that speaks of secrets
H0569.significance: Mesopotamian king. Name (of uncertain (perhaps foreign) derivation Amraphel, a king of Shinar). Name in royal or ruling context.

H0557.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0557.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.6.46; only referred to as Amzi (אַמְצִי); a son of Bani;  father of Hilkiah.
H0557.significance: Son of Bani. Name (from H553 (אָמַץ); strong Amtsi, an Israelite). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H6034.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H6034.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.2; only referred to as Anah (עֲנָה); a son of Zibeon;  father of Oholibamah and Dishon.
H6034.f: Horite, father of Oholibamah, Esau's wife
H6034.significance: Son of Zibeon. Name (probably from H6030 (עָנָה); an answer Anah, the name of two Edomites ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H6043.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H6043.s: A priest living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.8.4; only referred to as Anaiah (עֲנָיָה).
H6043.f: Stood beside Ezra during the reading of the Law
H6043.meaning: from H6030 (עָנָה); Jah has answered Anajah, the name of two Israelites
H6043.significance: Minor figure; name: from H6030 (עָנָה); Jah has answered Anajah, the name of two Israelites

H6061.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H6061.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.13.22; referred to as Anak (עֲנָק), or Anakim (עֲנָקִי); a son of Arba; father of Ahiman, Sheshai and Talmai.
H6061.f: Ancestor of giant people in Canaan
H6061.significance: Son of Arba. Name (the same as H6060 (עָנָק) Anak, a Canaanite). Name in lineage or family context.

H6047.s: People from Anam(?) of the Egyptians, first mentioned at Gen.10.13; only referred to as Anamim (עֲנָמִים); descended from Egypt along with Ludim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim, Pathrusim, Casluhim and Caphtorim.
H6047.f: Descendants of Mizraim, son of Ham
H6047.significance: Early nation. Name meaning: as if plural of some Egyptian word Anamim, a son of Mizraim and his de...

H6048.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H6048.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ki.17.31; only referred to as Anammelech (עֲנַמֶּ֫לֶךְ).
H6048.meaning: Hitchcock: answer; poverty of the king
H6048.significance: Minor figure; name: of foreign origin Anammelek, an Assyrian deity

H6052.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H6052.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.10.26; only referred to as Anan (עָנָן).
H6052.f: Signer of the covenant during Nehemiah's time
