H6052.meaning: the same as H6051 (עָנָן); cloud Anan, an Israelite
H6052.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H6051 (עָנָן); cloud Anan, an Israelite

H6054.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H6054.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.3.24; only referred to as Anani (עֲנָנִי);  son of Elioenai; a brother of Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan and Delaiah.
H6054.significance: Minor figure; name: from H6051 (עָנָן); cloudy Anani, an Israelite

H6055.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H6055.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.3.23; only referred to as Ananiah (עֲנַנְיָה);  father of Maaseiah.
H6055.f: Repairer of the wall in Jerusalem
H6055.meaning: from H6049 (עָנַן) and H3050 (יָהּ); Jah has covered Ananjah, the name of an Israelite and of a...
H6055.significance: Returned builder. Name meaning: from H6049 (עָנַן) and H3050 (יָהּ); Jah has covered Ananjah, the name...

G0367.d: High Priest living at the time of the New Testament
G0367.s: A High Priest living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.23.2; only referred to as Ananias (Ἀνανίας).
G0367.meaning: Greek Ἁνανίας (Ananias); from Hebrew חָנַן (chanan), gracious. Ananias = Yah is gracious. Multiple: disciple in Damascus (Acts 9:10), husband of Sapphira (Acts 5:1). Hitchcock: or Ananiah, the cloud of the Lord. BehindTheName: Greek form of Hananiah.
G0367.significance: Ananias of Damascus: obeyed the Lord and baptized Paul (Acts 9:17). Ananias and Sapphira: lied to the Spirit and fell (Acts 5:5). Same name, opposite fates.

H6067.s: A man living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jdg.3.31; only referred to as Anath (עֲנָת);  father of Shamgar.
H6067.f: Father of Shamgar, a judge of Israel
H6067.meaning: from H6030 (עָנָה); answer Anath, an Israelite
H6067.significance: Father of Shamgar. Name (from H6030 (עָנָה); answer Anath, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H6068.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H6068.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.8; only referred to as Anathoth (עֲנָתוֹת);  son of Becher; a brother of Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah and Alemeth.
H6068.f: Son of Becher, descendant of Benjamin
H6068.meaning: Hitchcock: or Anath, answer; song; poverty
H6068.significance: Minor figure; name: plural of H6067 (עֲנָת) Anathoth, the name of two Israelites, also of a place in Pal

G0406.d: Apostle living at the time of the New Testament
G0406.s: An apostle living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Mat.4.18; only referred to as Andrew (Ἀνδρέας);  son of John; a brother of Peter.
G0406.meaning: Greek Ἀνδρέας (Andreas); from ἀνήρ (aner), man. Andrew = manly. Apostle (Matt 4:18). Hitchcock: a strong man. BehindTheName: From Greek Ἀνδρέας (Andreas), from ἀνδρεῖος (andreios) 'manly', from ἀνήρ (aner) 'man'.
G0406.significance: Brother of Peter; first called with John (John 1:40). Brought Peter to Jesus. Name (manly) as the one who follows and brings others.

G0408.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0408.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Rom.16.7; only referred to as Andronicus (Ἀνδρόνικος).
G0408.f: Fellow prisoner with Paul, outstanding among the apostles
G0408.meaning: Hitchcock: a man excelling others. BehindTheName: From Greek meaning 'victory of a man', from ἀνήρ (aner) 'man' and νίκη (nike) 'victory'.
G0408.significance: Minor figure; name: from G435 (ἀνήρ) and G3534 (νῖκος) man of victory; Andronicos, an Israelite

H6063.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H6063.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.14.13; only referred to as Aner (עָנֵר); a brother of Mamre.
H6063.significance: Brother of Mamre. Name meaning: probably for H5288 (נַעַר) Aner, a Amorite, also a place in Palestine

H0593.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0593.s: A man from the tribe of Manasseh living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.19; only referred to as Aniam (אֲנִיעָם);  son of Shemida; a brother of Ahian, Shechem and Likhi.
H0593.f: Son of Shemida, descendant of Manasseh
H0593.meaning: Hitchcock: a people; the strength or sorrow of people
H0593.significance: Minor figure; name: from H578 (אָנָה) and H5971 (עַם); groaning of (the) people Aniam, an Israelite

G0451.d: Woman living at the time of the New Testament
G0451.s: A woman living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Luk.2.36; only referred to as Anna (Ἄννα); a daughter of Phanuel.
G0451.f: Prophetess who witnessed Jesus' dedication in the temple
G0451.meaning: Greek Ἄννα (Anna); from Hebrew חַנָּה (Hannah), grace. Anna = grace. Prophetess (Luke 2:36). Hitchcock: gracious; one who gives. BehindTheName: Greek form of Hannah.
G0451.significance: Widow; in the temple when Jesus was presented (Luke 2:36–38). Spoke of him to all who were waiting. Name (grace) as the one who recognized the redemption of Jerusalem.

G0452.d: High Priest living at the time of the New Testament
G0452.s: A High Priest living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Luk.3.2; only referred to as Annas (Ἄννας);  father in law of Caiaphas.
G0452.f: High priest during Jesus' ministry and trial
G0452.meaning: Greek Ἅννας (Hannas); from Hebrew חָנַן (chanan), gracious. Annas = gracious. High priest (Luke 3:2; John 18:13). Hitchcock: one who answers; humble. BehindTheName: Contracted form of Ananias.
G0452.significance: Former high priest; father-in-law of Caiaphas. Jesus brought before him (John 18:13). Name (gracious) vs. role in the condemnation of the righteous.

H6070.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H6070.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.24; only referred to as Anthothijah (עַנְתֹתִיָּה);  son of Shashak; a brother of Ishpan, Eber, Eliel, Abdon, Zichri, Hanan, Hananiah, Elam, Iphdeiah and Penuel.
H6070.f: Son of Shashak, descendant of Benjamin
H6070.meaning: from the same as H6068 (עֲנָתוֹת) and H3050 (יָהּ); answers of Jah Anthothijah, an Israelite
H6070.significance: Minor figure; name: from the same as H6068 (עֲנָתוֹת) and H3050 (יָהּ); answers of Jah Anthothijah, an Israelite

G0493.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0493.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Rev.2.13; only referred to as Antipas (Ἀντίπας).
G0493.meaning: Hitchcock: for all, or against all
G0493.significance: Minor figure; name: contracted for a compound of G473 (ἀντί) and a derivative of G3962 (πατήρ) Antipas, a Christian

H6036.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H6036.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.8; only referred to as Anub (עָנוּב);  son of Koz; a brother of Zobebah and Harum.
H6036.f: Son of Coz, descendant of Judah
H6036.significance: Minor figure; name: passive participle from the same as H6025 (עֵנָב); borne (as fruit) Anub, an Israelite

G0559.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0559.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Rom.16.10; only referred to as Apelles (Ἀπελλῆς).
G0559.f: Approved in Christ, greeted by Paul
G0559.meaning: Hitchcock: exclusion; separation. BehindTheName: Possibly from a Doric Greek form of Apollo.
G0559.significance: Minor figure; name: of Latin origin Apelles, a Christian

H0647.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0647.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Sa.9.1; only referred to as Aphiah (אֲפִיחַ);  father of Becorath.
H0647.f: Ancestor of King Saul, a Benjamite
H0647.significance: Saul's family. Name meaning: perhaps from H6315 (פּוּחַ); breeze Aphiach, an Israelite

G0625.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0625.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.18.24; only referred to as Apollos (Ἀπολλῶς).
G0625.f: Eloquent Jewish Christian from Alexandria, co-worker with Paul
G0625.meaning: Greek Ἀπολλῶς (Apollos); possibly from Apollo. Apollos = from Apollo. Alexandrian Jew (Acts 18:24). Hitchcock: one who destroys; destroyer
G0625.significance: Eloquent; knew only John’s baptism; instructed by Priscilla and Aquila (Acts 18:26). Fellow worker with Paul (1 Cor 3:6). Name in the service of the word.

H0649.s: People from Aph(?) from the tribe of Judah, first mentioned at 1Ch.2.30; only referred to as Appaim (אַפַּיִם); descended from Nadab along with Seled;  progenitors of Ishi.
H0649.f: Son of Nadab, descendant of Judah
H0649.significance: From  Judah. Name meaning: dual of H639 (אַף); two nostrils Appajim, an Israelite

G0682.d: Woman living at the time of the New Testament
G0682.s: A woman living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Phm.1.2; only referred to as Apphia (Ἀπφία).
G0682.f: Recipient of Paul's letter to Philemon
G0682.meaning: Hitchcock: productive; fruitful. BehindTheName: Greek form of a Hebrew name possibly meaning 'increasing'.
G0682.significance: Minor figure; name: probably of foreign origin Apphia, a woman of Collosæ

G0207.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0207.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.18.2; only referred to as Aquila (Ἀκύλας); husband of Priscilla.
G0207.f: Jewish Christian tentmaker, co-worker with Paul
G0207.meaning: Latin Aquila = eagle. Husband of Priscilla; tentmaker (Acts 18:2). Hitchcock: an eagle. BehindTheName: Latin meaning 'eagle'.
G0207.significance: With Priscilla, instructed Apollos (Acts 18:26); greeted by Paul (Rom 16:3). Name (eagle) as one who soars in the word; partner in ministry.

H0690.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0690.s: A man from the tribe of Asher living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.38; only referred to as Ara (אֲרָא);  son of Ithran; a brother of Jephunneh and Pispa.
H0690.f: Son of Jether, descendant of Asher
H0690.significance: Minor figure; name: probably for H738 (אֲרִי); lion Ara, an Israelite

H6166.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H6166.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin  living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.15; only referred to as Arad (עֲרָד);  son of Beriah; a brother of Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth, Zebadiah, Eder, Michael, Ishpah and Joha.
H6166.meaning: Hitchcock: a wild ass; a dragon
H6166.significance: Minor figure; name: from an unused root meaning to sequester itself; fugitive Arad, the name of a place near...

H0733.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0733.s: A man from the tribe of Asher living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.39; only referred to as Arah (אָרַח);  son of Shual; a brother of Hanniel and Rizia.
H0733.significance: Minor figure; name: from H732 (אָרַח); way faring Arach, the name of three Israelites

H0758.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0758.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.10.22; only referred to as Aram (אֲרָם);  son of Shem; a brother of Asshur, Elam, Arpachshad and Lud;  father of Uz, Hul, Gether and Mash.
H0758.f: Son of Shem, ancestor of the Arameans
H0758.meaning: Hitchcock: highness, magnificence, one that deceives; curse
H0758.significance: Son of Shem. Name (from the same as H759 (אַרְמוֹן); the highland Aram or Syria, and its ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0761.d: Woman living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0761.s: A concubine of Syria living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.14; only referred to as Aramitess (אֲרַמִּי); concubine of Manasseh;  mother of Machir and Asriel.
H0761.f: Concubine of Manasseh; mother of Asriel
H0761.meaning: patrial from H758 (אֲרָם) an Aramite or Aramaean
H0761.significance: Minor figure; name: patrial from H758 (אֲרָם) an Aramite or Aramaean

H0765.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0765.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.28; only referred to as Aran (אֲרָן);  son of Dishan; a brother of Uz.
H0765.f: Son of Dishan, descendant of Seir the Horite
H0765.significance: Son of Dishan. Name (from H7442 (רָנַן); stridulous Aran, an Edomite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0704.s: A man living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jos.14.15; only referred to as Arba (אַרְבַּע); father of Anak.
H0704.f: Father of Anak, former name of Hebron
H0704.significance: Father of Anak. Name (the same as H702 (אַרְבַּע) Arba, one of the Anakim). Name in lineage or family context.

G0745.d: Ethnarch living at the time of the New Testament
G0745.s: Ethnarch Herod Archelaus over Israel living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Mat.2.22; only referred to as Archelaus (Ἀρχέλαος);  son of Herod 'the Great'; a brother of  Herod Antipas, Herod Philip I and Herod Philip II.
G0745.f: Son of Herod the Great, Ethnarch of Judea
G0745.meaning: Hitchcock: the prince of the people
G0745.significance: Minor figure; name: from G757 (ἄρχω) and G2994 (Λαοδικεύς) people-ruling; Archelaus, a Jewish king

G0751.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0751.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Col.4.17; only referred to as Archippus (Ἄρχιππος).
G0751.f: Fellow soldier and minister in Colossae
G0751.significance: man living at the time of the new testament. Name meaning: from G746 (ἀρχή) and G2462 (ἵππος) horse-ruler; Archippus, a Christian

H0757.s: A person from Arach(?), first mentioned at Jos.16.2; only referred to as Archites (אַרְכִּי).
H0757.f: Inhabitants of a region near Bethel
H0757.meaning: patrial from another place (in Palestine) of similar name with H751 (אֶרֶךְ) an Arkite or native...
H0757.significance: people from arach(?). Name meaning: patrial from another place (in Palestine) of similar name with H751 (א...

H0714.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0714.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.26.40; referred to as Ard (אַרְדְּ), or Ardite (אַרְדִּי);  son of Bela; a brother of Naaman, Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, Iri, Addar, Gera, Abihud, Abishua and Ahoah.
H0714.f: Grandson of Benjamin, son of Bela
H0714.meaning: Hitchcock: one that commands; he that descends
H0714.significance: Son of Bela. Name (from an unused root probably meaning to wander; fugitive Ard, the name...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0715.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0715.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.18; only referred to as Ardon (אַרְדּוֹן);  son of Caleb and Azubah; a brother of Hur, Jesher, Shobab, Mesha, Haran, Moza, Gazez, Sheber, Tirhanah, Regem(?), Jotham(?), Geshan(?), Pelet(?), Ephah(?), Shaaph(?), Shaaph, Sheva and Achsah.
H0715.f: Son of Caleb, brother of Jether and Mered
H0715.meaning: Hitchcock: ruling; a judgment of malediction
H0715.significance: Minor figure; name: from the same as H714 (אַרְדְּ); roaming Ardon, an Israelite

H0692.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0692.s: A man from the tribe of Gad living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.16; referred to as Areli or Arelite (אַרְאֵלִי);  son of Gad; a brother of Ziphion, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri and Arod.
H0692.f: Son of Gad, grandson of Jacob
H0692.meaning: Hitchcock: the light or vision of God
H0692.significance: Son of Gad. Name (from H691 (אֶרְאֵל); heroic Areli (or an Arelite, collectively), an Is...). Name in lineage or family context.

G0702.d: King living at the time of the New Testament
G0702.s: A king living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at 2Co.11.32; only referred to as Aretas (Ἀρέτας).
G0702.f: King of the Nabataeans in Damascus
G0702.significance: Minor figure; name: of foreign origin Aretas, an Arabian

H0709.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0709.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ki.15.25; only referred to as Argob (אַרְגֹּב).
H0709.f: Officer of King Pekahiah of Israel
H0709.meaning: Hitchcock: a turf, or fat land
H0709.significance: Minor figure; name: from the same as H7263 (רֶגֶב); stony Argob, a district of Palestine

H0742.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H0742.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Est.9.9; only referred to as Aridai (אֲרִידַי);  son of Haman; a brother of Parshandatha, Dalphon, Aspatha, Poratha, Adalia, Aridatha, Parmashta, Arisai and Vaizatha.
H0742.f: Son of Haman, enemy of the Jews
H0742.meaning: of Persian origin Aridai, a son of Haman
H0742.significance: Minor figure; name: of Persian origin Aridai, a son of Haman

H0743.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H0743.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Est.9.8; only referred to as Aridatha (אֲרִידָ֑תָא);  son of Haman; a brother of Parshandatha, Dalphon, Aspatha, Poratha, Adalia, Parmashta, Arisai, Aridai and Vaizatha.
H0743.f: Son of Haman, enemy of the Jews
H0743.meaning: of Persian origin Aridatha, a son of Haman
H0743.significance: Minor figure; name: of Persian origin Aridatha, a son of Haman

H0745.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0745.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ki.15.25; only referred to as Arieh (אַרְיֵה).
H0745.f: Officer of King Pekahiah of Israel
H0745.meaning: the same as H738 (אֲרִי); lion Arjeh, an Israelite
H0745.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H738 (אֲרִי); lion Arjeh, an Israelite

H0739.d: Warriors living at the time of Exile and Return
H0739.s: A group of warriors living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.23.20; referred to as Ariel or "hero" (KJV= "lionlike men, NIV= "mightiest warriors"")  (אֲרִיאֵל).
H0739.f: Two lion-like men of Moab killed by Benaiah
H0739.meaning: Hitchcock: altar; light or lion of God. BehindTheName: Means 'lion of God' in Hebrew, from אֲרִי (ʾari) 'lion' and אֵל (ʾel) 'God'.
H0739.significance: A Moabite. Name (or אֲרִאֵל; from H738 (אֲרִי) and H410 (אֵל) lion of God; i.e. heroic). Name fits martial or military role.

H0740.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H0740.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Ezr.8.16; only referred to as Ariel (אֲרִיאֵל).
H0740.f: One of the leaders summoned by Ezra
H0740.meaning: Hitchcock: altar; light or lion of God. BehindTheName: Means 'lion of God' in Hebrew, from אֲרִי (ʾari) 'lion' and אֵל (ʾel) 'God'.
H0740.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H739 (אֲרִיאֵל) Ariel, a symbolical name for Jerusalem, also the name of an Israelite

H0746.d: King living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0746.s: A king in Mesopotamia living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.14.1; only referred to as Arioch (אַרְיוֹךְ).
H0746.f: King of Ellasar, ally of Chedorlaomer
H0746.significance: Mesopotamian king. Name (of foreign origin Arjok, the name of two Babylonians). Name in royal or ruling context.

H0747.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H0747.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Est.9.9; only referred to as Arisai (אֲרִיסַי);  son of Haman; a brother of Parshandatha, Dalphon, Aspatha, Poratha, Adalia, Aridatha, Parmashta, Aridai and Vaizatha.
H0747.f: Son of Haman, enemy of the Jews
H0747.meaning: of Persian origin Arisai, a son of Haman
H0747.significance: Minor figure; name: of Persian origin Arisai, a son of Haman

G0708.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0708.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.19.29; only referred to as Aristarchus (Ἀρίσταρχος).
G0708.f: Macedonian companion of Paul, fellow prisoner
G0708.meaning: Greek Ἀρίσταρχος (Aristarchos); from ἄριστος (aristos), best, + ἀρχή (arche), ruler. Aristarchus = best ruler. Macedonian (Acts 19:29). Hitchcock: the best prince
G0708.significance: Traveled with Paul (Acts 20:4); with him in the riot at Ephesus and on the voyage to Rome. “Fellow prisoner” (Col 4:10). Name (best ruler) as the one who served the apostle.

G0711.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0711.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Rom.16.10; only referred to as Aristobulus (Ἀριστόβουλος).
G0711.f: Believer in Rome, greeted by Paul
G0711.meaning: Greek Ἀριστόβουλος (Aristoboulos); from ἄριστος (aristos), best, + βουλή (boule), counsel. Aristobulus = best counsel. In Rome (Rom 16:10). Hitchcock: a good counselor. BehindTheName: From Greek meaning 'best in counsel', from ἄριστος (aristos) 'best' and βουλή (boule) 'counsel'.
G0711.significance: Household greeted by Paul (Rom 16:10). Name (best counsel) in the list of the saints in the capital.

H6208.s: People from Arak(?) of the Canaanites, first mentioned at Gen.10.17; only referred to as Arkites (עַרְקִי); descended from Canaan along with Sidon, Heth, Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites, Hivites, Sinites, Arvadites, Zemarites and Hamathites.
H6208.f: Canaanite people group descended from Canaan
H6208.meaning: patrial from an unused name meaning a tush an Arkite or inhabitant of Erek
H6208.significance: Canaanites. Name meaning: patrial from an unused name meaning a tush an Arkite or inhabitant of ...

H0764.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0764.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Sa.21.8; only referred to as Armoni (אַרְמֹנִי);  son of Saul and Rizpah; a brother of Mephibosheth;  half-brother of: Jonathan, Abinadab, Malchi-shua, Merab, Michal and Ish-bosheth.
H0764.f: Son of Saul by Rizpah, killed by Gibeonites
H0764.meaning: from H759 (אַרְמוֹן); palatial Armoni, an Israelite
H0764.significance: Minor figure; name: from H759 (אַרְמוֹן); palatial Armoni, an Israelite

H0770.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0770.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.3.21; only referred to as Arnan (אַרְנָן);  son of Hananiah; a brother of Pelatiah, Jeshaiah, Rephaiah, Obadiah and Shecaniah.
H0770.meaning: probably from the same as H769 (אַרְנוֹן); noisy Arnan, an Israelite
H0770.significance: Minor figure; name: probably from the same as H769 (אַרְנוֹן); noisy Arnan, an Israelite

H0720.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0720.s: A man from the tribe of Gad living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.16; referred to as Arod (אֲרוֹד), or Arodi or Arodite (אֲרוֹדִי);  son of Gad; a brother of Ziphion, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri and Areli.
H0720.meaning: an orthographical variation of H719 (אַרְוַד); fugitive Arod, an Israelite
H0720.significance: Son of Gad. Name (an orthographical variation of H719 (אַרְוַד); fugitive Arod, an Israe...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0775.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0775.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.10.22; referred to as Arpachshad (אַרְפַּכְשַׁד), or Arphaxad (Ἀρφαξάδ);  son of Shem; a brother of Asshur, Elam, Lud and Aram;  father of Cainan.
H0775.f: Son of Shem, ancestor of Abraham
H0775.meaning: probably of foreign origin Arpakshad, a son of Noah; also the region settled by him
H0775.significance: Son of Shem. Name (probably of foreign origin Arpakshad, a son of Noah; also the region s...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0783.d: Artaxerxes Longimanus, an emperor living at the time of Exile and Return
H0783.s: A king living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.4.7 (though some think this is another Artaxerxes); referred to as Artaxerxes (אַרְתַּחְשַׁשְׂתָּא), or Artaxerxes (Aramiac אַרְתַּחְשַׁשְׂתְּא);  son of Xerxes I or Ahasuerus and Vashti; brother of Darius.
H0783.f: Persian king during Ezra and Nehemiah's time
H0783.meaning: Hitchcock: the silence of light; fervent to spoil
H0783.significance: Persian king. Name (or אַרְתַּחְשַׁשְׁתְּא; or by permutation אַרְתַּחְשַׁסְתְּא; of forei...). Name in royal or ruling context.

G0734.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0734.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Tit.3.12; only referred to as Artemas (Ἀρτεμάς).
G0734.f: Companion of Paul, potential replacement for Titus
G0734.significance: Minor figure; name: contracted from a compound of G735 (Ἄρτεμις) and G1435 (δῶρον) gift of Artemis; Artemas (or...

H0721.s: People from Arvad(?) of the Canaanites, first mentioned at Gen.10.18; only referred to as Arvadites (אַרְוָדִי); descended from Canaan along with Sidon, Heth, Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites, Hivites, Arkites, Sinites, Zemarites and Hamathites.
H0721.f: Canaanite descendants of Canaan, son of Ham
H0721.meaning: patrial from H719 (אַרְוַד) an Arvadite or citizen of Arvad
H0721.significance: Canaanites. Name meaning: patrial from H719 (אַרְוַד) an Arvadite or citizen of Arvad

H0777.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0777.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.16.9; only referred to as Arza (אַרְצָא).
H0777.f: Steward of King Elah's household in Tirzah
H0777.meaning: from H776 (אֶרֶץ); earthiness Artsa, an Israelite
H0777.significance: Minor figure; name: from H776 (אֶרֶץ); earthiness Artsa, an Israelite

H0609.d: King living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0609.s: A king of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ki.15.8; referred to as Asa (אָסָא), or Asaph (KJV= Asa)  (Ἀσά); a son of Abijah; husband of Azubah;  father of Jehoshaphat.
H0609.f: King of Judah, son of Abijah; father of Jehoshaphat
H0609.significance: King of Judah. Name (of uncertain derivation Asa, the name of a king and of a Levite). Name in royal or ruling context.

H6214.d: David's compatriot living at the time of United Monarchy
H6214.s: A warrior living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.2.18; only referred to as Asahel (עֲשָׂהאֵל); his mother was Zeruiah; a brother of Abishai and Joab;  father of Zebadiah.
H6214.f: Son of Zeruiah, brother of Joab, killed by Abner
H6214.significance: David's compatriot. Name meaning: from H6213 (עָשָׂה) and H410 (אֵל); God has made Asahel, the name of f...

H6222.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H6222.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.6.30; only referred to as Asaiah (עֲשָׂיָה); a son of Haggiah.
H6222.f: Merarite Levite, ancestor of Ethan the singer
H6222.significance: Minor figure; name: from H6213 (עָשָׂה) and H3050 (יָהּ); Jah has made Asajah, the name of three or four Israelites

H0623.d: Singer living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0623.s: A musician from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.6.39; only referred to as Asaph (אָסָף); a son of Berechiah;  father of Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah and Asharelah.
H0623.f: Levite musician, psalmist, and ancestor of temple singers
H0623.meaning: Hitchcock: who gathers together. BehindTheName: Means 'collector' in Hebrew.
H0623.significance: Returned musician. Name (from H622 (אָסַף); collector Asaph, the name of three Israelites, and ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0840.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0840.s: A man from the tribe of Judah  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.16; only referred to as Asarel (אֲשַׂרְאֵל);  son of Jehallelel; a brother of Ziph, Ziphah and Tiria.
H0840.f: Son of Jehallelel, from the tribe of Judah
H0840.meaning: by orthographical variation from H833 (אָשַׁר) and H410 (אֵל); right of God Asarel, an Israelite
H0840.significance: Minor figure; name: by orthographical variation from H833 (אָשַׁר) and H410 (אֵל); right of God Asarel, an Israelite

G9825.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
G9825.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.10.19; only referred to as Asen (Ἀσέν).
G9825.f: Ancestor of exiles who returned to Jerusalem

H0621.d: Woman living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0621.s: A woman living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.41.45; only referred to as Asenath (אָֽסְנַת); a daughter of Potiphera; wife of Joseph;  mother of Manasseh and Ephraim.
H0621.f: Egyptian wife of Joseph; mother of Manasseh and Ephraim
H0621.meaning: Hitchcock: peril; misfortune. BehindTheName: Means 'belonging to the goddess Neith' in Ancient Egyptian.
H0621.significance: Daughter of Potiphera. Name meaning: of Egyptian derivation Asenath, the wife of Joseph

H0841.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0841.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.25.2; referred to as Asharelah (אֲשַׂרְאֵ֫לָה), or Jesharelah (יְשַׂרְאֵ֫לָה);  son of Asaph; a brother of Zaccur, Joseph and Nethaniah.
H0841.f: Levite musician appointed by David to prophesy with lyres
H0841.meaning: from the same as H840 (אֲשַׂרְאֵל); right toward God Asarelah, an Israelite
H0841.significance: Son of Asaph. Name (from the same as H840 (אֲשַׂרְאֵל); right toward God Asarelah, an Isra...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H0788.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0788.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.21; referred to as Ashbel (אַשְׁבֵּל), or Ashbelite (אַשְׁבֵּלִי);  son of Benjamin; a brother of Bela, Becher, Gera, Naaman, Ahiram, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, Ard, Ahiram and Jediael.
H0788.f: Son of Benjamin, founder of the Ashbelite clan

H1202.significance: Son of Malchijah. Name (from H6213 (עָשָׂה) and H3050 (יָהּ) with a prepositional prefix; in (...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H1201.d: King living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1201.s: A king of Northern Israel, living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ki.15.16; only referred to as Baasha (בַּעְשָׁא); a son of Ahijah;  father of Elah.
H1201.f: Third king of Israel who ruled for 24 years.
H1201.meaning: Hitchcock: he that seeks, or lays waste
H1201.significance: King of N. Israel. Name (from an unused root meaning to stink; offensiveness Basha, a king of I...). Name in royal or ruling context.

H1230.d: Levite living at the time of Exile and Return
H1230.s: A man from the tribe of Levi  living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at 1Ch.9.15; only referred to as Bakbakkar (בַּקְבַּקַּר).
H1230.f: A Levite who lived in Jerusalem.
H1230.meaning: reduplicated from H1239 (בָּקַר); searcher Bakbakkar, an Israelite
H1230.significance: Minor figure; name: reduplicated from H1239 (בָּקַר); searcher Bakbakkar, an Israelite

H1227.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1227.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.51; only referred to as Bakbuk (בַּקְבּוּק).
H1227.f: Ancestor of temple servants who returned from Babylonian exile.
H1227.meaning: the same as H1228 (בַּקְבֻּק)xlit baqbûk corrected to baqbuq Bakbuk, one of the Nethinim
H1227.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: the same as H1228 (בַּקְבֻּק)xlit baqbûk corrected to baqbuq Bakbuk, o...

H1229.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1229.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Neh.11.17; only referred to as Bakbukiah (בַּקְבֻּקְיָה).
H1229.f: A Levite who served in Jerusalem after the exile.
H1229.meaning: from H1228 (בַּקְבֻּק)xlit baqbûk corrected to baqbuq and H3050 (יָהּ); emptying (i.e. wasting)...
H1229.significance: Returned leader. Name meaning: from H1228 (בַּקְבֻּק)xlit baqbûk corrected to baqbuq and H3050 (יָהּ)...

H1109.d: Prophet living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1109.s: A prophet living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.22.5; referred to as Balaam (בִּלְעָם), or Balaam (Βαλαάμ); a son of Beor.
H1109.f: A prophet hired to curse Israel but blessed them instead.
H1109.meaning: Hitchcock: the ancient of the people; the destruction of the people
H1109.significance: Pagan prophet. Name (probably from H1077 (בַּל) and H5971 (עַם); not (of the) people, i.e. ...). Name fits prophetic or messenger role.

H1081.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1081.s: A king of Babylon living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.20.12; only referred to as Baladan (בַּלְאֲדָן);   father of Merodach-baladan.
H1081.significance: Babylonian king. Name (from H1078 (בֵּל) and H113 (אָדוֹן) (contracted); Bel (is his) lord Ba...). Name in royal or ruling context.

H1111.d: King living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1111.s: A king in Moab living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.22.2; referred to as Balak (בָּלָק), or Balak (Βαλάκ); a son of Zippor.
H1111.f: King of Moab who hired Balaam to curse Israel.
H1111.meaning: Hitchcock: who lays waste or destroys
H1111.significance: Moabite king. Name (from H1110 (בָּלַק); waster Balak, a Moabitish king). Name in royal or ruling context.

H1137.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1137.s: A musician from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.6.46; only referred to as Bani (בָּנִי); a son of Shemer;  father of Amzi.
H1137.f: A Levite musician in the time of David.
H1137.meaning: from H1129 (בָּנָה); built Bani, the name of five Israelites
H1137.significance: Son of Shemer. Name (from H1129 (בָּנָה); built Bani, the name of five Israelites). Name in Levitical or temple service.

G0912.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0912.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Mat.27.16; referred to as Barabbas (Βαραββᾶς) or Jesus Barabbas.
G0912.f: A notorious prisoner released instead of Jesus.
G0912.meaning: From בַּר (bar), son, + אַבָּא (abba), father. Barabbas = son of the father. Prisoner released at Passover (Matt 27:16). Hitchcock: son of shame, confusion
G0912.significance: Insurrectionist and murderer; chosen by the crowd over Jesus (Matt 27:21). Type of the guilty one released while the innocent is condemned—substitution.

H1292.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1292.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Job.32.2; only referred to as Barachel (בָּרַכְאֵל);  father of Elihu.
H1292.f: The father of Elihu, one of Job's friends.
H1292.significance: Father of Elihu. Name (from H1288 (בָרַךְ) and H410 (אֵל), God has blessed Barakel, the fathe...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1301.s: A Judge living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jdg.4.6; referred to as Barak (בָּרָק), or Barak (KJV= Bedan)  (בְּדָן), or Barak (Βαράκ); a son of Abinoam.
H1301.meaning: Hitchcock: thunder, or in vain. BehindTheName: Means 'lightning' in Hebrew.
H1301.significance: A Judge. Name (the same as H1300 (בָּרָק) Barak, an Israelite). Name in judicial or deliverer context.

H1282.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1282.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.3.22; only referred to as Bariah (בָּרִיחַ);  son of Shemaiah; a brother of Hattush, Igal, Neariah and Shaphat.
H1282.f: A descendant of David through the line of Solomon.
H1282.meaning: the same as H1281 (בָּרִיחַ) Bariach, an Israelite
H1282.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H1281 (בָּרִיחַ) Bariach, an Israelite

G0919.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0919.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.13.6; referred to as Bar-jesus (Βαριησοῦς), or Elymas (Ἐλύμας).
G0919.f: A Jewish sorcerer who opposed Paul and Barnabas.
G0919.meaning: of Chaldee origin (H01247 and H03091) son of Jesus (or Joshua); Bar-jesus, an Israelite
G0919.significance: man living at the time of the new testament. Name meaning: of Chaldee origin (H01247 and H03091) son of Jesus (or Joshua); Bar-je...

H1302.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1302.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.53; only referred to as Barkos (בַּרְקוֹס).
H1302.f: Ancestor of a family of temple servants who returned from exile.
H1302.meaning: of uncertain derivation Barkos, one of the Nethimim
H1302.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: of uncertain derivation Barkos, one of the Nethimim

G0921.d: Levite living at the time of the New Testament - unnamed father of Barnabas
G0921.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, inferred at Col.4.10; only referred to as father of Barnabas (.);  unnamed father of: Barnabas and Mary.
G0921.f: A close relative of John Mark.
G0921.meaning: Hitchcock: son of the prophet, or of consolation. BehindTheName: From Aramaic, possibly בּר נביא (bar navi) 'son of the prophet', though Acts says 'son of encouragement'.
G0921.significance: From  Levi. Name (of Chaldee origin (H01247 and H05029) son of Nabas (i.e. prophecy); Ba...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

G0918.d: Apostle living at the time of the New Testament
G0918.s: An apostle living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Mat.10.3; only referred to as Bartholomew (Βαρθολομαῖος).
G0918.f: One of the twelve apostles of Jesus Christ.
G0918.meaning: Greek Βαρθολομαῖος (Bartholomaios); from Aramaic bar + Ptolemy. Bartholomew = son of Ptolemy. Apostle (Matt 10:3). Hitchcock: a son that suspends the waters. BehindTheName: From Aramaic meaning 'son of Talmai'.
G0918.significance: One of the Twelve; often identified with Nathanael (John 1:45). Name (son of Ptolemy) in the circle of the apostles.

G0924.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0924.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Mrk.10.46; only referred to as Bartimaeus (Βαρτιμαῖος); a son of Timaeus.
G0924.f: A blind beggar healed by Jesus near Jericho.
G0924.meaning: Greek Βαρτιμαῖος (Bartimaios); from Aramaic bar + Timaeus. Bartimaeus = son of Timaeus. Blind beggar (Mark 10:46).
G0924.significance: “Son of David, have mercy on me” (Mark 10:48); received his sight (Mark 10:52). Name (son of Timaeus/honor) as the one who received honor from the Son of David.

H1263.d: Jeremiah's servant living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1263.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at Jer.32.12; only referred to as Baruch (בָּרוּךְ);  son of Neriah; a brother of Seraiah; a servant of Jeremiah.
H1263.f: Jeremiah's scribe who recorded and delivered his prophecies.
H1263.meaning: Hitchcock: who is blessed. BehindTheName: From Hebrew בָּרוּך (Baruḵ) meaning 'blessed'.
H1263.significance: Jeremiah's servant. Name (passive participle from H1288 (בָרַךְ); blessed Baruk, the name of thr...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1271.d: David's compatriot living at the time of United Monarchy
H1271.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.17.27; only referred to as Barzillai (בַּרְזִלַּי).
H1271.f: A Gileadite who provided for David during Absalom's rebellion.
H1271.meaning: Hitchcock: son of contempt; made of iron
H1271.significance: David's compatriot. Name meaning: from H1270 (בַּרְזֶל); iron-hearted Barzillai, the name of three Israe...

H1315.d: Woman living at the time of United Monarchy
H1315.s: A woman from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.4.15; only referred to as Basemath (בָּֽשְׂמַת);  daughter of Solomon; a sister of Taphath and Rehoboam; wife of Ahimaaz.
H1315.f: Wife of Ahimaaz, one of Solomon's district governors.
H1315.meaning: feminine of H1314 (בֶּשֶׂם) (the second form); fragrance Bosmath, the name of a wife of Esau,...
H1315.significance: Minor figure; name: feminine of H1314 (בֶּשֶׂם) (the second form); fragrance Bosmath, the name of a wife of Esau,...

H1339.d: David's wife living at the time of United Monarchy
H1339.s: A woman living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.11.3; referred to as Bathsheba (בַּת־שֶׁ֫בַע), or Bath-shua (NIV= Bathsheba, KJV= Bath-sheba)  (בַּת־שׁוּעַ); a daughter of Eliam; wife of David and Uriah;  mother of Shammua, Shobab, Nathan and Solomon.
H1339.f: Wife of Uriah, later married David and bore Solomon.
H1339.meaning: Hitchcock: the seventh daughter; the daughter of satiety. BehindTheName: Means 'daughter of the oath' in Hebrew, from בַּת (baṯ) 'daughter' and שָׁבַע (shavaʿ) 'oath'.
H1339.significance: David's wife. Name meaning: from H1323 (בַּת) and H7651 (שֶׁבַע) (in the sense of H7650 (שָׁבַע));...

H1323.d: Woman living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1323.s: A woman living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.38.2; only referred to as Bath-shua (בַּת שׁוּעַ); a daughter of Shua; wife of Judah;  mother of Er, Onan and Shelah.
H1323.f: Judah's Canaanite wife; mother of Er, Onan, and Shelah.
H1323.meaning: from H1129 (בָּנָה) (as feminine of H1121 (בֵּן)) a daughter (used in the same wide sense as...
H1323.significance: Daughter of Shua. Name meaning: from H1129 (בָּנָה) (as feminine of H1121 (בֵּן)) a daughter (used in ...

H0942.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H0942.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.3.18; only referred to as Bavvai (בַּוַּי); a son of Henadad.
H0942.f: A leader who helped repair Jerusalem's wall
H0942.meaning: probably of Persian origin Bavvai, an Israelite
H0942.significance: Minor figure; name: probably of Persian origin Bavvai, an Israelite

H1213.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1213.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.52; referred to as Bazluth (בַּצְלוּת), or Bazlith (NIV= Bazluth)  (בַצְלִית).
H1213.f: Ancestor of temple servants who returned from exile.
H1213.meaning: or בַּצְלִית; from the same as H1211 (בֶּצֶל)xlit bᵉtsel corrected to betsel; a peeling Batsluth...
H1213.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: or בַּצְלִית; from the same as H1211 (בֶּצֶל)xlit bᵉtsel corrected to ...

H1183.d: Warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1183.s: A warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.12.5; only referred to as Bealiah (בַּעַלְיָה).
H1183.f: A Benjamite warrior who joined David at Ziklag.
H1183.meaning: Hitchcock: the god of an idol; in an assembly
H1183.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1167 (בַּעַל) and H3050 (יָהּ); Jah (is) master Bealjah, an Israelite

H0893.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H0893.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Ezr.8.11b; only referred to as Bebai (בֵּבַי);  father of Zechariah.
H0893.f: Ancestor of exiles who returned with Ezra to Jerusalem.
H0893.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: probably of foreign origin Bebai, an Israelite

H1071.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1071.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.21; only referred to as Becher (בֶּ֫כֶר);  son of Benjamin; a brother of Bela, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ahiram, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, Ard, Ahiram and Jediael;  father of Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth and Alemeth.
H1071.f: Son of Benjamin, listed among those who entered Egypt.
H1071.significance: Son of Benjamin. Name (the same as H1070 (בֶּכֶר) Beker, the name of two Israelites). Name in lineage or family context.

H1064.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H1064.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Sa.9.1; only referred to as Becorath (בְּכוֹרַת); a son of Aphiah;  father of Zeror.
H1064.f: An ancestor of King Saul from the tribe of Benjamin.
H1064.meaning: feminine of H1062 (בְּכוֹרָה); primogeniture Bekorath, an Israelite
H1064.significance: Saul's family. Name (feminine of H1062 (בְּכוֹרָה); primogeniture Bekorath, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0911.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0911.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.35; only referred to as Bedad (בְּדַד);  father of Hadad.
H0911.f: Father of Hadad, an Edomite king.
H0911.significance: Father of Hadad. Name (from H909 (בָּדַד); separation Bedad, an Edomite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0917.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0917.s: A man from the tribe of Manasseh living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.17; only referred to as Bedan (בְּדָן); a son of Ulam.
H0917.f: A descendant of Manasseh through Machir and Gilead.
H0917.significance: Minor figure; name: probably shortened for H5658 (עַבְדוֹן); servile Bedan, the name of two Israelites

H0912.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H0912.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Ezr.10.35; only referred to as Bedeiah (בֵּֽדְיָה).
H0912.f: An Israelite who married a foreign woman during the exile.
H0912.meaning: probably a shortened form H5662 (עֹבַדְיָה); servant of Jehovah Bedejah, an Israelite
H0912.significance: Minor figure; name: probably a shortened form H5662 (עֹבַדְיָה); servant of Jehovah Bedejah, an Israelite

H0878.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0878.s: A man from the tribe of Asher living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.37; only referred to as Beera (בְּאֵרָא);  son of Zophah; a brother of Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah, Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah and Ithran.
H0878.f: A descendant of Asher through Zophah.
H0878.significance: Minor figure; name: from H875 (בְּאֵר); a well Beera, an Israelite

H0880.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0880.s: A man from the tribe of Reuben  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.5.6; only referred to as Beerah (בְּאֵרָה); a son of Baal.
H0880.f: A Reubenite leader exiled by the Assyrian king Tiglath-Pileser.
H0880.meaning: the same as H878 (בְּאֵרָא) Beerah, an Israelite
H0880.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H878 (בְּאֵרָא) Beerah, an Israelite

H0882.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0882.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, only mentioned at Gen.26.34; only referred to as Beeri (בְּאֵרִי);  father of Judith.
H0882.f: A Hittite, father of Esau's wife Judith.
H0882.significance: Father of Judith. Name (from H875 (בְּאֵר); fountained Beeri, the name of a Hittite and of an ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1106.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1106.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.21; referred to as Bela (בֶּ֫לַע), or Belaite (בַּלְעִי);  son of Benjamin; a brother of Becher, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ahiram, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, Ard, Ahiram and Jediael;  father of Ard, Naaman, Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, Iri, Addar, Gera, Abihud, Abishua and Ahoah.
H1106.b: Son of Benjamin and father of Ezbon
H1106.f: Son of Benjamin, head of the Belaite clan
H1106.meaning: the same as H1105 (בֶּלַע) Bela, the name of a place, also of an Edomite and of two Israelites
H1106.significance: Son of Benjamin and father of Ezbon. Name (the same as H1105 (בֶּלַע) Bela, the name of a place, also of an Edomi...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1112.d: Emperor living at the time of Exile and Return
H1112.s: An emperor of Babylon living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Dan.5.1; referred to as Belshazzar (בֵּֽלְאשַׁצַּר, בֵּלְשַׁאצַּר), or Belshazzar (Aramiac בֵּֽלְאשַׁצַּר, בֵּלְשַׁאצַּר); a son of Nebuchadnezzar.
H1112.f: The last Emperor of Babylon, son of Nabonidus.
H1112.meaning: Hitchcock: master of the treasure. BehindTheName: From Akkadian Bel-sharra-usur meaning 'Bel protect the king'.
H1112.significance: Son of Nebuchadnezzar. Name (or בֵּלְאשַׁצַּרlemma בֵּלְאשַׁצּר missing vowel, corrected to בֵּלְאש...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1122.d: Singer living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1122.s: A musician living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.15.18; only referred to as Ben (בֵּן).
H1122.f: A Levite appointed as a gatekeeper for the ark.
H1122.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H1121 (בֵּן) Ben, an Israelite

H1125.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H1125.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.4.11; only referred to as Ben-abinadab (בֶּן־אֲבִינָדָב); a son of Abinadab; husband of Taphath.
H1125.f: Solomon's son-in-law, an official in his administration.
H1125.meaning: from H1121 (בֵּן) and H40 (אֲבִימֶלֶךְ); (the) son of Abinadab Ben-Abinadab, an Israelite
H1125.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1121 (בֵּן) and H40 (אֲבִימֶלֶךְ); (the) son of Abinadab Ben-Abinadab, an Israelite

H1141.d: Warrior living at the time of United Monarchy
H1141.s: A warrior living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.8.18; only referred to as Benaiah (בְּנָיָ֫הוּ); a son of Jehoiada;  father of Ammizabad.
H1141.f: Son of Jehoiada, a mighty warrior and loyal supporter of David and Solomon.
H1141.meaning: Hitchcock: son of the Lord. BehindTheName: From Hebrew בְּנָיָה meaning 'Yahweh has built', from בָּנָה (bana) 'to build' and יָהּ (yah) referring to God.
H1141.significance: David's warrior. Name (or בּנָיָהוּ; (prolonged) from H1129 (בָּנָה) and H3050 (יָהּ); Jah ha...). Name fits martial or military role.

H1151.d: Ammonite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1151.s: A man of Ammon living at the time of the Patriarchs, only mentioned at Gen.19.38; only referred to as Ben-ammi (בֶּן־עַמִּי); a son of Lot and his second daughter; half-brother of Moab.
H1151.f: Son of Lot's younger daughter; father of the Ammonites.
H1151.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1121 (בֵּן) and H5971 (עַם) with pronomial suffix; son of my people Ben-Ammi, a son of Lot

H1128.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H1128.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.4.9; only referred to as Ben-deker (בֶּן־דֶּ֫קֶר); a son of Deker.
H1128.f: One of Solomon's twelve district governors.
H1128.meaning: from H1121 (בֵּן) and a derivative of H1856 (דָּקַר); son of piercing (or of a lance) Ben-Deker,...
H1128.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1121 (בֵּן) and a derivative of H1856 (דָּקַר); son of piercing (or of a lance) Ben-Deker,...

H1127.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H1127.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.4.13; only referred to as Ben-Geber (בֶּן־גֶּ֫בֶר); a son of Geber.
H1127.f: One of Solomon's twelve district governors.
H1127.meaning: from H1121 (בֵּן) and H1397 (גֶּבֶר); son of (the) hero Ben-Geber, an Israelite
H1127.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1121 (בֵּן) and H1397 (גֶּבֶר); son of (the) hero Ben-Geber, an Israelite

H1130.d: King living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1130.s: A King of Aram living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ki.15.18; only referred to as Ben-hadad (בֶּן־הֲדַד); a son of Tabrimmon.
H1130.f: King of Aram, contemporary of Asa and Baasha.
H1130.meaning: from H1121 (בֵּן) and H1908 (הֲדַד); son of Hadad Ben-Hadad, the name of several Syrian kings
H1130.significance: Syrian king. Name (from H1121 (בֵּן) and H1908 (הֲדַד); son of Hadad Ben-Hadad, the name ...). Name in royal or ruling context.

H1134.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1134.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ch.17.7; only referred to as Ben-hail (בֶּן־חַ֫יִל).
H1134.meaning: from H1121 (בֵּן) and H2428 (חַיִל); son of might Ben-Chail, an Israelite
H1134.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1121 (בֵּן) and H2428 (חַיִל); son of might Ben-Chail, an Israelite

H1135.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1135.s: A man from the tribe of Judah(?) living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.20; only referred to as Ben-hanan (בֶּן־חָנָן);  son of Shimon; a brother of Amnon, Rinnah and Tilon.
H1135.meaning: from H1121 (בֵּן) and H2605 (חָנָן); son of Chanan Ben-Chanan, an Israelite
H1135.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1121 (בֵּן) and H2605 (חָנָן); son of Chanan Ben-Chanan, an Israelite

H1136.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H1136.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.4.10; only referred to as Ben-hesed (בֶּן־חֶ֫סֶד); a son of Hesed.
H1136.meaning: from H1121 (בֵּן) and H2617 (חֵסֵד); son of kindness Ben-Chesed, an Israelite
H1136.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1121 (בֵּן) and H2617 (חֵסֵד); son of kindness Ben-Chesed, an Israelite

H1133.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H1133.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.4.8; only referred to as Hur (בֶּן־חוּר);  father of Ben-hur.
H1133.f: One of Solomon's twelve district governors.
H1133.significance: Father of Ben-hur. Name (from H1121 (בֵּן) and H2354 (חוּר); son of Chur Ben-Chur, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H1148.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1148.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.10.13; only referred to as Beninu (בְּנִ֑ינוּ).
H1148.meaning: probably from H1121 (בֵּן) with pron. suff.; our son Beninu, an Israelite
H1148.significance: Minor figure; name: probably from H1121 (בֵּן) with pron. suff.; our son Beninu, an Israelite

H1144.d: Jacob's son living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1144.s: A man who founded the tribe of Benjamin  living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.35.18; referred to as Benjamin or Benjaminite (בִּנְיָמִין), or Ben-oni (בֶּן־אוֹנִ֑י), or [Ben]jamin (יָמִין), or Benjaminite (בֶּן־יְמִינִי), or [Ben]jaminite (יְמִינִי), or [Ben]jaminite (יָֽמִינִי), or Benjamin (Βενιαμίν);  son of Israel and Rachel; a brother of Joseph;  half-brother of: Reube
H1144.meaning: From בֶּן (ben), son, + יָמִין (yamin), right hand. Benjamin = son of the right hand. Youngest son of Jacob (Gen 35:18). BehindTheName: From Hebrew בִּנְיָמִין meaning 'son of the south' or 'son of the right hand', from בֵּן (ben) 'son' and יָמִין (yamin) 'right hand, south'.
H1144.significance: Born to Rachel in death (Gen 35:18); “son of my sorrow” / “son of the right hand.” Tribe of Saul and Paul. Name (right hand) as the beloved of the father.

H1121.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1121.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.24.26; only referred to as Beno (בְּנוֹ);  son of Jaaziah; a brother of Shoham, Zaccur and Ibri.
H1121.f: Levite from the family of Merari
H1121.significance: Son of Jaaziah. Name (from H1129 (בָּנָה) a son (as a builder of the family name), in the wi...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H1132.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1132.s: A man from the tribe of Judah(?) living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.20; only referred to as Ben-zoheth (בֶּן־זוֹחֵת);  son of Ishi; a brother of Zoheth.
H1132.meaning: from H1121 (בֵּן) and H2105 (זוֹחֵת); son of Zocheth Ben-Zocheth, an Israelite
H1132.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1121 (בֵּן) and H2105 (זוֹחֵת); son of Zocheth Ben-Zocheth, an Israelite

H1160.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1160.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.22.5; referred to as Beor (בְּעוֹר), or Beor (Βοσόρ, Βεώρ);  father of Balaam.
H1160.significance: Father of Balaam. Name (from H1197 (בָּעַר) (in the sense of burning); a lamp Beor, the name o...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1298.d: King living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1298.s: A king of Sodom living at the time of the Patriarchs, only mentioned at Gen.14.2; only referred to as Bera (בֶּ֫רַע).
H1298.f: King of Sodom during Abraham's time
H1298.significance: Minor figure; name: of uncertain derivation Bera, a Sodomitish king

H1294.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1294.s: A warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.12.3; only referred to as Beracah (בְּרָכָה).
H1294.f: Benjamite warrior who joined David at Ziklag
H1294.meaning: the same as H1293 (בְּרָכָה) Berakah, the name of an Israelite, and also of a valley in Palestine
H1294.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H1293 (בְּרָכָה) Berakah, the name of an Israelite, and also of a valley in Palestine

H1256.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1256.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.21; only referred to as Beraiah (בְּרָאיָה);  son of Shimei; a brother of Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi, Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel, Adaiah and Shimrath.
H1256.meaning: Hitchcock: the choosing of the Lord
H1256.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1254 (בָּרָא) and H8050 (שְׁמוּאֵל); Jah has created Berajah, an Israelite

H1296.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1296.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.3.20; only referred to as Berechiah (בֶּרֶכְיָה);  son of Zerubbabel; a brother of Meshullam, Hananiah, Shelomith, Hashubah, Ohel, Hasadiah, Jushab-hesed, Abiud.
H1296.meaning: or בֶּרֶכְיָהוּ; from H1290 (בֶּרֶךְ) and H3050 (יָהּ); knee (i.e. blessing) of Jah Berekjah,...
H1296.significance: Minor figure; name: or בֶּרֶכְיָהוּ; from H1290 (בֶּרֶךְ) and H3050 (יָהּ); knee (i.e. blessing) of Jah Berekjah,...

H1260.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1260.s: A man from the tribe of Ephraim living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.20; only referred to as Bered (בֶּ֫רֶד);  son of Shuthelah; a brother of Eran;  father of Tahath.
H1260.significance: Son of Shuthelah. Name (from H1258 (בָּרַד); hail Bered, the name of a place south of Palestin...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1275.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1275.s: A man from the tribe of Asher living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.36; only referred to as Beri (בֵּרִי);  son of Zophah; a brother of Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Imrah, Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran and Beera.
H1275.significance: Minor figure; name: probably by contraction from H882 (בְּאֵרִי) Beri, an Israelite

H1283.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1283.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin  living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at 1Ch.8.13; only referred to as Beriah (בְּרִיעָה);  son of Elpaal; a brother of Eber, Misham, Shemed, Shema, Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber, Ishmerai, Izliah and Jobab;  father of Arad, Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth, Zebadiah, Eder, Michael, Ishpah, Joha.
H1283.f: Benjamite leader who drove out the Gittites
H1283.significance: Son of Elpaal. Name (apparently from the feminine of H7451 (רַע) with a prepositional prefi...). Name in lineage or family context.

G0959.d: Woman living at the time of the New Testament
G0959.s: A woman living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.25.13; only referred to as Bernice (Βερνίκη).
G0959.f: Jewish princess, sister of King Agrippa II
G0959.meaning: Greek Βερνίκη (Bernike); from Greek, bringer of victory. Bernice = bringer of victory. Sister of Agrippa II (Acts 25:13). Hitchcock: one that brings victory
G0959.significance: Present with Agrippa when Paul made his defense (Acts 25:23). Name (victory) as the one who heard the gospel in the royal court—and did not believe.

H1153.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1153.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.49; only referred to as Besai (בֵּסַי).
H1153.f: Ancestor of temple servants who returned from exile
H1153.significance: man living at the time of exile and return. Name meaning: from H947 (בּוּס); domineering Besai, one of the Nethinim

H1152.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1152.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.3.6; only referred to as Besodeiah (בְּסוֹדְיָ֑ה);  father of Meshullam.
H1152.f: Father of Meshullam, a repairer of Jerusalem's gates
H1152.significance: Returned builder. Name meaning: from H5475 (סוֹד) and H3050 (יָהּ) with prepositional prefix; in (the)...

H1051.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1051.s: A man from the tribe of Judah  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.12; only referred to as Beth-rapha (בֵּית רָפָא);  son of Eshton; a brother of Paseah and Tehinnah.
H1051.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1004 (בַּיִת) and H7497 (רָפָא); house of (the) giant Beth-Rapha, an Israelite

H1328.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1328.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.22.22; only referred to as Bethuel (בְּתוּאֵל);  son of Nahor and Milcah; a brother of Uz, Buz, Kemuel, Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph and Tebah;  half-brother of: Gaham, Tahash and Maacah;  father of Rebekah and Laban.
H1328.significance: Son of Nahor. Name (apparently from the same as H1326 (בָּתָה) and H410 (אֵל); destroyed o...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1209.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1209.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.10.18; only referred to as Bezai (בֵּצָ֑י).
H1209.f: Judahite leader who sealed the covenant
H1209.significance: Minor figure; name: perhaps the same as H1153 (בְּסַי) Betsai, the name of two Israelites

H1212.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1212.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Exo.31.2; only referred to as Bezalel (בְּצַלְאֵל); a son of Uri.
H1212.f: Skilled craftsman who built the tabernacle
H1212.meaning: probably from H6738 (צֵל) and H410 (אֵל) with a prepositional prefix; in (the) shadow (i.e....
H1212.significance: Son of Uri. Name (probably from H6738 (צֵל) and H410 (אֵל) with a prepositional prefix; ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1221.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1221.s: A man from the tribe of Asher living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.37; only referred to as Bezer (בֶּ֫צֶר);  son of Zophah; a brother of Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran and Beera.
H1221.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H1220 (בֶּצֶר), an inaccessible spot Betser, a place in Palestine; also an Israelite

H1075.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H1075.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.20.1; referred to as Bichri (בִּכְרִי), or Bichrite (NIV= Bikrites)  (בֵּרִים);  father of Sheba.
H1075.f: Benjamite, father of the rebel Sheba
H1075.significance: Father of Sheba. Name (from H1069 (בָּכַר); youth-ful Bikri, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0920.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0920.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ki.9.25; only referred to as Bidkar (בִּדְקַר).
H0920.f: Officer of Jehu who witnessed Ahab's judgment
H0920.meaning: Hitchcock: in compunction, or sharp pain
H0920.significance: Minor figure; name: probably from H1856 (דָּקַר) with a prepositional prefix; by stabbing, i.e. assassin Bidkar, an...

H0903.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H0903.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Est.1.10; only referred to as Bigtha (בִּגְתָא).
H0903.meaning: of Persian derivation Bigtha, a eunuch of Xerxes
H0903.significance: Minor figure; name: of Persian derivation Bigtha, a eunuch of Xerxes

H0904.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H0904.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Est.2.21; referred to as Bigthan or Bigthana (בִּגְתָן).
H0904.f: Persian official who plotted against King Ahasuerus
H0904.meaning: Hitchcock: in the press; giving meat
H0904.significance: man living at the time of exile and return. Name meaning: or בִּגְתָנָא; of similar derivation to H903 (בִּגְתָא) Bigthan or Big...

H0902.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H0902.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.14; only referred to as Bigvai (בִּגְוַי).
H0902.f: Ancestor of exiles who returned to Jerusalem
H0902.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: probably of foreign origin Bigvai, an Israelite

H1085.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1085.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Job.2.11; only referred to as Bildad (בִּלְדַּד).
H1085.significance: man living at the time of the patriarchs. Name meaning: of uncertain derivation Bildad, one of Job's friends

H1083.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1083.s: A priest living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Neh.10.8; referred to as Bilgah (בִּלְגָּה), or Bilgai (בִּלְגַּי).
H1083.f: Priest who returned from exile and sealed the covenant
H1083.significance: Returned priest. Name (from H1082 (בָּלַג); desistance Bilgah, the name of two Israelites). Name fits cultic or priestly role.

H1090.d: Woman living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1090.s: A concubine living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.29.29; only referred to as Bilhah (בִּלְהָה); concubine of Israel;  mother of Dan and Naphtali.
H1090.f: Rachel's maidservant and mother of Dan and Naphtali
H1090.meaning: Hitchcock: Bilhan, who is old or confused. BehindTheName: Means 'bashful' in Hebrew.
H1090.significance: woman living at the time of the patriarchs. Name meaning: from H1089 (בָּלַהּ); timid Bilhah, the name of one of Jacob's concubi...

H1092.d: Warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1092.s: A warrior from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.7.10; only referred to as Bilhan (בִּלְהָן); a son of Jediael;  father of Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Chenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish and Ahishahar.
H1092.f: Benjamite, son of Jediael and father of seven sons
H1092.meaning: from H1089 (בָּלַהּ); timid Bilhan, the name of an Edomite and of an Israelite
H1092.significance: Benjamite warrior. Name (from H1089 (בָּלַהּ); timid Bilhan, the name of an Edomite and of an I...). Name fits martial or military role.

H1114.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1114.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.2; only referred to as Bilshan (בִּלְשָׁן).
H1114.f: Leader who returned from Babylonian exile
H1114.significance: Returned leader. Name meaning: of uncertain derivation Bilshan, an Israelite

H1118.s: A man from the tribe of Asher living before Israel's Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.33; only referred to as Bimhal (בִּמְהָל);  son of Japhlet; a brother of Pasach and Ashvath.
H1118.f: Son of Japhlet from the tribe of Asher
H1118.meaning: probably from H4107 (מָהַל) with prepositional prefix; with pruning Bimhal, an Israelite
H1118.significance: Minor figure; name: probably from H4107 (מָהַל) with prepositional prefix; with pruning Bimhal, an Israelite

H1150.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1150.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.8.37; only referred to as Binea (בִּנְעָא); a son of Moza;  father of Raphah, Eleasah and Azel.
H1150.f: Descendant of King Saul and Jonathan
H1150.significance: Saul's family. Name (or בִּנְעָה; of uncertain derivation Bina or Binah, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H1131.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1131.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Ezr.8.33; only referred to as Binnui (בִּנּוּי);  father of Noadiah.
H1131.f: Levite who weighed the temple vessels after the exile
H1131.significance: Father of Noadiah. Name (from H1129 (בָּנָה); built up Binnui, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H1306.d: King living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1306.s: A king in Canaan living at the time of the Patriarchs, only mentioned at Gen.14.2; only referred to as Birsha (בִּרְשַׁע).
H1306.f: King of Gomorrah during Abraham's time
H1306.meaning: Hitchcock: an evil; a son who beholds
H1306.significance: Minor figure; name: probably from H7562 (רֶשַׁע) with a prepositional prefix; with wickedness Birsha, a king of Gomorrah

H1269.d: Man or town at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1269.s: A man or town of the tribe of Asher at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.31; only referred to as Birzaith (ברזות); a son of Malchiel.
H1269.f: A son or town of Malchiel
H1269.meaning: probably feminine plural from an unused root (apparently mean to pierce); holes Birzoth, an...
H1269.significance: Minor figure; name: probably feminine plural from an unused root (apparently mean to pierce); holes Birzoth, an...

H1312.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1312.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Ezr.4.7; only referred to as Bishlam (בִּשְׁלָם).
H1312.f: Samaritan official who opposed the rebuilding of Jerusalem
H1312.significance: Minor figure; name: of foreign derivation Bishlam, a Persian

H1332.d: Woman living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1332.s: A woman of the Egyptians living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.18; only referred to as Bithiah (בִּתְיָה); a daughter of Pharaoh; wife of Mered(?);  mother of Miriam, Shammai and Ishbah.
H1332.f: Daughter of Pharaoh who married Mered of Judah
H1332.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1323 (בַּת) and H3050 (יָהּ); daughter (i.e. worshipper) of Jah Bithjah, an Egyptian woman

H0968.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H0968.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Est.1.10; only referred to as Biztha (בִּזְּתָא).
H0968.meaning: of Persian origin Biztha, a eunuch of Xerxes
H0968.significance: Minor figure; name: of Persian origin Biztha, a eunuch of Xerxes

G0986.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G0986.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Act.12.20; only referred to as Blastus (Βλάστος).
G0986.f: Herod's chamberlain who helped the people of Tyre and Sidon
G0986.meaning: Greek Βλάστος (Blastos); from βλαστός (blastos), bud. Blastus = chamberlain of Herod (Acts 12:20). Hitchcock: that buds or brings forth
G0986.significance: Mediated between Tyre and Sidon and Herod (Acts 12:20). Name (bud) as the one in the court when Herod was struck (Acts 12:23)—the king’s servant and the King’s judgment.

H1162.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Rut.2.1; referred to as Boaz (בֹּ֫עַז), or Boaz (Βοόζ); a son of Salmon and Rahab; husband of Ruth;  father of Obed.
H1162.f: Kinsman-redeemer who married Ruth, ancestor of David and Jesus
H1162.meaning: From בֹּעַז (Boaz); possibly “in him is strength.” Boaz = kinsman (Ruth 2:1). Hitchcock: or Booz, in strength. BehindTheName: Means 'swiftness' in Hebrew.
H1162.significance: Redeemed Ruth and the land (Ruth 4:9–10); in the line of David (Ruth 4:21–22). Type of the kinsman-redeemer—strength in him to redeem. Name in the line of Christ.

H1074.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1074.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.8.38; only referred to as Bocheru (בֹּֽכְרוּ);  son of Azel; a brother of Azrikam, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah and Hanan.
H1074.f: Son of Azel, a descendant of King Saul
H1074.significance: Saul's family. Name (from H1069 (בָּכַר); first-born Bokeru, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0932.s: A man living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jos.15.6; only referred to as Bohan (בֹּ֫הַן).
H0932.f: Reubenite after whom a boundary stone was named
H0932.significance: man living before israel's monarchy. Name meaning: an orthographical variation of H931 (בֹּהֶן) thumb, Bohan, an Israelit...

H1231.d: Priest living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1231.s: A High Priest from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.6.5; only referred to as Bukki (בֻּקִּי); a son of Abishua;  father of Uzzi.
H1231.f: High priest, son of Abishua and father of Uzzi
H1231.significance: High Priest. Name (from H1238 (בָּקַק); wasteful Bukki, the name of two Israelites). Name fits cultic or priestly role.

H1232.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1232.s: A musician from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.25.4; only referred to as Bukkiah (בֻּקִּיָּ֫הוּ);  son of Heman; a brother of Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.
H1232.f: Levite musician in David's time, son of Heman
H1232.meaning: Hitchcock: the dissipation of the Lord
H1232.significance: Son of Heman. Name (from H1238 (בָּקַק) and H3050 (יָהּ); wasting of Jah Bukkijah, an Isra...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H0946.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0946.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.25; only referred to as Bunah (בּוּנָה);  son of Jerahmeel; a brother of Ram, Oren, Ozem, Ahijah and Onam.
H0946.f: Son of Jerahmeel, descendant of Judah
H0946.significance: Minor figure; name: from H995 (בִּין); discretion Bunah, an Israelite

H1138.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1138.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.11.15; only referred to as Bunni (בֻּנִּי);  father of Hashabiah.
H1138.f: Levite who lived in Jerusalem during Nehemiah's time
H1138.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: or (fuller) בּוּנִי; from H1129 (בָּנָה); built Bunni or Buni, an Isra...

H0938.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0938.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, only mentioned at Gen.22.21; only referred to as Buz (בּוּז);  son of Nahor and Milcah; a brother of Uz, Kemuel, Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph and Bethuel;  half-brother of: Tebah, Gaham, Tahash and Maacah.
H0938.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H937 (בּוּז) Buz, the name of a son of Nahor, and of an Israelite

H0941.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H0941.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Ezk.1.3; only referred to as Buzi (בּוּזִי);  father of Ezekiel.
H0941.significance: Father of Ezekiel. Name (the same as H940 (בּוּזִי) Buzi, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0940.s: People from Ram, first mentioned at Job.32.2; only referred to as Buzites (בּוּזִי).
H0940.meaning: patronymic from H938 (בּוּז) a Buzite or descendant of Buz
H0940.significance: people from ram@job.32.2. Name meaning: patronymic from H938 (בּוּז) a Buzite or descendant of Buz

G2533.d: Woman living at the time of the New Testament
G2533.s: A woman living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Jhn.18.13; only referred to as a wife of Caiaphas (.);  unnamed daughter of: Annas; wife of Caiaphas.
G2533.f: The wife of Caiaphas the high priest.
G2533.meaning: Hitchcock: one who answers; humble. BehindTheName: Contracted form of Ananias.
G2533.significance: Minor figure; name: of Chaldee origin the dell; Caiaphas (i.e. Cajepha), an Israelite

H7014.d: Man living at the time before the Flood
H7014.s: A man living at the time before the Flood, first mentioned at Gen.4.1; referred to as Cain (קַ֫יִן), or Cain (Κάϊν);  son of Adam and Eve; a brother of Abel and Seth;  father of Enoch.
H7014.f: Adam and Eve's firstborn son, killed his brother Abel
H7014.meaning: From קָנָה (qanah), acquire, get. Cain = acquisition. Firstborn of Adam (Gen 4:1). Hitchcock: possession, or possessed. BehindTheName: From Hebrew קָיִן (Qayin) possibly meaning 'acquired', from קָנָה (qana) 'to acquire'.
H7014.significance: Offered unacceptable sacrifice; slew Abel (Gen 4:8). Name (acquire) as grasping—land, offering, brother’s life. Type of the way of the flesh (Jude 11).

G2536.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
G2536.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, only mentioned at Luk.3.36; only referred to as Cainan (Καϊνάν, Καϊνάμ); a son of Arpachshad;  father of Shelah.
G2536.f: Son of Arphaxad, ancestor of Jesus (Luke's genealogy)
G2536.significance: Son of Arpachshad. Name (of Hebrew origin (H07018) Cainan (i.e. Kenan), the name of two patriar...). Name in lineage or family context.

H3633.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living before Israel's Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.6; only referred to as Calcol (כַּלְכֹּל);  son of Zerah; a brother of Zabdi, Ethan, Heman and Dara.
H3633.f: Son of Zerah, grandson of Judah
H3633.significance: Minor figure; name: from H3557 (כּוּל); sustenance Calcol, an Israelite

H3612.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H3612.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at 1Ch.2.9; referred to as Caleb (כָּלֵב), or Carmi (NIV= Karmi)  (כַּרְמִי), or Chelubai (כְּלוּבָ֑י);  son of Hezron; a brother of Ram, Jerahmeel, Segub and Ashhur; husband of Azubah, Jerioth, Ephrathah, Ephah and Maacah;  father of Hur, Jesher, Shobab, Ardon, Mesha, Haran, Moza, Gazez, Sheber, Tirhanah, Re
H3612.meaning: Hitchcock: a dog; a crow; a basket. BehindTheName: Most likely related to Hebrew כֶּלֶב (kelev) 'dog'. Alternate theory: from כֹּל (kol) 'all' and לֵב (lev) 'heart'.
H3612.significance: Son of Hezron. Name (perhaps a form of H3611 (כֶּלֶב), or else from the same root in the se...). Name in lineage or family context.

H3667.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H3667.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.9.18; only referred to as Canaan (כְּנַ֫עַן);  son of Ham; a brother of Cush, Egypt and Put;  father of Sidon, Heth, Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites, Hivites, Arkites, Sinites, Arvadites, Zemarites and Hamathites.
H3667.f: Son of Ham; father of Sidon and Heth
H3667.meaning: Hitchcock: merchant; trader; or that humbles and subdues. BehindTheName: From Hebrew כְּנַעַן possibly from a root meaning 'low, humble'.
H3667.significance: Son of Ham. Name (from H3665 (כָּנַע); humiliated Kenaan, a son a Ham; also the country ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H3669.d: Woman living at the time of the Patriarchs
H3669.s: A woman living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.46.10; only referred to as Canaanite woman (כְּנַעֲנִי);  mother of Shaul.
H3669.meaning: patrial from H3667 (כְּנַעַן) a Kenaanite or inhabitant of Kenaan; by implication, a pedlar (the...
H3669.significance: woman living at the time of the patriarchs. Name meaning: patrial from H3667 (כְּנַעַן) a Kenaanite or inhabitant of Kenaan; by ...

H3732.s: People from Caphtor (Crete) of the Egyptians, first mentioned at Gen.10.14; only referred to as Caphtorim (כַּפְתֹּרִי); descended from Egypt along with Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim, Pathrusim and Casluhim.
H3732.f: Descendants of Mizraim who displaced the Avvim
H3732.meaning: patrial from H3731 (כַּפְתֹּר) a Caphtorite (collectively) or native of Caphtor
H3732.significance: Early nation. Name meaning: patrial from H3731 (כַּפְתֹּר) a Caphtorite (collectively) or native o...

H3752.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H3752.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Est.1.10; only referred to as Carkas (כַּרְכַּס).
H3752.meaning: of Persian origin Karkas, a eunuch of Xerxes
H3752.significance: Minor figure; name: of Persian origin Karkas, a eunuch of Xerxes

H3756.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H3756.s: A man from the tribe of Reuben living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.9; referred to as Carmi (כַּרְמִי), or Carmite (NIV= Karmite)  (כַּרְמִי);  son of Reuben; a brother of Pallu, Hezron and Hanoch.
H3756.f: Son of Reuben; father of the Carmites
H3756.meaning: Hitchcock: my vineyard; lamb of the waters
