H3756.significance: Son of Reuben. Name (from H3754 (כֶּרֶם); gardener Karmi, the name of three Israelites). Name in lineage or family context.

G2591.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G2591.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at 2Ti.4.13; only referred to as Carpus (Κάρπος).
G2591.meaning: Hitchcock: fruit; fruitful. BehindTheName: From Greek Κάρπος (Karpos) meaning 'fruit, profits'.
G2591.significance: Minor figure; name: perhaps for G2590 (καρπός) Carpus, probably a Christian

H3771.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H3771.s: A prince of Persia living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Est.1.14; only referred to as Carshena (כַּרְשְׁנָא).
H3771.significance: Minor figure; name: of foreign origin Karshena, a courtier of Xerxes

H3695.s: People from Casluch(?) of the Egyptians, first mentioned at Gen.10.14; only referred to as Casluhim (כַּסְלֻחִים); descended from Egypt along with Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim, Pathrusim and Caphtorim;  progenitors of the Philistine.
H3695.f: Descendants of Mizraim, ancestor of Philistines
H3695.significance: Early nation. Name meaning: a plural probably of foreign derivation Casluchim, a people cognate to...

H3540.d: King living at the time of the Patriarchs
H3540.s: A king in Mesopotamia living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.14.1; only referred to as Chedorlaomer (כְּדׇרְלָעֹמֶר).
H3540.f: King of Elam, led coalition against Sodom and Gomorrah
H3540.significance: Mesopotamian king. Name (of foreign origin Kedorlaomer, an early Persian king). Name in royal or ruling context.

H3636.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H3636.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Ezr.10.30; only referred to as Chelal (כְּלָ֑ל).
H3636.f: Israelite who married a foreign wife during Ezra's time
H3636.significance: Minor figure; name: from H3634 (כָּלַל); complete Kelal, an Israelite

H3620.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H3620.s: A man from the tribe of Judah  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.11; only referred to as Chelub (כְּלוּב); a brother of Shuhah;  father of Mehir.
H3620.significance: Father of Mehir. Name (the same as H3619 (כְּלוּב)xlit kᵉlûb corrected to kᵉlûwb Kelub, the n...). Name in lineage or family context.

H3622.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H3622.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Ezr.10.35; only referred to as Cheluhi (כְּלוּהוּ).
H3622.f: A man who married a foreign woman
H3622.meaning: from H3615 (כָּלָה); completed Keluhai, an Israelite
H3622.significance: Minor figure; name: from H3615 (כָּלָה); completed Keluhai, an Israelite

H3668.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H3668.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.10; only referred to as Chenaanah (כְּנַעֲנָה);  son of Bilhan; a brother of Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Zethan, Tarshish and Ahishahar.
H3668.f: Son of Bilhan, descendant of Benjamin
H3668.significance: Minor figure; name: feminine of H3667 (כְּנַעַן) Kenaanah, the name of two Israelites

H3662.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H3662.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.9.4; only referred to as Chenani (כְּנָנִי).
H3662.f: Levite who led the people in confession
H3662.significance: Minor figure; name: from H3661 (כָּנַן); planted Kenani, an Israelite

H3663.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H3663.s: A musician living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.15.22; only referred to as Chenaniah (כְּנַנְיָ֫הוּ).
H3663.f: Levite leader of singing and administration under David
H3663.meaning: Hitchcock: preparation, or disposition, or strength, of the Lord
H3663.significance: man living at the time of divided monarchy. Name meaning: or כְּנַנְיָהוּ; from H3661 (כָּנַן) and H3050 (יָהּ); Jah has planted...

H3763.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H3763.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.26; only referred to as Cheran (כְּרָ֑ן);  son of Dishon; a brother of Eshban, Ithran and Hemdan.
H3763.f: Son of Dishon, descendant of Esau
H3763.significance: Son of Dishon. Name (of uncertain derivation Keran, an aboriginal Idumaean). Name in lineage or family context.

H3774.d: A military group in the Old Testament
H3774.s: A group of warriors, first mentioned at 2Sa.8.18; referred to as Cherethite (כְּרֵתִי), or Carite or Cherethite (=Qere. Ketiv= Carian, NIV= Kerethite) (כָּרִי).
H3774.meaning: probably from H3772 (כָּרַת) in the sense of executioner; (compare H2876 (טַבָּח)) (only...
H3774.significance: Royal guards. Name meaning: probably from H3772 (כָּרַת) in the sense of executioner; (compare H28...

H3777.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H3777.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, only mentioned at Gen.22.22; only referred to as Chesed (כֶּ֫שֶׂד);  son of Nahor and Milcah; a brother of Uz, Buz, Kemuel, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph and Bethuel;  half-brother of: Tebah, Gaham, Tahash and Maacah.
H3777.meaning: Hitchcock: as a devil, or a destroyer
H3777.significance: Minor figure; name: from an unused root of uncertain meaning Kesed, a relative of Abraham

H3609.d: David's son living at the time of United Monarchy
H3609.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.3.3; referred to as Chileab (כִּלְאָב), or Daniel (דָּנִיֵּאל, דָּנִאֵל); a son of David and Abigail;  half-brother of: Amnon, Absalom, Adonijah, Shephatiah, Ithream, Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon, Ibhar, Elishua, Nepheg, Japhia, Elishama, Eliada, Eliphelet, Tamar, Elpelet, Nogah and Jerimoth.
H3609.f: Son of David and Abigail the Carmelitess
H3609.meaning: apparently from H3607 (כָּלָא) and H1 (אָב); restraint of (his) father Kilab, an Israelite
H3609.significance: David's son. Name (apparently from H3607 (כָּלָא) and H1 (אָב); restraint of (his) father...). Name in lineage or family context.

H3630.s: A man living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Rut.1.2; only referred to as Chilion (כִּלְיוֹן);  son of Elimelech and Naomi; a brother of Mahlon; husband of Orpah.
H3630.f: Son of Elimelech and Naomi; husband of Orpah
H3630.significance: Son of Elimelech. Name (a form of H3631 (כִּלָּיוֹן) Kiljon, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H3643.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H3643.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.19.37; only referred to as Chimham (כִּמְהָם).
H3643.f: Barzillai's son, accompanied David to Jerusalem
H3643.meaning: Hitchcock: as they; like to them
H3643.significance: man living at the time of united monarchy. Name meaning: from H3642 (כָּמַהּ); pining Kimham, an Israelite

H3692.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H3692.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.34.21; only referred to as Chislon (כִּסְלוֹן);  father of Elidad.
H3692.f: Father of Elidad, a leader from Benjamin
H3692.significance: Father of Elidad. Name (from H3688 (כָּסַל); hopeful Kislon, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

G5514.d: Woman living at the time of the New Testament
G5514.s: A woman living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at 1Co.1.11; only referred to as Chloe (Χλόη).
G5514.f: Believer whose household reported divisions in Corinthian church
G5514.meaning: Hitchcock: green herb. BehindTheName: Means 'green shoot' in Greek, referring to new plant growth.
G5514.significance: Minor figure; name: feminine of apparently a primary word "green"; Chloë, a Christian female

G5529.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G5529.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Luk.8.3; only referred to as Chuza (Χουζᾶς); husband of Joanna.
G5529.f: Herod's steward, whose wife Joanna supported Jesus
G5529.significance: Minor figure; name: of uncertain origin Chuzas, an officer of Herod

G2803.d: Woman living at the time of the New Testament
G2803.s: A woman living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at 2Ti.4.21; only referred to as Claudia (Κλαυδία).
G2803.f: Believer in Rome who sent greetings to Timothy
G2803.meaning: Hitchcock: Claudius, lame. BehindTheName: Feminine form of Claudius.
G2803.significance: Minor figure; name: feminine of G2804 (Κλαύδιος) Claudia, a Christian woman

G2804.d: Emperor living at the time of the New Testament
G2804.s: An emperor of Rome living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.11.28; referred to as Claudius (Κλαύδιος), or Caesar (Καῖσαρ).
G2804.meaning: of Latin origin Claudius, the name of two Romans
G2804.significance: Roman Emperor. Name meaning: of Latin origin Claudius, the name of two Romans

G2815.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G2815.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Php.4.3; only referred to as Clement (Κλήμης).
G2815.f: Fellow laborer with Paul in the gospel
G2815.significance: Minor figure; name: of Latin origin merciful; Clemes (i.e. Clemens), a Christian

H3626.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H3626.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.11.5; only referred to as Col-hozeh (כׇּל־חֹזֶה); a son of Hazaiah;  father of Baruch.
H3626.f: Ancestor of Maaseiah, who settled in Jerusalem
H3626.meaning: from H3605 (כֹּל) and H2374 (חֹזֶה); every seer Col-Chozeh, an Israelite
H3626.significance: Returned from exile. Name (from H3605 (כֹּל) and H2374 (חֹזֶה); every seer Col-Chozeh, an Israeli...). Name in lineage or family context.

H3562.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy - unnamed father
H3562.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, inferred at 2Ch.31.12; only referred to as father of Conaniah;  unnamed father of: Conaniah and Shimei.
H3562.f: Father of Conaniah, a Levite in charge of offerings
H3562.meaning: from H3559 (כּוּן) and H3050 (יָהּ); Jah has sustained Conanjah, the name of two Israelites
H3562.significance: man living at the time of divided monarchy - unnamed father. Name meaning: from H3559 (כּוּן) and H3050 (יָהּ); Jah has sustained Conanjah, the n...

G2883.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G2883.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.10.1; only referred to as Cornelius (Κορνήλιος).
G2883.f: Centurion, first Gentile convert to Christianity
G2883.meaning: Greek Κορνήλιος (Kornelios); from Latin Cornelius. Cornelius = of a horn. Centurion (Acts 10:1). BehindTheName: Roman name possibly from Latin cornu 'horn'.
G2883.significance: God-fearer; first Gentile to receive the Spirit in Acts (Acts 10:44–48). Type of the opening of the gospel to the nations; name (horn) as strength and salvation (Ps 18:2).

G2973.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
G2973.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at Luk.3.28; only referred to as Cosam (Κωσάμ); a son of Elmadam;  father of Addi.
G2973.f: Ancestor of Jesus in Luke's genealogy
G2973.significance: Son of Elmadam. Name (of Hebrew origin (compare H07081) Cosam (i.e. Kosam) an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H3579.d: Woman living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H3579.s: A woman living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.25.15; only referred to as Cozbi (כָּזְבִי); a daughter of Zur.
H3579.f: Midianite woman killed for immorality with an Israelite
H3579.significance: Daughter of Zur. Name meaning: from H3576 (כָּזַב); false Cozbi, a Midianitess

G2913.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G2913.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at 2Ti.4.10; only referred to as Crescens (Κρήσκης).
G2913.f: Companion of Paul who went to Galatia
G2913.meaning: Hitchcock: growing; increasing. BehindTheName: Latin name from cresco 'to grow'.
G2913.significance: Minor figure; name: of Latin origin growing; Cresces (i.e. Crescens), a Christian

G2921.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G2921.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.18.8; only referred to as Crispus (Κρίσπος).
G2921.f: Synagogue leader in Corinth who believed in Jesus
G2921.meaning: Greek Κρίσπος (Krispos); from Latin Crispus. Crispus = curled. Ruler of the synagogue (Acts 18:8).
G2921.significance: Believed with his household (Acts 18:8); Paul baptized him (1 Cor 1:14). Name (curled) as the one who turned from synagogue to Christ.

H3568.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H3568.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.10.6; only referred to as Cush (כּוּשׁ);  son of Ham; a brother of Canaan, Egypt and Put;  father of Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, Sabteca and Nimrod.
H3568.f: Son of Ham; father of Nimrod and other descendants
H3568.significance: Son of Ham. Name (probably of foreign origin Cush (or Ethiopia), the name of a son of Ha...). Name in lineage or family context.

H3573.s: A king of Mesopotamia living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jdg.3.8; only referred to as Cushan-rishathaim (כּוּשַׁן רִשְׁעָתַ֫יִם).
H3573.f: King of Mesopotamia who oppressed Israel
H3573.meaning: apparently from H3572 (כּוּשָׁן) and the dual of H7564 (רִשְׁעָה); Cushan of double wickedness...
H3573.significance: king living before israel's monarchy. Name (apparently from H3572 (כּוּשָׁן) and the dual of H7564 (רִשְׁעָה); Cus...). Name in royal or ruling context.

H3570.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H3570.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at Jer.36.14; only referred to as Cushi (כּוּשִׁי);  father of Shelemiah.
H3570.f: Ancestor of Jehudi, who read Jeremiah's scroll
H3570.meaning: the same as H3569 (כּוּשִׁי) Cushi, the name of two Israelites
H3570.significance: Father of Shelemiah. Name (the same as H3569 (כּוּשִׁי) Cushi, the name of two Israelites). Name in lineage or family context.

H3569.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H3569.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at Zep.1.1; only referred to as Cushi (כּוּשִׁי); a son of Gedaliah;  father of Zephaniah.
H3569.meaning: patronymically from H3568 (כּוּשׁ) a Cushite, or descendant of Cush
H3569.significance: Son of Gedaliah. Name (patronymically from H3568 (כּוּשׁ) a Cushite, or descendant of Cush). Name in lineage or family context.

H3566.d: Emperor living at the time of Exile and Return
H3566.s: An emperor Persia living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ch.36.22; referred to as Cyrus (כּ֫וֹרֶשׁ), or Cyrus (Aramiac כּ֫וֹרֶשׁ).
H3566.f: Persian Emperor who decreed the rebuilding of the Temple
H3566.meaning: Hitchcock: as miserable; as heir. BehindTheName: From Old Persian Kuruš, possibly meaning 'young' or 'humiliator of the enemy'.
H3566.significance: Persian Emperor. Name meaning: or (Ezra 1:1 (last time),2) כֹּרֶשׁ; from the Persians Koresh (or Cyru...

H1813.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1813.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Est.9.7; only referred to as Dalphon (דַּלְפוֹן);  son of Haman; a brother of Parshandatha, Aspatha, Poratha, Adalia, Aridatha, Parmashta, Arisai, Aridai and Vaizatha.
H1813.f: Son of Haman, enemy of the Jews
H1813.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1811 (דָּלַף); dripping Dalphon, a son of Haman

G1152.d: Woman living at the time of the New Testament
G1152.s: A woman living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Act.17.34; only referred to as Damaris (Δάμαρις).
G1152.f: Woman who believed Paul's message in Athens
G1152.meaning: Hitchcock: a little woman. BehindTheName: Probably means 'calf, heifer, girl' from Greek δάμαλις (damalis).
G1152.significance: Minor figure; name: probably from the base of G1150 (δαμάζω) perhaps gentle; Damaris, an Athenian woman

H1835.d: Jacob's son living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1835.s: A man who founded the tribe of Dan  living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.30.6; only referred to as Dan (דָּן);  son of Israel and Bilhah; a brother of Naphtali;  half-brother of: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Gad, Asher, Issachar, Zebulun, Dinah, Joseph and Benjamin;  father of Hushim.
H1835.f: Fifth son of Jacob, founder of Israelite tribe
H1835.meaning: Hitchcock: judgment; he that judges. BehindTheName: Means 'he judged' in Hebrew, from דִּין (din) 'to judge'.
H1835.significance: Son of Israel. Name (from H1777 (דִּין); judge Dan, one of the sons of Jacob; also the trib...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1840.d: Prophet living at the time of Exile and Return
H1840.s: A prophet living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezk.14.14; referred to as Daniel (דָּנִיֵּאל, דָּנִאֵל), or Daniel (Aramiac דָּנִיֵּאל, דָּנִאֵל), or Belteshazzar (בֵּלְטְשַׁאצַּר), or Belteshazzar (Aramiac בֵּלְטְשַׁאצַּר) (KJV= Daniel) or Daniel (Δανιήλ).
H1840.meaning: From דָּן (dan), judge, + אֵל (el), God. Daniel = God is my judge. Exile prophet (Dan 1:6). Hitchcock: judgment of God; God my judge. BehindTheName: From Hebrew דָּנִיֵּאל meaning 'God is my judge', from דִּין (din) 'to judge' and אֵל (ʾel) 'God'.
H1840.significance: Interpreter of dreams and visions; faithful in the court of Babylon. Lion’s den (Dan 6); type of the wise one who keeps the law and is vindicated by God.

H1841.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1841.s: A priest living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.8.2; only referred to as Daniel (דָּנִיֵּאל, דָּנִאֵל).
H1841.f: Priest who returned from Babylonian exile
H1841.meaning: Hitchcock: judgment of God; God my judge. BehindTheName: From Hebrew דָּנִיֵּאל meaning 'God is my judge', from דִּין (din) 'to judge' and אֵל (ʾel) 'God'.
H1841.significance: Returned priest. Name ((Aramaic) corresponding to H1840 (דָנִיֵּאל) Danijel, the Hebrew proph...). Name fits cultic or priestly role.

H1873.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living before Israel's Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.6; only referred to as Dara (דָּרַע);  son of Zerah; a brother of Zabdi, Ethan, Heman and Calcol.
H1873.f: Son of Zerah, grandson of Judah
H1873.meaning: probably a contraction from H1862 (דַּרְדַּע) Dara, an Israelite
H1873.significance: Minor figure; name: probably a contraction from H1862 (דַּרְדַּע) Dara, an Israelite

H1862.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H1862.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.4.31; only referred to as Darda (דַּרְדַּע);  son of Mahol; a brother of Ethan, Heman and Calcol.
H1862.f: Wise man surpassed by Solomon's wisdom
H1862.significance: Minor figure; name: apparently from H1858 (דַּר) and H1843 (דֵּעַ); pearl of knowledge Darda, an Israelite

H1867.d: Emperor Darius I, 'the Great', living at the time of Exile and Return
H1867.s: An emperor of Persia living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.4.5; referred to as Darius (דָּֽרְיָ֫וֶשׁ), or Darius (Aramiac דָּֽרְיָ֫וֶשׁ); father of Ahasuerus i.e. Xerxes I.
H1867.f: Persian king who decreed the rebuilding of the Temple
H1867.meaning: Hitchcock: he that informs himself. BehindTheName: From Old Persian Darayauš meaning 'possessing goodness', from daraya 'to possess' and vau 'good'.
H1867.significance: Persian emperor. Name meaning: of Persian origin Darejavesh, a title (rather than name) of several Pe...

H1874.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1874.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.56; only referred to as Darkon (דַּרְקוֹן).
H1874.f: Ancestor of a family of temple servants
H1874.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: of uncertain derivation Darkon, one of 'Solomon's servants'

H1885.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1885.s: A man from the tribe of Reuben living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.16.1; only referred to as Dathan (דָּתָן);  son of Eliab; a brother of Abiram and Nemuel.
H1885.f: Reubenite who rebelled against Moses and Aaron
H1885.significance: Son of Eliab. Name (of uncertain derivation Dathan, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H4353.d: Manasseh's son living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H4353.s: A man from the tribe of Manasseh living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.50.23; referred to as Machir (מָכִיר), or Machirite (NIV= Makirite)  (מָכִירִי);  son of Manasseh and Aramitess; a brother of Asriel; husband of Maacah;  father or founder of Gilead, daughter of Machir, Peresh, Sheresh and Hammolecheth; founder of Gilead.
H4353.f: Son of Manasseh; father (ie re-founder) of Gilead
H4353.significance: Manasseh's son. Name (from H4376 (מָכַר); salesman Makir, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H4918.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H4918.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.3.19; only referred to as Meshullam (מְשֻׁלָּם);  son of Zerubbabel; a brother of Hananiah, Shelomith, Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, Jushab-hesed, Abiud.
H4918.f: Son of Zerubbabel, a descendant of David.
H4918.meaning: from H7999 (שָׁלַם); allied Meshullam, the name of seventeen Israelites
H4918.significance: Minor figure; name: from H7999 (שָׁלַם); allied Meshullam, the name of seventeen Israelites

H6547.d: Woman living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness - unnamed daughter of Pharaoh
H6547.s: A woman of the Egyptians living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Exo.2.5; only referred to as daughter of Pharaoh;  unnamed daughter of: Pharaoh;  adoptive mother of: Moses.
H6547.f: Daughter of Pharaoh - Rescued and adopted Moses
H6547.significance: Minor figure; name: of Egyptian derivation Paroh, a general title of Egyptian kings

H6317.d: Woman living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness - unnamed daughter of Putiel
H6317.s: A woman living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Exo.6.25; only referred to as daughter of Putiel;  unnamed daughter of: Putiel; wife of Eleazar;  mother of Phinehas.
H6317.f: Daughter of Putiel - Wife of Eleazar the priest
H6317.significance: Minor figure; name: from an unused root (probably meaning to disparage) and H410 (אֵל); contempt of God Putiel, an...

H5571.d: Woman living at the time of Exile and Return - unnamed daughter of Sanballat
H5571.s: A woman living at the time of Exile and Return, inferred at Neh.13.28; only referred to as daughter of Sanballat;  unnamed daughter of: Sanballat; wife of son of Joiada.
H5571.f: Married to a grandson of the high priest Eliashib
H5571.significance: Priest's wife. Name (of foreign origin Sanballat, a Persian satrap of Samaria). Name fits cultic or priestly role.

H7935.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H7935.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.3.21; only referred to as Shecaniah (שְׁכַנְיָהוּ);  son of Hananiah; a brother of Pelatiah, Jeshaiah, Rephaiah, Arnan and Obadiah;  father of Shemaiah.
H7935.significance: Son of Hananiah. Name (or (prolonged) שְׁכַנְיָהוּ; from H7931 (שָׁכַן) and H3050 (יָהּ); Jah...). Name in lineage or family context.

H3876.d: Woman living at the time of the Patriarchs - unnamed older daughter of Lot
H3876.s: A woman living at the time of the Patriarchs, inferred at Gen.19.30a; only referred to as daughter1 of Lot;  unnamed older daughter of: Lot;  daughter of Lot;  mother of Moab; a sister of daughter2 of Lot.
H3876.f: Elder daughter of Lot; mother of Moab
H3876.meaning: the same as H3875 (לוֹט) Lot, Abraham's nephew
H3876.significance: Sister of daughter2_of_Lot. Name meaning: the same as H3875 (לוֹט) Lot, Abraham's nephew

H1732.d: King living at the time of United Monarchy
H1732.s: A king of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at Rut.4.17; referred to as David (KJV, NIV= David) (דָּוִד), or David (Δαυείδ, Δαυίδ, Δαβίδ);  son of Jesse and Nahash; a brother of Eliab, Abinadab, Shimeah, Zeruiah, Abigail (?), Nethanel, Raddai, Ozem and Elihu; husband of Michal, Abigail, Ahinoam, Maacah, Haggith, Abital, Eglah and Bathsheba;  father of Amnon, Chileab, Abs
H1732.meaning: From דּוֹד (dod), beloved, or root דָּוִד (David). David = beloved. Second king of Israel (1 Sam 16:13). Hitchcock: well-beloved, dear. BehindTheName: From Hebrew דָּוִד (Dawiḏ), from דּוֹד (doḏ) 'beloved' or 'uncle'.
H1732.significance: King after God’s heart (1 Sam 13:14); type of Christ as king (2 Sam 7; Luke 1:32). Shepherd, psalmist, covenant recipient. His line endures forever.

H1688.s: A king of the Amorites living before Israel's Monarchy, only mentioned at Jos.10.3; only referred to as Debir (דְּבִיר).
H1688.f: Amorite king of Eglon, defeated by Joshua
H1688.significance: Minor figure; name: or (shortened) דְּבִר; (Joshua 13:26 (but see H3810 (לֹא דְבַר))), the same as H1687 (דְּבִיר)...

H1683.s: A Judge living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jdg.4.4; only referred to as Deborah (דְּבוֹרָה); wife of Lappidoth.
H1683.f: Prophetess and judge who led Israel to victory over Canaanites.
H1683.meaning: From דְּבוֹרָה (devorah), bee. Deborah = bee. Prophetess and judge (Judg 4:4). Hitchcock: word; thing; a bee. BehindTheName: Means 'bee' in Hebrew.
H1683.significance: Judged Israel; went with Barak to battle (Judg 4:9). “Mother in Israel” (Judg 5:7). Name (bee) as the one who brought the sting of judgment and the honey of deliverance.

H1719.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1719.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.25.3; only referred to as Dedan (רֹדָן);  son of Jokshan; a brother of Sheba;  father of Asshurim, Letushim and Leummim.
H1719.meaning: Hitchcock: their breasts; friendship; a judge
H1719.significance: Son of Jokshan. Name (or (prolonged) דְּדָנֶה; (Ezekiel 25:13), of uncertain derivation Deda...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1723.d: Word sometimes translated as a name
H1723.s: A group or a word meaning "that is", only mentioned at Ezr.4.9; only referred to as Dehavite (דֵּהָיֵא).
H1723.f: People group who opposed the rebuilding of Jerusalem
H1723.meaning: (Aramaic) of uncertain derivation Dahava, a people colonized in Samaria
H1723.significance: Minor figure; name: (Aramaic) of uncertain derivation Dahava, a people colonized in Samaria

H1857.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H1857.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.4.9; only referred to as Deker (דֶּ֫קֶר);  father of Ben-deker.
H1857.f: Son of Abinadab, one of Solomon's twelve officers
H1857.meaning: from H1856 (דָּקַר); a stab Deker, an Israelite
H1857.significance: Father of Ben-deker. Name (from H1856 (דָּקַר); a stab Deker, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H1806.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1806.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.3.24; only referred to as Delaiah (דְּלָיָ֫הוּ);  son of Elioenai; a brother of Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan and Anani.
H1806.meaning: Hitchcock: the poor of the Lord
H1806.significance: Minor figure; name: or (prolonged) דְּלָיָהוּxlit Dᵉlâyâhhûw corrected to Dᵉlâyâhûw; from H1802 (דָּלָה) and H3050...

H1807.s: A woman living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jdg.16.4; only referred to as Delilah (דְּלִילָה); wife of Samson.
H1807.meaning: Hitchcock: poor; small; head of hair. BehindTheName: Probably from Hebrew דָּלַל (dalal) 'to be weak, to languish'.
H1807.significance: woman living before israel's monarchy. Name meaning: from H1809 (דָּלַל); languishing Delilah, a Philistine woman

G1214.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G1214.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Col.4.14; only referred to as Demas (Δημᾶς).
G1214.f: Companion of Paul who later deserted him
G1214.meaning: Greek Δημᾶς (Demas); possibly short for Demetrius. Demas = companion of Paul (Col 4:14). Hitchcock: popular
G1214.significance: Once with Paul (Phlm 24); later “in love with this present world” (2 Tim 4:10). Name as the one who turned away—warning against apostasy.

G1216.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G1216.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.19.24; only referred to as Demetrius (Δημήτριος).
G1216.f: Silversmith who opposed Paul in Ephesus
G1216.meaning: Hitchcock: belonging to corn, or to Ceres
G1216.significance: man living at the time of the new testament. Name meaning: from (Ceres) Demetrius, the name of an Ephesian and of a Christian

H1845.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1845.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.1.14; referred to as Deuel (דְּעוּאֵל), or Reuel (רְעוּאֵל);  father of Eliasaph.
H1845.f: Father of Eliasaph, leader of the tribe of Gad
H1845.significance: Father of Eliasaph. Name (from H3045 (יָדַע) and H410 (אֵל); known of God Deuel, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H1691.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1691.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at Hos.1.3; only referred to as Diblaim (דִּבְלַ֫יִם);  father of Gomer.
H1691.significance: Father of Gomer. Name (dual from the masculine of H1690 (דְּבֵלָה); two cakes Diblajim, a sym...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1704.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1704.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Lev.24.11; only referred to as Dibri (דִּבְרִי);  father of Shelomith.
H1704.f: Father of Shelomith, whose son blasphemed God's name
H1704.significance: Father of Shelomith. Name (from H1697 (דָּבָר); wordy Dibri, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H1853.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1853.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.10.27; only referred to as Diklah (דִּקְלָה);  son of Joktan; a brother of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah, Hadoram, Uzal, Obal, Abimael, Sheba, Ophir, Havilah and Jobab.
H1853.significance: Son of Joktan. Name (of foreign origin Diklah, a region of Arabia). Name in lineage or family context.

H1783.d: Jacob's daughter living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1783.s: A woman living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.30.21; only referred to as Dinah (דִּינָה);  daughter of Israel and Leah; a sister of Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar and Zebulun;  half-sister of: Dan, Naphtali, Gad, Asher, Joseph and Benjamin.
H1783.meaning: Hitchcock: judgment; who judges. BehindTheName: Means 'judged' in Hebrew, from דִּין (din) 'to judge'.
H1783.significance: Jacob's daughter. Name meaning: feminine of H1779 (דִּין); justice Dinah, the daughter of Jacob

H1784.d: Word sometimes translated as a name
H1784.s: A group or a word meaning "judges", only mentioned at Ezr.4.9; only referred to as Dinaite (דִּינָיֵא).
H1784.f: People group who opposed the rebuilding of Jerusalem
H1784.meaning: (Aramaic) partial from uncertain primitive a Dinaite or inhabitant of some unknown Assyria province
H1784.significance: Minor figure; name: (Aramaic) partial from uncertain primitive a Dinaite or inhabitant of some unknown Assyria province

G1354.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G1354.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Act.17.34; only referred to as Dionysius (Διονύσιος).
G1354.f: Areopagite who believed Paul's message in Athens
G1354.significance: Minor figure; name: from (Bacchus) reveller; Dionysius, an Athenian

G1361.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G1361.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at 3Jn.1.9; only referred to as Diotrephes (Διοτρεφής).
G1361.significance: Minor figure; name: from the alternate of G2203 (Ζεύς) and G5142 (τρέφω) Jove-nourished; Diotrephes, an opponent of...

H1789.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1789.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.21; referred to as Dishan (דִּישָׁן), or Dishan (דִּישֹׁן);  son of Seir; a brother of Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Dishon, Ezer and Timna;  father of Uz, Aran.
H1789.significance: Son of Seir. Name (another form of H1787 (דִּישׁוֹן) Dishan, an Edomite). Name in lineage or family context.

H1787.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1787.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.21; referred to as Dishon (דִּישֹׁן), or Dishon (דִּישָׁן);  son of Seir; a brother of Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Ezer, Dishan and Timna;  father of Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, Cheran.
H1787.f: Descendant of Seir the Horite, son of Anah
H1787.significance: Son of Seir. Name ((Diyshon, the same as H1788 (דִּישֹׁן) Dishon, the name of two Edomite...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1721.s: People from Dodan(?) of the Greeks, first mentioned at Gen.10.4; referred to as Dodanim or Rodanim (KJV= Dodanim, NIV= Rodanites)  (רוֹדָנִים); descended from Javan along with Elishah, Tarshish and Kittim.
H1721.f: Descendants of Javan, son of Japheth
H1721.meaning: or (by orthographical error) רֹדָנִים (1 Chronicles 1:7); a plural of uncertain derivation...
H1721.significance: Early nation. Name meaning: or (by orthographical error) רֹדָנִים (1 Chronicles 1:7); a plural of ...

H1735.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1735.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ch.20.37; only referred to as Dodavahu (דּוֹדָוָהוּ);  father of Eliezer.
H1735.f: Prophet who rebuked Jehoshaphat for his alliance with Ahaziah
H1735.meaning: from H1730 (דּוֹד) and H3050 (יָהּ); love of Jah Dodavah, an Israelite
H1735.significance: Father of Eliezer. Name (from H1730 (דּוֹד) and H3050 (יָהּ); love of Jah Dodavah, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H1734.d: Warrior living at the time of United Monarchy
H1734.s: A warrior living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.23.9; referred to as Dodo (דּוֹדוֹ), or Dodai (דּוֹדַי);  father of Eleazar.
H1734.f: Father of Eleazar, one of David's mighty men
H1734.significance: David's warrior. Name (from H1730 (דּוֹד); loving Dodo, the name of three Israelites). Name fits martial or military role.

H1673.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H1673.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.21.7; only referred to as Doeg (דֹּאֵג).
H1673.f: Edomite chief shepherd who betrayed David to Saul
H1673.meaning: Hitchcock: careful, who acts with uneasiness
H1673.significance: David's opponent. Name meaning: or (fully) דּוֹאֵג; active participle of H1672 (דָּאַג); anxious Doeg,...

G1409.d: Woman living at the time of the New Testament
G1409.s: A woman living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Act.24.24; only referred to as Drusilla (Δρούσιλλα); wife of Felix.
G1409.f: Jewish wife of Felix, the Roman governor
G1409.meaning: Greek Δρούσιλλα (Drousilla); from Latin Drusilla. Drusilla = wife of Felix (Acts 24:24). Hitchcock: watered by the dew
G1409.significance: Jewish wife of the Roman governor; with Felix heard Paul speak of righteousness and judgment (Acts 24:25). Felix was afraid—but did not repent.

H1746.d: Arabian living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1746.s: A man of the Arabs living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.25.14; only referred to as Dumah (דּוּמָה);  son of Ishmael; a brother of Nebaioth, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam, Mishma, Massa, Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, Kedemah and Mahalath.
H1746.f: Son of Ishmael and grandson of Abraham
H1746.meaning: the same as H1745 (דּוּמָה) Dumah, a tribe and region of Arabia
H1746.significance: Son of Ishmael. Name (the same as H1745 (דּוּמָה) Dumah, a tribe and region of Arabia). Name in lineage or family context.

H5858.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H5858.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.23; only referred to as Ebal (עֵיבָל);  son of Shobal; a brother of Alvan, Manahath, Shepho and Onam.
H5858.f: Son of Shobal and descendant of Seir the Horite
H5858.significance: Son of Shobal. Name (perhaps from an unused root probably meaning to be bald; bare Ebal, a ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5651.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H5651.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Ezr.8.6; only referred to as Ebed (עֶ֫בֶד); a son of Jonathan.
H5651.f: Descendant of Adin who returned with Ezra
H5651.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H5650 (עֶבֶד) Ebed, the name of two Israelites

H5663.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5663.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at Jer.38.7; only referred to as Ebed-melech (עֶ֫בֶד מֶ֫לֶךְ).
H5663.f: Ethiopian eunuch who rescued Jeremiah from a cistern
H5663.significance: man living at the time of divided monarchy. Name meaning: from H5650 (עֶבֶד) and H4428 (מֶלֶךְ); servant of a king Ebed-Melek, a...

H5677.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5677.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.12; only referred to as Eber (עֵ֫בֶר);  son of Elpaal; a brother of Misham, Shemed, Beriah, Shema, Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber, Ishmerai, Izliah and Jobab.
H5677.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H5676 (עֵבֶר) Eber, the name of two patriarchs and four Israelites

H0043.d: Levite living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0043.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Exo.6.24; referred to as Ebiasaph (אֶבְיָסָף, אֲבִיאָסָף), or Abiasaph (אֲבִיאָסָף), or Asaph (אָסָף);  son of Korah; a brother of Assir and Elkanah;  father of Assir and Kore.
H0043.meaning: Hitchcock: a father that gathers or adds
H0043.significance: Son of Korah. Name (contracted from H23 (אֲבִיאָסָף) Ebjasaph, an Israelite). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H5731.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5731.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ch.29.12; only referred to as Eden (עֵ֫דֶן); a son of Joah.
H5731.f: Levite who assisted in Hezekiah's temple cleansing
H5731.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H5730 (עֵדֶן) (masculine) Eden, the region of Adam's home

H5740.d: Levite living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5740.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.23.23; only referred to as Eder (עֵ֫דֶר);  son of Mushi; a brother of Mahli and Jerimoth.
H5740.f: Levite descendant of Merari during David's reign
H5740.significance: Son of Mushi. Name (the same as H5739 (עֵדֶר) Eder, the name of an Israelite and of two pl...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H5738.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5738.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin  living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.15; only referred to as Eder (עֶ֫דֶר);  son of Beriah; a brother of Arad, Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth, Zebadiah, Michael, Ishpah and Joha.
H5738.f: Descendant of Benjamin, son of Beriah
H5738.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5737 (עֲדַר); an arrangement (i.e. drove) Eder, an Israelite

H5698.d: Woman living at the time of United Monarchy
H5698.s: A woman living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.3.5; only referred to as Eglah (עֶגְלָה); wife of David;  mother of Ithream.
H5698.f: David's wife and mother of Ithream
H5698.significance: David's wife. Name meaning: the same as H5697 (עֶגְלָה) Eglah, a wife of David

H5700.s: A king in Moab living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jdg.3.12; only referred to as Eglon (עֶגְלוֹן).
H5700.f: King of Moab who oppressed Israel
H5700.significance: Moabite king. Name (from H5695 (עֵגֶל); vituline Eglon, the name of a place in Palestine a...). Name in royal or ruling context.

H4714.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H4714.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.10.6; only referred to as Egypt (מִצְרַ֫יִם);  son of Ham; a brother of Canaan, Cush and Put;  father of Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim, Pathrusim, Casluhim and Caphtorim.
H4714.f: Descendant of Ham, ancestor of African peoples
H4714.meaning: Hebrew מִצְרַיִם (Mitzrayim); dual of מָצוֹר (matzor), siege. Egypt = the two straits (or land of bondage). Hitchcock: that troubles or oppresses; anguish
H4714.significance: House of slavery (Ex 20:2); place of sojourn and exodus. “Out of Egypt I called my son” (Hos 11:1; Matt 2:15). Type of the world and of deliverance.

H0164.s: A Judge from the tribe of Benjamin living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jdg.3.15; referred to as Ehud (אֵהוּד), or Ehud (אֵחוּד); a son of Gera;  father of Naaman, Ahijah, Gera, Uzza and Ahihud.
H0164.f: Left-handed Benjamite judge who delivered Israel from Moabite oppression
H0164.meaning: From אֶחָד (echad), one; Ehud = united. Left-handed judge (Judg 3:15). Hitchcock: he that praises
H0164.significance: Judge who delivered Israel from Moab by killing Eglon (Judg 3:21). Left-handedness as unexpected weapon; name (united) as the one who unites Israel against the oppressor.

H6134.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H6134.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.27; only referred to as Eker (עֵקֶר);  son of Ram; a brother of Maaz and Jamin.
H6134.f: Son of Ram, descendant of Judah
H6134.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H6133 (עֵקֶר) Eker, an Israelite

H0414.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0414.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.4.18; only referred to as Ela (אֵלָא);  father of Shimei.
H0414.f: Son of Uzzi, an official under Solomon
H0414.meaning: a variation of H424 (אֵלָה)lemma אִלָה first vowel, corrected to אֵלָה; oak Ela, an Israelite
H0414.significance: Father of Shimei. Name (a variation of H424 (אֵלָה)lemma אִלָה first vowel, corrected to אֵלָה...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0425.s: A man from the tribe of Judah  living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.4.15; only referred to as Elah (אֵלָה);  son of Caleb; a brother of Achsah, Iru and Naam;  father of Kenaz and Jehallelel(?).
H0425.f: Son of Caleb; father of Kenaz
H0425.meaning: Hitchcock: an oak; a curse; perjury
H0425.significance: Son of Caleb. Name (the same as H424 (אֵלָה)lemma אִלָה first vowel, corrected to אֵלָה El...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5867.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5867.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.24; only referred to as Elam (עֵילָם);  son of Shashak; a brother of Ishpan, Eber, Eliel, Abdon, Zichri, Hanan, Hananiah, Anthothijah, Iphdeiah and Penuel.
H5867.meaning: Hitchcock: a young man; a virgin; a secret
H5867.significance: Minor figure; name: or עוֹלָם; (Ezra 10:2; Jeremiah 49:36), probably from H5956 (עָלַם); hidden, i.e. distant Elam,...

H0501.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0501.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.8.37; referred to as Eleasah (אֶלְעָשָׂה), or Eshek (עֵ֫שֶׁק);  son of Binea; a brother of Raphah and Azel;  father of Ulam, Jeush and Eliphelet.
H0501.f: Descendant of Saul and Jonathan, son of Rapha
H0501.meaning: from H410 (אֵל) and H6213 (עָשָׂה); God has made Elasah, the name of four Israelites
H0501.significance: Saul's family. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H6213 (עָשָׂה); God has made Elasah, the name of f...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0420.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0420.s: A man of the Midianites living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.25.4; only referred to as Eldaah (אֶלְדָּעָה);  son of Midian; a brother of Ephah, Epher, Hanoch and Abida.
H0420.f: Son of Midian, grandson of Abraham
H0420.significance: Son of Midian. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H3045 (יָדַע); God of knowledge Eldaah, a son of M...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0419.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0419.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.11.26; only referred to as Eldad (אֶלְדָּד).
H0419.f: Prophet who prophesied in the Israelite camp
H0419.meaning: Hitchcock: favored of God; love of God
H0419.significance: man living at the time of egypt and wilderness. Name meaning: from H410 (אֵל) and H1730 (דּוֹד); God has loved Eldad, an Israelite

H0496.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0496.s: A man from the tribe of Ephraim living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.21; only referred to as Elead (אֶלְעָד);  son of Ephraim; a brother of Shuthelah, Becher, Tahan, Ezer and Beriah.
H0496.f: Ephraimite killed by the men of Gath
H0496.significance: Minor figure; name: from H410 (אֵל) and H5749 (עוּד); God has testified Elad, an Israelite

H0497.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0497.s: A man from the tribe of Ephraim living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.20; only referred to as Eleadah (אֶלְעָדָה); a son of Tahath;  father of Tahath.
H0497.f: Son of Ephraim, ancestor of Joshua
H0497.meaning: from H410 (אֵל) and H5710 (עָדָה); God has decked Eladah, an Israelite
H0497.significance: Son of Tahath. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H5710 (עָדָה); God has decked Eladah, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0499.d: High Priest living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0499.s: A High Priest from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Exo.6.23; only referred to as Eleazar (אֶלְעָזָר);  son of Aaron and Elisheba; a brother of Nadab, Abihu and Ithamar; husband of daughter of Putiel;  father of Phinehas.
H0499.f: Son of Aaron, high priest after his father
H0499.meaning: Hitchcock: help of God, court of God
H0499.significance: A High Priest. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H5826 (עָזַר); God (is) helper Elazar, the name of...). Name fits cultic or priestly role.

G1648.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
G1648.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Mat.1.15; only referred to as Eleazar (Ἐλεάζαρ); a son of Eliud;  father of Matthan.
G1648.f: Ancestor of Jesus, son of Eliud; father of Matthan
G1648.meaning: Greek Ἐλεάζαρ (Eleazar); from Hebrew אֶלְעָזָר (Elazar), God has helped. Eleazar = God has helped. In genealogy (Matt 1:15). Hitchcock: help of God, court of God
G1648.significance: In the line of Jesus (Matt 1:15). Name (God has helped) as the line that leads to the one who is our help.

H0445.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0445.s: A warrior living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.21.19; only referred to as Elhanan (אֶלְחָנָן); a son of Jaare-oregim.
H0445.f: Warrior from Bethlehem who killed Goliath's brother Lahmi
H0445.meaning: Hitchcock: grace, or gift, or mercy of God
H0445.significance: David's warrior. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H2603 (חָנַן); God (is) gracious Elchanan, an Isra...). Name fits martial or military role.

H5941.d: High Priest living at the time of United Monarchy
H5941.f: High priest and judge of Israel at Shiloh
H5941.meaning: Hitchcock: the offering or lifting up | Eli, my God, my God. BehindTheName: Means 'ascension' in Hebrew.
H5941.significance: A High Priest. Name (from H5927 (עָלָה); lofty Eli, an Israelite highpriest). Name fits cultic or priestly role.

H0446.d: David's brother living at the time of United Monarchy
H0446.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.16.6; only referred to as Eliab (אֱלִיאָב);  son of Jesse; a brother of David, Abinadab, Shimeah, Nethanel, Raddai, Ozem, Zeruiah, Abigail(?) and Elihu;  father of Abihail.
H0446.meaning: Hitchcock: God is my father; God is the father
H0446.significance: David's brother. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H1 (אָב); God of (his) father Eliab, the name of s...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0450.d: David's son living at the time of United Monarchy
H0450.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.5.16; referred to as Eliada (אֶלְיָדָע), or Beeliada (בְּעֶלְיָדָע);  son of David; a brother of Amnon, Chileab, Absalom, Adonijah, Shephatiah, Ithream, Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon, Ibhar, Elishua, Nepheg, Japhia, Elishama, Eliphelet, Tamar, Elpelet, Nogah and Jerimoth.
H0450.f: Son of David born in Jerusalem
H0450.significance: David's son. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H3045 (יָדַע); God (is) knowing Eljada, the name o...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0455.d: Warrior living at the time of United Monarchy
H0455.s: A warrior living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.23.32; only referred to as Eliahba (אֶלְיַחְבָּא).
H0455.f: Shaalbonite, one of David's mighty men
H0455.significance: David's warrior. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H2244 (חָבָא); God will hide Eljachba, an Israelit...). Name fits martial or military role.

H0471.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0471.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.18.18; only referred to as Eliakim (אֶלְיָקִים); a son of Hilkiah.
H0471.significance: Son of Hilkiah. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H6965 (קוּם); God of raising Eljakim, the name of ...). Name in lineage or family context.

G1662.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
G1662.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Mat.1.13; only referred to as Eliakim (Ἐλιακείμ); a son of Abiud;  father of Azor.
G1662.f: Ancestor of Jesus in Matthew's genealogy
G1662.significance: Son of Abiud. Name (of Hebrew origin (H0471) Eliakim, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0463.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0463.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.11.3; referred to as Eliam (אֱלִיעָם), or Ammiel (עַמִּיאֵל);  father of Bathsheba.
H0463.f: Father of Bathsheba, wife of Uriah the Hittite
H0463.significance: Father of Bathsheba. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H5971 (עַם); God of (the) people Eliam, an Israeli...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0460.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0460.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.3.24; only referred to as Eliasaph (אֶלְיָסָף); a son of Lael.
H0460.f: Son of Lael, leader of the Gershonite Levites
H0460.significance: Minor figure; name: from H410 (אֵל) and H3254 (יָסַף); God (is) gatherer Eljasaph, the name of two Israelites

H0475.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0475.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.3.24; only referred to as Eliashib (אֶלְיָשִׁיב);  son of Elioenai; a brother of Hodaviah, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah and Anani.
H0475.significance: Minor figure; name: from H410 (אֵל) and H7725 (שׁוּב); God will restore Eljashib, the name of six Israelites

H0448.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0448.s: A musician from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.25.4; only referred to as Eliathah (אֳלִיאָ֫תָה);  son of Heman; a brother of Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Giddalti, Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.
H0448.f: Son of Heman, appointed as a musician in David's time
H0448.significance: Son of Heman. Name (or (contraction) אֱלִיָּתָה; from H410 (אֵל) and H225 (אוּת); God of (...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H0449.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0449.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.34.21; only referred to as Elidad (אֱלִידָד); a son of Chislon.
H0449.f: Son of Chislon, leader from the tribe of Benjamin
H0449.significance: Minor figure; name: from the same as H419 (אֶלְדָּד); God of (his) love Elidad, an Israelite

H0454.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0454.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.3.23; only referred to as Elioenai (אֶלְיוֹעֵינַי);  son of Neariah; a brother of Hizkiah and Azrikam;  father of Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah and Anani.
H0454.f: A descendant of David through Jeconiah.
H0454.meaning: Hitchcock: toward him are mine eyes; or to him are my fountains
H0454.significance: Son of Neariah. Name (or (shortened) אֶלְיוֹעֵינַי; from H413 (אֵל) and H3068 (יְהֹוָה) and ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0447.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0447.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.22; only referred to as Eliel (אֱלִיאֵל);  son of Shashak; a brother of Ishpan, Eber, Abdon, Zichri, Hanan, Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah, Iphdeiah and Penuel.
H0447.f: Descendant of Shashak from the tribe of Benjamin
H0447.significance: Minor figure; name: from H410 (אֵל) repeated; God of (his) God Eliel, the name of nine Israelites

H0462.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0462.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.20; only referred to as Elienai (אֱלִיעֵינַי);  son of Shimei; a brother of Jakim, Zichri, Zabdi, Zillethai, Eliel, Adaiah, Beraiah and Shimrath.
H0462.meaning: Hitchcock: the God of my eyes
H0462.significance: Minor figure; name: probably contracted for H454 (אֶלְיְהוֹעֵינַי) Elienai, an Israelite

H0461.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0461.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.8; only referred to as Eliezer (אֱלִיעֶ֫זֶר);  son of Becher; a brother of Zemirah, Joash, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth and Alemeth.
H0461.f: A descendant of Benjamin; son of Becher.
H0461.meaning: Hitchcock: help, or court, of my God
H0461.significance: Minor figure; name: from H410 (אֵל) and H5828 (עֵזֶר); God of help Eliezer, the name of a Damascene and of ten...

G1663.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
G1663.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at Luk.3.29; only referred to as Eliezer (Ἐλιέζερ); a son of Jorim;  father of Joshua.
G1663.meaning: Hitchcock: help, or court, of my God
G1663.significance: Son of Jorim. Name (of Hebrew origin (H0461) Eliezer, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0456.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0456.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.4.3; only referred to as Elihoreph (אֱלִיחֹ֫רֶף);  son of Seraiah; a brother of Ahijah.
H0456.meaning: Hitchcock: god of winter, or of youth
H0456.significance: Minor figure; name: from H410 (אֵל) and H2779 (חֹרֶף); God of autumn Elichoreph, an Israelite

H0453.d: David's brother living at the time of United Monarchy
H0453.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.27.18; only referred to as Elihu (אֱלִיהוּ);  son of Jesse; a brother of David, Eliab, Abinadab, Shimeah, Nethanel, Raddai, Zeruiah, Abigail(?) and Ozem.
H0453.f: Leader of the tribe of Judah.
H0453.meaning: Hitchcock: he is my God himself
H0453.significance: Minor figure; name: or (fully) אֱלִיהוּא; from H410 (אֵל) and H1931 (הוּא); God of him Elihu, the name of one of...

H0452.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0452.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.27; only referred to as Elijah (אֵלִיָּה);  son of Jeroham; a brother of Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah, Jaareshiah and Zichri.
H0452.meaning: From אֵל (el) + יָהּ (Yah). Elijah = my God is YHWH. Prophet (1 Ki 17:1). Hitchcock: God the Lord, the strong Lord. BehindTheName: From Hebrew אֵלִיָּהוּ (ʾEliyyahu) meaning 'my God is Yahweh'.
H0452.significance: Prophet of fire; confronts Ahab and Baal (1 Ki 18). Type of the forerunner (Mal 4:5; Matt 17:3). Taken up in a whirlwind (2 Ki 2:11); John the Baptist comes in his spirit.

H0470.d: Warrior living at the time of United Monarchy
H0470.s: A warrior living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Sa.23.25; only referred to as Elika (אֱלִיקָא).
H0470.f: A Harodite, one of David's mighty men.
H0470.significance: Minor figure; name: from H410 (אֵל) and H6958 (קוֹא); God of rejection Elika, an Israelite

H0458.s: A man living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Rut.1.2; only referred to as Elimelech (אֱלִימֶ֫לֶךְ); son of Salma; husband of Naomi;  father of Mahlon, Chilion.
H0458.significance: Father of Mahlon. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H4428 (מֶלֶךְ); God of (the) king Elimelek, an Isr...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0465.d: Warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0465.s: A warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.11.35; only referred to as Eliphal (אֱלִיפָל); a son of Ur.
H0465.f: One of David's mighty men, son of Ur.
H0465.significance: Minor figure; name: from H410 (אֵל) and H6419 (פָּלַל); God of judgment Eliphal, an Israelite

H0464.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0464.s: A man of the Edomites living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.4; only referred to as Eliphaz (אֱלִיפַז); a son of Esau and Adah;  half-brother of: Reuel, Jeush, Jalam and Korah; husband of Timna;  father of Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, Kenaz, Amalek and Korah.
H0464.significance: Son of Esau. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H6337 (פָּז); God of gold Eliphaz, the name of one...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0466.d: Singer living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0466.s: A musician living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.15.18; only referred to as Eliphelehu (אֱלִיפְלֵ֫הוּ).
H0466.f: A Levite musician during David's reign.
H0466.meaning: from H410 (אֵל) and H6395 (פָּלָה); God of his distinction Eliphelehu, an Israelite
H0466.significance: A singer. Name meaning: from H410 (אֵל) and H6395 (פָּלָה); God of his distinction Eliphelehu,...

H0467.d: David's son living at the time of United Monarchy
H0467.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.3.6; referred to as Elpelet (אֶלְפָּֽלֶט), or Eliphelet (אֲלִיפֶ֫לֶט);  son of David; a brother of Amnon, Chileab, Absalom, Adonijah, Shephatiah, Ithream, Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon, Ibhar, Elishua, Nepheg, Japhia, Elishama, Eliada, Eliphelet, Tamar, Nogah and Jerimoth.
H0467.f: A son of David born in Jerusalem.
H0467.meaning: or (shortened) אֱלְפֶּלֶט; from H410 (אֵל) and H6405 (פַּלֵּט); God of deliverance Eliphelet or...
H0467.significance: David's son. Name (or (shortened) אֱלְפֶּלֶט; from H410 (אֵל) and H6405 (פַּלֵּט); God of...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0477.d: Prophet living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0477.s: A prophet living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ki.19.16; referred to as Elisha (אֱלִישָׁע), or Elisha (Ἐλισσαῖος); a son of Shaphat.
H0477.meaning: From אֵל (el) + יָשַׁע (yasha), save. Elisha = God is salvation. Successor of Elijah (1 Ki 19:16). Hitchcock: salvation of God. BehindTheName: From Hebrew אֱלִישָׁע meaning 'my God is salvation'.
H0477.significance: Asks for double portion (2 Ki 2:9); many signs—healing, provision, resurrection. Name (God saves) fits his ministry. Continuation of Elijah’s mantle.

H0473.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0473.s: A man of the Greeks living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.10.4; only referred to as Elishah (אֱלִישָׁה);  son of Javan; a brother of Tarshish, Kittim and Dodanim.
H0473.f: A son of Javan, who is grandson of Noah.
H0473.meaning: Hitchcock: it is God; the lamb of God: God that gives help
H0473.significance: Son of Javan. Name (probably of foreign derivation Elishah, a son of Javan). Name in lineage or family context.

H0476.d: David's son living at the time of United Monarchy
H0476.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.5.16; only referred to as Elishama (אֱלִישָׁמָע);  son of David; a brother of Amnon, Chileab, Absalom, Adonijah, Shephatiah, Ithream, Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon, Ibhar, Elishua, Nepheg, Japhia, Eliada, Eliphelet, Tamar, Elpelet, Nogah and Jerimoth.
H0476.f: A son of King David born in Jerusalem.
H0476.significance: David's son. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H8085 (שָׁמַע); God of hearing Elishama, the name ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0478.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0478.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ch.23.1; only referred to as Elishaphat (אֱלִישָׁפָט); a son of Zichri.
H0478.f: One of the captains who helped Jehoiada overthrow Athaliah.
H0478.significance: Minor figure; name: from H410 (אֵל) and H8199 (שָׁפַט); God of judgment Elishaphat, an Israelite

H0472.d: Woman living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0472.s: A woman from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Exo.6.23; only referred to as Elisheba (אֱלִישֶׁ֫בַע);  daughter of Amminadab; a sister of Nahshon; wife of Aaron;  mother of Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
H0472.significance: Minor figure; name: from H410 (אֵל) and H7651 (שֶׁבַע) (in the sense of H7650 (שָׁבַע)); God of (the) oath Elisheba,...

H0474.d: David's son living at the time of United Monarchy
H0474.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.5.15; referred to as Elishua (אֱלִישׁוּעַ), or Elishama (אֱלִישָׁמָע);  son of David; a brother of Amnon, Chileab, Absalom, Adonijah, Shephatiah, Ithream, Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon, Ibhar, Nepheg, Japhia, Elishama, Eliada, Eliphelet, Tamar, Elpelet, Nogah and Jerimoth.
H0474.f: A son of David born in Jerusalem.
H0474.significance: David's son. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H7769 (שׁוּעַ); God of supplication (or of riches)...). Name in lineage or family context.

G1664.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
G1664.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Mat.1.14; only referred to as Eliud (Ἐλιούδ); a son of Achim;  father of Eleazar.
G1664.significance: Son of Achim. Name (of Hebrew origin (H0410 and H01935) God of majesty; Eliud, an Israelit...). Name in lineage or family context.

G1665.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G1665.s: A man from the tribe of Levi through Aaron, living at the time of the New Testament, not named  in the Bible but implied at Luk.1.36; father of Elizabeth (Ἐλισάβετ) and the wife of Heli (?).
G1665.f: The wife of Zechariah and mother of John the Baptist.
G1665.meaning: BehindTheName: From Hebrew אֱלִישֶׁבַע (ʾElishevaʿ) meaning 'my God is an oath'.
G1665.significance: man living at the time of the new testament. Name meaning: of Hebrew origin (H0472) Elisabet, an Israelitess

H0469.d: Levite living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0469.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Exo.6.22; referred to as Elizaphan or Elzaphan (אֱלִיצָפָן);  son of Uzziel; a brother of Mishael, Sithri, Micah and Isshiah.
H0469.f: A Levite leader from the Kohathite clan.
H0469.meaning: or (shortened) אֶלְצָפָן; from H410 (אֵל) and H6845 (צָפַן); God of treasure Elitsaphan or...
H0469.significance: Son of Uzziel. Name (or (shortened) אֶלְצָפָן; from H410 (אֵל) and H6845 (צָפַן); God of tr...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H0468.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0468.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.1.5; only referred to as Elizur (אֱלִיצוּר); a son of Shedeur.
H0468.f: A leader from the tribe of Reuben.
H0468.meaning: Hitchcock: God is my strength; my rock; rock of God
H0468.significance: Son of Shedeur. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H6697 (צוּר); God of (the) rock Elitsur, an Israel...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0511.d: Levite living at the time of United Monarchy
H0511.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.1.1; only referred to as Elkanah (אֶלְקָנָה); a son of Jeroham; husband of Hannah and Peninnah;  father of Samuel.
H0511.f: The father of the prophet Samuel.
H0511.meaning: Hitchcock: God the zealous; the zeal of God
H0511.significance: Son of Jeroham. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H7069 (קָנָה); God has obtained Elkanah, the name ...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

G1678.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
G1678.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at Luk.3.28; only referred to as Elmadam (Ἐλμωδάμ); a son of Er;  father of Cosam.
G1678.meaning: of Hebrew origin (perhaps for H0486) Elmodam, an Israelite
G1678.significance: Son of Er. Name (of Hebrew origin (perhaps for H0486) Elmodam, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0493.d: Warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0493.s: A warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.11.46; only referred to as Elnaam (אֶלְנָ֑עַם);  father of Jeribai, Joshaviah.
H0493.f: Father of Jeribai and Joshaviah, David's mighty men.
H0493.significance: David's warrior. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H5276 (נָעֵם); God (is his) delight Elnaam, an Isr...). Name fits martial or military role.

H0494.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0494.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ki.24.8; only referred to as Elnathan (אֶלְנָתָן);  father of Nehushta.
H0494.f: Father of Nehushta, King Jehoiachin's mother.
H0494.meaning: Hitchcock: God hath given; the gift of God
H0494.significance: Father of Nehushta. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H5414 (נָתַן); God (is the) giver Elnathan, the na...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0356.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0356.s: A man from the tribe of Zebulun living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.14; referred to as Elon (אֵלוֹן), or Elonite (אֵלֹנִי);  son of Zebulun; a brother of Sered and Jahleel.
H0356.f: A son of Zebulun and founder of the Elonites.
H0356.significance: Son of Zebulun. Name (or (shortened) אֵלוֹן ; or אֵילֹן ; from H352 (אַיִל); oak-grove Elon,...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0508.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0508.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.8.11; only referred to as Elpaal (אֶלְפַּ֫עַל);  son of Shaharaim and Hushim; a brother of Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam, Jeuz, Sachia, Mirmah and Abitub;  father of Eber, Misham, Shemed, Beriah, Shema, Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber, Ishmerai, Izliah, Jobab.
H0508.significance: Son of Shaharaim. Name (from H410 (אֵל) and H6466 (פָּעַל); God (is) act Elpaal, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0498.d: Warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0498.s: A warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.12.5; only referred to as Eluzai (אֶלְעוּזַי).
H0498.f: A Benjamite warrior who joined David at Ziklag.
H0498.significance: Minor figure; name: from H410 (אֵל) and H5756 (עוּז) (in the sense of H5797 (עֹז)); God (is) defensive Eluzai, an...

H0443.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0443.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.26.7; only referred to as Elzabad (אֶלְזָבָד);  son of Shemaiah; a brother of Othni, Rephael, Obed, Elihu and Semachiah.
H0443.f: A Korahite gatekeeper in the time of David.
H0443.significance: Minor figure; name: from H410 (אֵל) and H2064 (זָבַד); God has bestowed Elzabad, the name of two Israelites

H0368.s: People from Em(?), first mentioned at Gen.14.5; only referred to as Emim (אֵימִים).
H0368.f: An ancient people group defeated by Chedorlaomer.
H0368.meaning: plural of H367 (אֵימָה); terrors Emim, an early Canaanitish (or Maobitish) tribe
H0368.significance: people from em(?). Name meaning: plural of H367 (אֵימָה); terrors Emim, an early Canaanitish (or Maobit...

H5881.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5881.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.1.15; only referred to as Enan (עֵינָן);  father of Ahira.
H5881.f: Father of Ahira, a leader of the tribe of Naphtali.
H5881.significance: Father of Ahira. Name (from H5869 (עַיִן); having eyes Enan, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H2585.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H2585.s: A man from the tribe of Reuben living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.9; referred to as Hanoch (חֲנוֹךְ), or Hanochite (NIV= Hanokite)  (חֲנֹכִי);  son of Reuben; a brother of Pallu, Hezron and Carmi.
H2585.f: A son of Reuben, grandson of Jacob.
H2585.significance: Son of Reuben. Name (from H2596 (חָנַךְ); initiated Chanok, an antediluvian patriach). Name in lineage or family context.

H0583.d: Man living at the time before the Flood
H0583.s: A man living at the time before the Flood, first mentioned at Gen.4.26; referred to as Enosh (אֱנוֹשׁ), or Enos (KJV= Enosh)  (Ἐνώς); a son of Seth;  father of Kenan.
H0583.f: Son of Seth, during whose time people called on the Lord's name.
H0583.meaning: the same as H582 (אֱנוֹשׁ) Enosh, a son of Seth
H0583.significance: Son of Seth. Name (the same as H582 (אֱנוֹשׁ) Enosh, a son of Seth). Name in lineage or family context.

G1866.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G1866.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Rom.16.5; only referred to as Epaenetus (Ἐπαίνετος).
G1866.f: A believer in Asia and beloved by Paul.
G1866.meaning: from G1867 (ἐπαινέω) praised; Epænetus, a Christian
G1866.significance: Minor figure; name: from G1867 (ἐπαινέω) praised; Epænetus, a Christian

G1889.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G1889.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Col.1.7; only referred to as Epaphras (Ἐπαφρᾶς).
G1889.f: A faithful minister and fellow servant of Paul.
G1889.significance: man living at the time of the new testament. Name meaning: contracted from G1891 (Ἐπαφρόδιτος) Epaphras, a Christian

G1891.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G1891.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Php.2.25; only referred to as Epaphroditus (Ἐπαφρόδιτος).
G1891.f: A messenger and minister to Paul from Philippi.
G1891.significance: man living at the time of the new testament. Name meaning: from G1909 (ἐπί) (in the sense of devoted to) and (Venus) Epaphroditus...

H5891.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5891.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.47; only referred to as Ephah (עֵיפָה);  son of Caleb and Jahdai; a brother of Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Shaaph, Hur(?), Jesher(?), Shobab(?), Ardon(?), Mesha(?), Haran(?), Moza(?), Gazez(?), Sheber(?), Tirhanah(?), Shaaph(?), Sheva(?) and Achsah(?).
H5891.f: Son of Jahdai, in Caleb's genealogy.
H5891.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H5890 (עֵיפָה) Ephah, the name of a son of Midian, and of the region settled by him;...

H5778.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5778.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at Jer.40.8; only referred to as Ephai (עוֹפַי).
H5778.f: A Netophathite whose son joined Gedaliah.
H5778.meaning: from H5775 (עוֹף); birdlike Ephai, an Israelite
H5778.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5775 (עוֹף); birdlike Ephai, an Israelite

H6081.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H6081.s: A man from the tribe of Judah(?) living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.17; only referred to as Epher (עֵ֫פֶר);  son of Ezrah; a brother of Jether, Mered and Jalon.
H6081.f: Son of Ezrah, in the genealogy of Judah.
H6081.significance: Minor figure; name: probably a variation of H6082 (עֹפֶר); gazelle Epher, the name of an Arabian and of two Israelites

H0654.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0654.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.2.37; only referred to as Ephlal (אֶפְלָל); a son of Zabad;  father of Obed.
H0654.f: Son of Zabad, in the genealogy of Judah.
H0654.meaning: from H6419 (פָּלַל); judge Ephlal, an Israelite
H0654.significance: Son of Zabad. Name (from H6419 (פָּלַל); judge Ephlal, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0641.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0641.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.34.23; only referred to as Ephod (אֵפֹד);  father of Hanniel.
H0641.f: A leader from the tribe of Manasseh.
H0641.meaning: the same as H646 (אֵפוֹד) shortened Ephod, an Israelite
H0641.significance: Father of Hanniel. Name (the same as H646 (אֵפוֹד) shortened Ephod, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0669.d: Joseph's son living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0669.s: A man who founded the tribe of Ephraim, living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.41.52; referred to as Ephraim or Ephraimite (אֶפְרַ֫יִם), or Ephron (=Ketiv. Qere, KJV= Ephrain) (עֶפְרוֹן), or Ephraimite (KJV= Ephrathite) or Ephrathite (NIV= Ephraimite)  (אֶפְרָתִי);  son of Joseph and Asenath; a brother of Manasseh;  father of Shuthelah, Becher, Tahan, Ezer, Elead and Beriah.
H0669.meaning: Hitchcock: fruitful; increasing. BehindTheName: From Hebrew אֶפְרַיִם meaning 'fruitful'.
H0669.significance: joseph's son living at the time of the patriarchs. Name (dual of masculine form of H672 (אֶפְרָת); double fruit Ephrajim, a son...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0672.d: Woman living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0672.s: A woman from the tribe of Judah  living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at 1Ch.2.19; referred to as Ephrathah (אֶפְרָ֫תָה), or Ephrath (אֶפְרָת), or Ephrathite (אֶפְרָתִי); wife of Hezron and Hezron; mother of Hur and Ram; ; then married to Caleb and bore Ashhur.
H0672.meaning: or אֶפְרָתָה; from H6509 (פָּרָה); fruitfulness Ephrath, another name for Bethlehem;
H0672.significance: Associated with  Bethlehem. Name meaning: or אֶפְרָתָה; from H6509 (פָּרָה); fruitfulness Ephrath, another name ...

H6085.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H6085.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.23.8; only referred to as Ephron (עֶפְרוֹן); a son of Zohar.
H6085.f: A Hittite who sold a burial site to Abraham.
H6085.significance: Son of Zohar. Name (from the same as H6081 (עֵפֶר); fawn-like Ephron, the name of a Canaan...). Name in lineage or family context.

H6147.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H6147.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.38.3; only referred to as Er (עֵר);  son of Judah and Bath-shua; a brother of Onan and Shelah;  half-brother of: Perez and Zerah; husband of Tamar.
H6147.f: Judah's firstborn son, killed by God for his wickedness.
H6147.significance: Son of Judah. Name (from H5782 (עוּר); watchful Er, the name of two Israelites). Name in lineage or family context.

G2262.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
G2262.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at Luk.3.28; only referred to as Er (Ἤρ); a son of Joshua;  father of Elmadam.
G2262.significance: Son of Joshua. Name (of Hebrew origin (H06147) Er, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H6197.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H6197.s: A man from the tribe of Ephraim living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.26.36; referred to as Eran (עֵרָן), or Eranite (עֵרָנִי);  son of Shuthelah; a brother of Bered.
H6197.f: Son of Shuthelah, grandson of Ephraim; head of clan.
H6197.significance: Son of Shuthelah. Name (probably from H5782 (עוּר); watchful Eran, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

G2037.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G2037.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.19.22; only referred to as Erastus (Ἔραστος).
G2037.f: Companion of Paul; served as city treasurer in Corinth.
G2037.meaning: Greek Ἔραστος (Erastus); from ἐραστός (erastos), beloved. Erastus = beloved. City treasurer (Rom 16:23). Hitchcock: lovely, amiable
G2037.significance: One of Paul’s helpers (Acts 19:22); “city treasurer” in Corinth (Rom 16:23). Name (beloved) in the list of those who served the church.

H6179.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H6179.s: A man from the tribe of Gad living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.16; referred to as Eri (עֵרִי), or Erite (עֵרִי);  son of Gad; a brother of Ziphion, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Arod and Areli.
H6179.f: Son of Gad; head of the Erite clan.
H6179.significance: Son of Gad. Name (from H5782 (עוּר); watchful Eri, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0634.d: King living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0634.s: A king of Assyria living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.19.37; only referred to as Esarhaddon (אֵסַר־חַדּוֹן);  son of Sennacherib; a brother of Adrammelech and Sharezer.
H0634.f: King of Assyria; son and successor of Sennacherib.
H0634.meaning: of foreign derivation Esar-chaddon, an Assyrian king
H0634.significance: King of Assyria. Name (of foreign derivation Esar-chaddon, an Assyrian king). Name in royal or ruling context.

H6215.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H6215.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.25.25; referred to as Esau (עֵשָׂו), or Esau (Ἠσαῦ), or Edom (אֱדוֹם), or Esau (עֵשָׂו), or Esau (Ἠσαῦ);  son of Isaac and Rebekah; a brother of Israel; husband of Oholibamah, Judith, Adah and Mahalath;  father of Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam and Korah;  founded nation of Edom.
H6215.meaning: Hitchcock: he that acts or finishes. BehindTheName: From Hebrew עֵשָׂו (ʿEsaw), possibly meaning 'hairy'.
H6215.significance: edomite living at the time of the patriarchs. Name (apparently a form of the passive participle of H6213 (עָשָׂה) in the o...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0790.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0790.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.26; only referred to as Eshban (אֶשְׁבָּן);  son of Dishon; a brother of Hemdan, Ithran and Cheran.
H0790.f: Son of Dishon, a Horite chief in Seir.
H0790.meaning: probably from the same as H7644 (שֶׁבְנָא); vigorous Eshban, an Idumaean
H0790.significance: Son of Dishon. Name (probably from the same as H7644 (שֶׁבְנָא); vigorous Eshban, an Idumae...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0812.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0812.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.14.13; only referred to as Eshcol (אֶשְׁכֹּל); a brother of Mamre and Aner.
H0812.f: Amorite ally of Abram; valley named after him.
H0812.significance: Brother of Mamre. Name meaning: the same as H811 (אֶשְׁכּוֹל) Eshcol, the name of an Amorite, also of ...

H0850.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0850.s: A man from the tribe of Judah  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.4.11; only referred to as Eshton (אֶשְׁתּוֹן); a son of Mehir;  father of Beth-rapha, Paseah, Tehinnah.
H0850.f: Son of Mehir; father of Beth-rapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah.
H0850.meaning: probably from the same as H7764 (שׁוּנִי); restful Eshton, an Israelite
H0850.significance: Son of Mehir. Name (probably from the same as H7764 (שׁוּנִי); restful Eshton, an Israelit...). Name in lineage or family context.
