G2069.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
G2069.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Luk.3.25; only referred to as Esli (Ἐσλί); a son of Naggai;  father of Nahum.
G2069.meaning: Hitchcock: near me; he who separates
G2069.significance: Son of Naggai. Name (of Hebrew origin (probably for H0454) Esli, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0635.d: Woman living at the time of Exile and Return
H0635.s: A woman living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Est.2.7; referred to as Esther (אֶסְתֵּר), or Hadassah (הֲדַסָּה); a daughter of Abihail.
H0635.f: Jewish queen of Persia; saved her people from genocide.
H0635.meaning: From Persian or Hebrew; possibly “star” (Persian) or “hidden.” Esther = queen in Persia (Est 2:7). Hitchcock: secret; hidden. BehindTheName: Possibly from Persian meaning 'star', or from Ishtar.
H0635.significance: Jewish queen who risked her life for her people (Est 4:16). “For such a time as this.” Type of providence and the hidden hand of God in exile.

H0387.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.2.6; only referred to as Ethan (אֵיתָן);  son of Zerah; a brother of Zabdi, Heman, Calcol and Dara;  father of Azariah.
H0387.f: Son of Zerah; grandson of Judah.
H0387.meaning: Hitchcock: strong; the gift of the island
H0387.significance: Son of Zerah. Name (the same as H386 (אֵיתָן); permanent Ethan, the name of four Israelite...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0856.d: King living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0856.s: A king of Sidon living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.16.31; only referred to as Ethbaal (אֶתְבַּ֫עַל);  father of Jezebel.
H0856.f: King of Sidon; father of Jezebel.
H0856.meaning: Hitchcock: toward the idol, or with Baal
H0856.significance: Father of Jezebel. Name (from H854 (אֵת) and H1168 (בַּעַל); with Baal Ethbaal, a Phoenician ki...). Name in royal or ruling context.

H0869.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0869.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.7; only referred to as Ethnan (אֶתְנַן);  son of Ashhur and Helah; a brother of Haahashtari, Zereth, Izhar and Koz;  half-brother of: Ahuzzam, Hepher and Temeni.
H0869.f: Son of Ashhur, the founder of Tekoa.
H0869.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H868 (אֶתְנַן) in the sense of H867 (אֶתְנִי) Ethnan, an Israelite

G2103.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G2103.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at 2Ti.4.21; only referred to as Eubulus (Εὔβουλος).
G2103.f: Greeted by Paul in his letter to Timothy.
G2103.significance: Minor figure; name: from G2095 (εὖ) and G1014 (βούλομαι) good-willer; Eubulus, a Christian

G2131.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament - unnamed father of Eunice
G2131.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, inferred at 2Ti.1.5; only referred to as father_of_Eunice (.);  unnamed father of Eunice@2Ti.1.5.
G2131.f: Father of Eunice - Grandfather of Timothy
G2131.meaning: Greek Εὐνίκη (Eunike); from εὐ (eu), good, + νίκη (nike), victory. Eunice = good victory. Mother of Timothy (2 Tim 1:5).
G2131.significance: Jewish mother; faith that dwelt in her and in Lois (2 Tim 1:5). Name (good victory) as the one who passed the faith to Timothy.

G2136.d: Woman living at the time of the New Testament
G2136.s: A woman living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Php.4.2; only referred to as Euodia (Εὐοδία).
G2136.f: Christian woman in Philippi; urged by Paul to reconcile.
G2136.meaning: from the same as G2137 (εὐοδόω) fine travelling; Euodia, a Christian woman
G2136.significance: Minor figure; name: from the same as G2137 (εὐοδόω) fine travelling; Euodia, a Christian woman

G2161.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G2161.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Act.20.9; only referred to as Eutychus (Εὔτυχος).
G2161.f: Young man in Troas; fell from window; restored by Paul.
G2161.significance: Minor figure; name: from G2095 (εὖ) and a derivative of G5177 (τυγχάνω) well- fated, i.e. fortunate; Eutychus, a...

H2332.d: Woman living at the time before the Flood
H2332.s: A woman living at the time before the Flood, first mentioned at Gen.3.20; referred to as Eve (חַוָּה), or Eve (Εὖα);  wife of Adam;  mother of Cain, Abel and Seth.
H2332.f: First woman; wife of Adam; tempted by the serpent.
H2332.meaning: From חָוָה (chawah), live, or חַי (chay), life. Eve = life. First woman; mother of all living (Gen 3:20). Hitchcock: living; enlivening. BehindTheName: From Hebrew חַוָּה (Ḥawwa) meaning 'to breathe' or 'living'.
H2332.significance: Taken from Adam; mother of Cain, Abel, Seth. Deceived (1 Tim 2:14) yet given the promise of the seed (Gen 3:15). Type of the church as bride.

H0189.d: King living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0189.s: A king living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.31.8; only referred to as Evi (אֱוִי).
H0189.f: Midianite king killed in battle against Israel.
H0189.significance: king living at the time of egypt and wilderness. Name (probably from H183 (אָוָה); desirous Evi, a Midianitish chief). Name in royal or ruling context.

H0192.d: King living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0192.s: A king in Babylon living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.25.27; only referred to as Evil-merodach (אֱוִיל מְרֹדַךְ).
H0192.f: King of Babylon; released Jehoiachin from prison.
H0192.meaning: Akkadian Amel-Marduk; Evil-merodach = man of Marduk. Babylonian king (2 Ki 25:27); son of Nebuchadnezzar. Hitchcock: the fool of Merodach; the fool grinds bitterly
H0192.significance: Released Jehoiachin from prison (2 Ki 25:27–30). Gentile king who shows kindness to the Davidic prisoner; unwittingly preserves the line.

H0229.d: Warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0229.s: A warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.11.37; only referred to as Ezbai (אֶזְבָּ֑י);  father of Naarai.
H0229.f: Father of Naarai, one of David's mighty men.
H0229.meaning: probably from H231 (אֵזוֹב); hyssop-like Ezbai, an Israelite
H0229.significance: David's warrior. Name (probably from H231 (אֵזוֹב); hyssop-like Ezbai, an Israelite). Name fits martial or military role.

H0675.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0675.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.7; only referred to as Ezbon (אֶצְבּוֹן);  son of Bela; a brother of Ard, Naaman, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, Iri, Addar, Gera, Abihud, Abishua and Ahoah.
H0675.f: Son of Bela, grandson of Benjamin.
H0675.significance: Minor figure; name: or אֶצְבֹּן; of uncertain derivation Etsbon, the name of two Israelites

H3168.d: Prophet living at the time of Exile and Return
H3168.s: A prophet living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezk.1.3; only referred to as Ezekiel (יְחֶזְקֵאל); a son of Buzi.
H3168.f: Prophet during Babylonian exile; author of the Book of Ezekiel.
H3168.meaning: From חָזַק (chazaq), strengthen, + אֵל (el), God. Ezekiel = God strengthens. Exile prophet (Ezek 1:3). Hitchcock: the strength of God. BehindTheName: From Hebrew יְחֶזְקֵאל meaning 'God strengthens'.
H3168.significance: Prophet of the glory and the dry bones (Ezek 37); watchman (Ezek 33:7). Name (God strengthens) as the one who spoke hope in exile.

H5829.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5829.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.4; only referred to as Ezer (עֵ֫זֶר);  son of Hur; a brother of Uri, Shobal, Salma, Hareph, Jezreel, Ishma, Idbash, Hazzelelponi and Penuel;  father or founder of Hushah.
H5829.f: Father or founder of Hushah, of Ephrathah.
H5829.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H5828 (עֵזֶר) Ezer, the name of four Israelites

H0687.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0687.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.21; only referred to as Ezer (אֵ֫צֶר);  son of Seir; a brother of Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Dishon, Dishan and Timna;  father of Bilhan, Zaavan, Akan.
H0687.f: Horite chief in Seir; son of Seir the Horite.
H0687.significance: Son of Seir. Name (from H686 (אָצַר); treasure Etser, an Idumaean). Name in lineage or family context.

H6112.s: People from Ezni(?), only mentioned at 2Sa.23.8; only referred to as Eznites (עֵצֶן).
H6112.f: Adino the Eznite; one of David's mighty men.
H6112.meaning: from an unused root meaning to be sharp or strong a spear
H6112.significance: Minor figure; name: from an unused root meaning to be sharp or strong a spear

H5830.d: Priest living at the time of Exile and Return
H5830.s: A priest from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.7.1; referred to as Ezra (עֶזְרָא), or Ezra (Aramiac עֶזְרָא);  son of Seraiah; a brother of Jehozadak.
H5830.f: Priest; scribe; led a group of exiles back to Jerusalem.
H5830.meaning: Hitchcock: help; court. BehindTheName: From Hebrew עֶזְרָא meaning 'help'.
H5830.significance: Returned priest. Name (a variation of H5833 (עֶזְרָה) Ezra, an Israelite). Name fits cultic or priestly role.

H5834.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5834.s: A man from the tribe of Judah(?) living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.17; only referred to as Ezrah (עֶזְרָה);  father of Jether, Mered, Epher and Jalon.
H5834.f: Son of Chelub; mentioned in Judah's genealogy.
H5834.meaning: the same as H5833 (עֶזְרָה) Ezrah, an Israelite
H5834.significance: Father of Jether. Name (the same as H5833 (עֶזְרָה) Ezrah, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H5836.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5836.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.27.26; only referred to as Ezri (עֶזְרִי); a son of Chelub.
H5836.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5828 (עֵזֶר); helpful Ezri, an Israelite

H2518.d: High Priest living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H2518.s: A High Priest from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.22.4; only referred to as Hilkiah (חִלְקִיָּהוּ); a son of Shallum;  father of Azariah and Gemariah.
H2518.f: The high priest who discovered the Book of the Law.
H2518.significance: A High Priest. Name (or חִלְקִיָּהוּ; from H2506 (חֵלֶק) and H3050 (יָהּ); portion of Jah C...). Name fits cultic or priestly role.

H1940.d: Woman (?) living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1940.s: A woman(?) from the tribe of Judah(?) living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.19; only referred to as Hodiah (הוֹדִיָּה); sister of Naham; wife of Ishbah(?);  mother of Maacathites(?) and Garmites(?).
H1940.f: Wife of a Judahite named Ishbar.
H1940.meaning: a form for the feminine of H3064 (יְהוּדִי) a Jewess
H1940.significance: Minor figure; name: a form for the feminine of H3064 (יְהוּדִי) a Jewess

G2976.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament - unnamed father
G2976.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, inferred at Luk.10.39; only referred to as father of Lazarus (.);  unnamed father of: Martha, Mary and Lazarus.
G2976.f: The father of Mary, Martha and Lazarus of Bethany.
G2976.meaning: Hitchcock: assistance of God. BehindTheName: From Greek Λάζαρος (Lazaros), from Hebrew אֶלְעָזָר (ʾElʿazar) meaning 'my God has helped'.
G2976.significance: man living at the time of the new testament - unnamed father. Name meaning: probably of Hebrew origin (H0499) Lazarus (i.e. Elazar), the name of t...

H4471.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs - unnamed father
H4471.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, inferred at Gen.14.13; only referred to as father of Mamre;  unnamed father of: Mamre, Eshcol and Aner.
H4471.f: Father of Mamre - Amorite, ally of Abraham
H4471.meaning: Hitchcock: rebellious; bitter; set with trees
H4471.significance: man living at the time of the patriarchs - unnamed father. Name meaning: from H4754 (מָרָא)(in the sense of vigor); lusty Mamre, an Amorite

H5416.d: David's son living at the time of United Monarchy
H5416.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.5.14; referred to as Nathan (נָתָן), or Nathan (Ναθάν);  son of David and Bathsheba; a brother of Shammua, Shobab and Solomon;  half-brother of: Amnon, Chileab, Absalom, Adonijah, Shephatiah, Ithream, Ibhar, Elishua, Nepheg, Japhia, Elishama, Eliada, Eliphelet, Tamar, Elpelet, Nogah and Jerimoth;  father of
H5416.f: Son of David and Bathsheba, ancestor of Jesus.
H5416.meaning: Hitchcock: given; giving; rewarded. BehindTheName: From Hebrew נָתָן (Natan) meaning 'he gave'.
H5416.significance: David's son. Name (from H5414 (נָתַן); given Nathan, the name of five Israelites). Name in lineage or family context.

H8472.d: Woman living at the time of United Monarchy
H8472.s: A woman of the Egyptians living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ki.11.19; only referred to as Tahpenes (תַּחְפְּנֵיס); wife of Pharaoh;  mother of daughter of Pharaoh.
H8472.f: Egyptian queen who raised Hadad the Edomite
H8472.significance: Egyptian woman. Name meaning: of Egyptian derivation Tachpenes, an Egyptian woman

G5095.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament - unnamed father of Timothy
G5095.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, inferred at Act.16.1; only referred to as father of Timothy (.);  unnamed father of Timothy.
G5095.f: Father of Timothy - Greek man; husband of Eunice
G5095.meaning: BehindTheName: From Greek Τιμόθεος (Timotheos) meaning 'honouring God'.
G5095.significance: man living at the time of the new testament - unnamed father. Name meaning: from G5092 (τιμή) and G2316 (θεός) dear to God; Timotheus, a Christian

G5344.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G5344.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.23.24; only referred to as Felix (Φῆλιξ); husband of Drusilla.
G5344.f: Roman governor of Judea; heard Paul's case.
G5344.significance: man living at the time of the new testament. Name meaning: of Latin origin happy; Phelix (i.e. Felix), a Roman

G5347.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G5347.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.24.27; referred to as Festus (Φῆστος), or Porcius (Πόρκιος).
G5347.f: Roman governor of Judea; heard Paul's case; sent him to Rome.
G5347.significance: man living at the time of the new testament. Name meaning: of Latin derivation festal; Phestus (i.e. Festus), a Roman

G5415.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G5415.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at 1Co.16.17; referred to as Fortunatus (ESV, NIV= [ ]) (Φορτουνᾶτος).
G5415.f: Corinthian Christian; visited Paul in Ephesus.
G5415.significance: man living at the time of the new testament. Name meaning: of Latin origin "fortunate"; Fortunatus, a Christian

H1603.s: A man living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jdg.9.26; only referred to as Gaal (גַּ֫עַל); a son of Ebed.
H1603.f: Son of Ebed; led a revolt against Abimelech.
H1603.significance: Son of Ebed. Name (from H1602 (גָּעַל); loathing Gaal, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H1373.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1373.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.11.8; only referred to as Gabbai (גַּבַּי).
H1373.f: Benjamite leader who settled in Jerusalem.
H1373.significance: Minor figure; name: from the same as H1354 (גַב); collective Gabbai, an Israelite

H1410.d: Jacob's son living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1410.s: A man who founded the tribe of Gad  living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.30.11; referred to as Gad or Gadite (גָּד), or Gad or Gadite (גָּדִי), or Gad (Γάδ);  son of Israel and Zilpah; a brother of Asher;  half-brother of: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Dan, Naphtali, Issachar, Zebulun, Dinah, Joseph and Benjamin;  father of Ziphion, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arod and Areli.
H1410.significance: jacob's son living at the time of the patriarchs. Name (from H1464 (גּוּד) Gad, a son of Jacob, including his tribe and its te...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1426.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1426.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.13.11; only referred to as Gaddi (גַּדִּי); a son of Susi.
H1426.f: Son of Susi; representative of Manasseh among the spies.
H1426.significance: Minor figure; name: intensive for H1424 (גָּדִי) Gaddi, an Israelite

H1427.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1427.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.13.10; only referred to as Gaddiel (גַּדִּיאֵל); a son of Sodi.
H1427.f: Son of Sodi; representative of Zebulun among the spies.
H1427.meaning: Hitchcock: goat of God; the Lord my happiness
H1427.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1409 (גָּד) and H410 (אֵל); fortune of God Gaddiel, an Israelite

H1424.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1424.s: A man of the Kingdom of Israel, living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.15.14; only referred to as Gadi (גָּדִי);  father of Menahem.
H1424.f: Father of Menahem, king of Israel.
H1424.meaning: from H1409 (גָּד); fortunate Gadi, an Israelite
H1424.significance: Father of Menahem. Name (from H1409 (גָּד); fortunate Gadi, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H1514.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1514.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, only mentioned at Gen.22.24; only referred to as Gaham (גַּ֫חַם);  son of Nahor and Reumah; a brother of Tebah, Tahash and Maacah;  half-brother of: Uz, Buz, Kemuel, Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph and Bethuel.
H1514.meaning: from an unused root meaning to burn; flame Gacham, a son of Nahor
H1514.significance: Minor figure; name: from an unused root meaning to burn; flame Gacham, a son of Nahor

H1515.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1515.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.47; only referred to as Gahar (גַּ֫חַר).
H1515.f: Ancestor of temple servants who returned from Babylonian exile.
H1515.meaning: from an unused root meaning to hide; lurker Gachar, one of the Nethinim
H1515.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: from an unused root meaning to hide; lurker Gachar, one of the Nethini...

G1050.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G1050.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at 3Jn.1.1; only referred to as Gaius (Γάϊος).
G1050.f: Recipient of John's third epistle; commended for his faithfulness.
G1050.meaning: Latin Gaius. Gaius = rejoice. Multiple in NT: host (Rom 16:23), Macedonian (Acts 19:29), recipient of 3 John. Hitchcock: lord; an earthly man
G1050.significance: Paul’s host (“host of the whole church” Rom 16:23); one of the few who supported the apostle. Name (rejoice) in the fellowship of the gospel.

H1559.d: Levite living at the time of Exile and Return
H1559.s: A man from the tribe of Levi  living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at 1Ch.9.16; only referred to as Galal (גָּלָל); a son of Jeduthun;  father of Shemaiah.
H1559.f: Levite musician; descendant of Jeduthun; lived in Jerusalem.
H1559.significance: Returned musician. Name (from H1556 (גָּלַל), in the sense of H1560 (גְּלָל); great Galal, the ...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

G1058.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G1058.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.18.12; only referred to as Gallio (Γαλλίων).
G1058.f: Roman proconsul of Achaia; refused to judge Paul.
G1058.meaning: Hitchcock: who sucks, or lives on milk
G1058.significance: man living at the time of the new testament. Name meaning: of Latin origin Gallion (i.e. Gallio), a Roman officer

G1059.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G1059.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.5.34; only referred to as Gamaliel (Γαμαλιήλ).
G1059.f: Pharisee; teacher of the law; Paul's mentor.
G1059.meaning: Greek Γαμαλιήλ (Gamaliel); from Hebrew גְּמַלִּיאֵל (Gamaliel), reward of God. Gamaliel = reward of God. Pharisee; teacher of Paul (Acts 5:34; 22:3). Hitchcock: recompense of God; camel of God
G1059.significance: Counseled tolerance toward the apostles (Acts 5:34–39); “if it is of God, you cannot overthrow it.” Name (reward of God) as the teacher under whom Paul learned the law.

H1583.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1583.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.1.10; only referred to as Gamaliel (גַּמְלִיאֵל); a son of Pedahzur.
H1583.f: Leader of the tribe of Manasseh during the Exodus.
H1583.meaning: Hitchcock: recompense of God; camel of God
H1583.significance: Son of Pedahzur. Name (from H1580 (גָּמַל) and H410 (אֵל); reward of God Gamliel, an Israelit...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1577.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1577.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.24.17; only referred to as Gamul (גָּמוּל).
H1577.f: Head of a priestly division in David's time.
H1577.significance: Minor figure; name: passive participle of H1580 (גָּמַל); rewarded Gamul, an Israelite

H1619.d: Warrior living at the time of United Monarchy
H1619.s: A warrior living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.23.38; only referred to as Gareb (גָּרֵב).
H1619.f: One of David's mighty warriors; an Ithrite.
H1619.significance: David's warrior. Name (from the same as H1618 (גָּרָב); scabby Gareb, the name of an Israelit...). Name fits martial or military role.

H1636.s: People descended from Gerem(?), living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.19; only referred to as Garmites (גַּרְמִי);  founded Keilah.
H1636.meaning: Hitchcock: men of Garmi, ie., bones, or, my cause
H1636.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1634 (גֶּרֶם) bony, i.e. strong

H1609.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1609.s: A man of the Edomites living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.11; only referred to as Gatam (גַּעְתָּם);  son of Eliphaz; a brother of Teman, Omar, Zepho, Kenaz, Amalek and Korah.
H1609.f: Son of Eliphaz; grandson of Esau; Edomite chief.
H1609.significance: An Edomite. Name (of uncertain derivation Gatam, an Edomite). Name in lineage or family context.

H1495.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1495.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.46a; only referred to as Gazez (גָּזֵז);  son of Caleb and Ephah; a brother of Haran and Moza;  half-brother of: Hur, Jesher, Shobab, Ardon, Mesha, Sheber, Tirhanah, Regem(?), Jotham(?), Geshan(?), Pelet(?), Ephah(?), Shaaph(?), Shaaph, Sheva and Achsah.
H1495.f: Son of Caleb and his concubine Ephah.
H1495.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1494 (גַּזָז); shearer Gazez, the name of two Israelites

H1502.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1502.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.48; only referred to as Gazzam (גַּזָּם).
H1502.f: Ancestor of temple servants who returned from Babylonian exile.
H1502.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: from the same as H1501 (גָּזָם); devourer Gazzam, one of the Nethinim

H1398.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H1398.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ki.4.19; only referred to as Geber (גֶּ֫בֶר); a son of Uri; father of Ben-Geber.
H1398.f: Son of Uri; one of Solomon's twelve district governors.
H1398.significance: Son of Uri. Name (the same as H1397 (גֶּבֶר) Geber, the name of two Israelites). Name in lineage or family context.

H1436.d: Levite living at the time of United Monarchy
H1436.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.25.3; only referred to as Gedaliah (גְּדַלְיָ֫הוּ);  son of Jeduthun; a brother of Obed-edom, Mattithiah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Hashabiah.

H1436.significance: Son of Jeduthun. Name (or (prolonged) גְּדַלְיָהוּ; from H1431 (גָּדַל) and H3050 (יָהּ); Jah...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H1446.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H1446.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.8.31; only referred to as Gedor (גְּדוֹר);  son of Abiel and Maacah; a brother of Kish, Ner, Abdon, Zur, Baal, Nadab, Ahio, Zecher and Mikloth.
H1446.f: Son of Abiel, the founder of Gibeon.
H1446.meaning: or (fully) גְּדוֹר; from H1443 (גָּדַר); inclosure Gedor, a place in Palestine; also the name of...
H1446.significance: Saul's family. Name (or (fully) גְּדוֹר; from H1443 (גָּדַר); inclosure Gedor, a place in P...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1522.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1522.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.4.12; only referred to as Gehazi (גֵּיחֲזִי).

H1582.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1582.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.13.12; only referred to as Gemalli (גְּמַלִּי);  father of Ammiel.

H1582.significance: Father of Ammiel. Name (probably from H1581 (גָּמָל); cameldriver Gemalli, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H1587.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1587.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at Jer.36.10; only referred to as Gemariah (גְּמַרְיָ֫הוּ);  son of Shaphan; a brother of Ahikam and Elasah;  father of Micaiah.

H1592.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H1592.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ki.11.20; only referred to as Genubath (גְּנֻבַת); a son of Hadad and sister of Tahpenes.

H1592.significance: Son of Hadad. Name (from H1589 (גָּנַב); theft Genubath, an Edomitish prince). Name in lineage or family context.

H1617.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1617.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.21; only referred to as Gera (גֵּרָא);  son of Benjamin; a brother of Bela, Becher, Ashbel, Naaman, Ahiram, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, Ard, Ahiram and Jediael;  father or founder of Ehud.

H1617.significance: Son of Benjamin. Name (perhaps from H1626 (גֵּרָה); a grain Gera, the name of six Israelites). Name in lineage or family context.

H1647.d: Levite living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1647.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Exo.2.22; only referred to as Gershom (גֵּרְשֹׁם);  son of Moses and Zipporah; a brother of Eliezer;  father of Jonathan(?) and Shebuel.
H1647.f: Son of Moses; father of Jonathan, a renegade priest.
H1647.significance: Son of Moses. Name (for H1648 (גֵּרְשׁוֹן) Gereshom, the name of four Israelites). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H1648.d: Levite living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1648.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.11; referred to as Gershon or Gershom or Gershonite (גֵּרְשׁוֹן), or Gershom or Gershomite (גֵּרְשֹׁם), or Gershonite or Gershon (NIV= Gershonite)  (גֵּרְשֻׁנִּי);  son of Levi; a brother of Kohath, Merari and Jochebed;  father of Libni and Shimei.
H1648.meaning: Hitchcock: his banishment; the change of pilgrimage
H1648.significance: levite living at the time of egypt and wilderness. Name (or גֵּרְשׁוֹם; from H1644 (גָּרַשׁ); a refugee Gereshon or Gereshom, a...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H1529.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1529.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.47; only referred to as Geshan (גֵּישָׁן); son of Caleb and Jahdai; a brother of Regem, Jotham, Pelet, Ephah, Shaaph, Hur(?), Jesher(?), Shobab(?), Ardon(?), Mesha(?), Haran(?), Moza(?), Gazez(?), Sheber(?), Tirhanah(?), Shaaph(?), Sheva(?) and Achsah(?).
H1529.f: Son of Jahdai, a descendant of Caleb.
H1529.meaning: from the same as H1487 (גּוּשׁ); lumpish Geshan, an Israelite
H1529.significance: Minor figure; name: from the same as H1487 (גּוּשׁ); lumpish Geshan, an Israelite

H1654.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return

H1654.f: Arab opponent of Nehemiah; tried to hinder wall rebuilding.

H1654.significance: Nehemiah's opponent. Name meaning: or (prolonged) גַּשְׁמוּ; the same as H1653 (גֶּשֶׁם) Geshem or Gashmu...

H1666.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs

H1666.significance: Early Patriarch. Name (of uncertain derivation Gether, a son of Aram, and the region settled ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1345.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1345.s: A man from the tribe of Gad living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.13.15; only referred to as Geuel (גְּאוּאֵל); a son of Machi.
H1345.f: Son of Machi; representative of Gad among the twelve spies.
H1345.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1342 (גָּאָה) and H410 (אֵל); majesty of God Geuel, an Israelite

H1388.d: Woman or town of the time of Divided Monarchy
H1388.s: A woman or town of the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.49; only referred to as Gibea (גִּבְעָא);  founded or fathered by Sheva; a sister of Machbenah.
H1388.f: With Machbenah, daughters or towns of Sheva.
H1388.meaning: by permutation for H1389 (גִּבְעָה); a hill Giba, a place in Palestine
H1388.significance: Minor figure; name: by permutation for H1389 (גִּבְעָה); a hill Giba, a place in Palestine

H1437.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1437.s: A musician from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.25.4; only referred to as Giddalti (גִּדַּלְתִּי);  son of Heman; a brother of Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.
H1437.f: Son of Heman; a temple musician during David's reign.
H1437.meaning: from H1431 (גָּדַל); I have made great Giddalti, an Israelite
H1437.significance: Son of Heman. Name (from H1431 (גָּדַל); I have made great Giddalti, an Israelite). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H1435.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1435.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.56; only referred to as Giddel (גִּדֵּל).
H1435.f: Ancestor of Solomon's servants who returned from Babylonian exile.
H1435.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: from H1431 (גָּדַל); stout Giddel, the name of one of the Nethinim, al...

H1439.s: A Judge living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jdg.6.11; referred to as Gideon (גִּדְעוֹן), or Jerubbaal (יְרֻבַּ֫עַל), or Jerubbesheth (יְרֻבֶּשֶׁת), or Gideon (Γεδεών); a son of Joash;  father of Jether, Abimelech and Jotham.
H1439.meaning: From גָּדַע (gada), cut off. Gideon = hewer, cutter. Judge (Judg 6:11). Hitchcock: he that bruises or breaks; a destroyer. BehindTheName: From Hebrew גִּדְעוֹן meaning 'feller, hewer'.
H1439.significance: Least in Manasseh (Judg 6:15); “the Lord is peace” (Judg 6:24). Fleece (Judg 6:36–40); 300 (Judg 7:7). Name (cutter) as the one who cut down the altar of Baal—and cut the army to 300.

H1441.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1441.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.1.11; only referred to as Gideoni (גִּדְעֹנִי);  father of Abidan.

H1441.significance: Father of Abidan. Name (from H1438 (גָּדַע); warlike (compare H1439 (גִּדְעוֹן)) Gidoni, an Is...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1562.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1562.s: A musician living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.12.36; only referred to as Gilalai (גִּלֲלַי);  son of Jonathan; a brother of Zechariah, Shemaiah, Azarel, Milalai, Maai, Nethanel, Judah and Hanani.

H1562.significance: Minor figure; name: from H1561 (גֵּלֶל); dungy Gilalai, an Israelite

H1568.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1568.s: A man from the tribe of Manasseh living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.26.29; only referred to as Gilead (גִּלְעָד);  son of Machir; a brother of daughter of Machir, Peresh, Sheresh and Hammolecheth;  father of Abiezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Shemida and Hepher.

H1568.significance: Son of Machir. Name (probably from H1567 (גַּלְעֵד) Gilad, a region East of the Jordan; als...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1527.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy

H1527.significance: Father of Tibni. Name (of uncertain derivation Ginath, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H1599.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1599.s: A priest living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Neh.10.6; referred to as Ginnethon or Ginnethoi (KJV= Ginnetho, NIV= Ginnethon)  (גִּנְּתוֹן).

H1599.meaning: or גִּנְּתוֹ; from H1598 (גָּנַן); gardener Ginnethon or Ginnetho, an Israelite
H1599.significance: Returned priest. Name (or גִּנְּתוֹ; from H1598 (גָּנַן); gardener Ginnethon or Ginnetho, an ...). Name fits cultic or priestly role.

H1622.s: People from Girgas(?) of the Canaanites, first mentioned at Gen.10.16; referred to as Girgashites (גִּרְגָּשִׁי), or Girgashite (LXX) (Γεργεσί); descended from Canaan along with Sidon, Heth, Jebusites, Amorites, Hivites, Arkites, Sinites, Arvadites, Zemarites and Hamathites.
H1622.f: A Canaanite people group living in the Promised Land.

H1511.s: People from Girzit(?), only mentioned at 1Sa.27.8; only referred to as Girzites (גִּזְרִי).

H1658.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1658.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.11.21; only referred to as Gishpa (גִּשְׁפָּא).
H1658.f: An overseer of the temple servants during Nehemiah's time.
H1658.meaning: of uncertain derivation Gishpa, an Israelite
H1658.significance: Minor figure; name: of uncertain derivation Gishpa, an Israelite

H1493.s: A group of warriors from Gizon(?), only mentioned at 1Ch.11.34; only referred to as Gizonites (גִּזוֹנִי).
H1493.f: A people group mentioned in the Old Testament.

H1463.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1463.s: A man from the tribe of Reuben  living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.5.4; only referred to as Gog (גּוֹג); a son of Shemaiah;  father of Shimei.
H1463.f: A descendant of Reuben, son of Joel.
H1463.significance: Son of Shemaiah. Name (of uncertain derivation Gog, the name of an Israelite, also of some no...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1555.d: Giant living at the time of United Monarchy
H1555.s: A gigantic man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.17.4; only referred to as Goliath (גׇּלְיַת);  son of Rapha; a brother of Ishbi-benob, Saph, Lahmi, huge man.
H1555.f: A Philistine giant defeated by David.
H1555.meaning: Hitchcock: passage; revolution; heap. BehindTheName: Possibly from גָּלָה (gala) 'to uncover, reveal'.
H1555.significance: A gigantic man. Name (perhaps from H1540 (גָּלָה); exile Goljath, a Philistine). Name in lineage or family context.

H1586.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1586.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.10.2; only referred to as Gomer (גֹּ֫מֶר);  son of Japheth; a brother of Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech and Tiras;  father of Ashkenaz, Riphath and Togarmah.
H1586.f: Son of Japheth; father of Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.
H1586.significance: Son of Japheth. Name (from H1584 (גָּמַר); completion Gomer, the name of a son of Japheth an...). Name in lineage or family context.

H1476.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H1476.s: A man from the tribe of Naphtali living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.24; referred to as Guni (גּוּנִי), or Gunite (גּוּנִי);  son of Naphtali; a brother of Jahzeel, Jezer and Shillem.

H1476.significance: Son of Naphtali. Name (probably from H1598 (גָּנַן); protected Guni, the name of two Israelit...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0326.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy

H0326.f: A descendant of Judah through Hezron.
H0326.significance: Minor figure; name: probably of Persian derivation an achastarite (i.e. courier); the designation (rather than name)...

H2252.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H2252.s: A priest living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.61; referred to as Habaiah or Hobaiah (KJV= Habaiah)  (חֲבַיָה).

H2265.d: Prophet living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H2265.s: A prophet living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at Hab.1.1; only referred to as Habakkuk (חֲבַקּוּק).
H2265.f: A prophet who questioned God's justice.
H2265.meaning: From חָבַק (chavaq), embrace. Habakkuk = embrace. Prophet (Hab 1:1). Hitchcock: he that embraces; a wrestler. BehindTheName: From Hebrew חֲבַקּוּק meaning 'embrace'.
H2265.significance: “Why do you make me see iniquity?” (Hab 1:3); “the righteous shall live by his faith” (Hab 2:4; Rom 1:17). Name (embrace) as the one who clung to the word in the midst of judgment.

H2262.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H2262.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at Jer.35.3; only referred to as Habazziniah (חֲבַצִּנְיָה);  father of Jeremiah.
H2262.f: Grandfather of Jaazaniah, a Rechabite leader.
H2262.meaning: of uncertain derivation Chabatstsanjah, a Rechabite
H2262.significance: Father of Jeremiah. Name (of uncertain derivation Chabatstsanjah, a Rechabite). Name in lineage or family context.

H2446.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H2446.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Neh.1.1; only referred to as Hacaliah (חֲכַלְיָה);  father of Nehemiah, Hanani.
H2446.f: Father of Nehemiah, the governor of Judah.
H2446.meaning: from the base of H2447 (חַכְלִיל) and H3050 (יָהּ); darkness of Jah Chakaljah, an Israelite
H2446.significance: Returned leader. Name meaning: from the base of H2447 (חַכְלִיל) and H3050 (יָהּ); darkness of Jah Ch...

H2453.s: A group of warriors from Hachmon or Tahchemon(?), first mentioned at 2Sa.23.8; referred to as Hachmonites (חַכְמוֹנִי), or Tahchemonite (KJV= Tachmonite, NIV= Tahkemonite)  (תַּחְכְּמֹנִי).
H2453.f: A clan or family known for their mighty warriors.
H2453.meaning: from H2449 (חָכַם); skilful Chakmoni, an Israelite
H2453.significance: Family of warrior. Name (from H2449 (חָכַם); skilful Chakmoni, an Israelite). Name fits martial or military role.

H1908.d: King living at the time of United Monarchy
H1908.s: A king of Edom of the Egyptians living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ki.11.14; referred to as Hadad (הֲדַד), or Hadad (אֲדַד); husband of sister of Tahpenes;  father of Genubath.
H1908.f: An Edomite prince who opposed Solomon.
H1908.significance: Father of Genubath. Name (probably of foreign origin (compare H111 (אֲדַד)) Hadad, the name of a...). Name in royal or ruling context.

H2301.d: Arabian living at the time of the Patriarchs
H2301.s: A man of the Arabs living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.25.15; referred to as Hadad (חֲדַד), or Hadad (KJV= Hadar, in Ben Chaim)  (חֲדַר);  son of Ishmael; a brother of Nebaioth, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam, Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, Kedemah and Mahalath.
H2301.f: A son of Ishmael, Abraham's son.
H2301.significance: Son of Ishmael. Name (from H2300 (חָדַד); fierce Chadad, an Ishmaelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H1909.d: King living at the time of United Monarchy
H1909.s: A king of Zobah living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.8.3; referred to as Hadadezer (הֲדַרְעֶ֫זֶר), or Hadadezer (KJV= Hadarezer)  (הֲדַדְעֶ֫זֶר); a son of Rehob.
H1909.f: King of Zobah, defeated by David.
H1909.significance: King of Zobah. Name (from H1908 (הֲדַד) and H5828 (עֵזֶר); Hadad (is his) help Hadadezer, a...). Name in royal or ruling context.

H2311.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H2311.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ch.28.12; only referred to as Hadlai (חַדְלָ֑י);  father of Amasa.
H2311.f: Father of Amasa, who opposed taking captives from Judah.
H2311.significance: Father of Amasa. Name (from H2309 (חֶדֶל); idle Chadlai, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H1913.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1913.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.10.27; only referred to as Hadoram (הֲדוֹרָם);  son of Joktan; a brother of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah, Uzal, Diklah, Obal, Abimael, Sheba, Ophir, Havilah and Jobab.
H1913.f: Son of Joktan, a descendant of Shem.
H1913.significance: Son of Joktan. Name (or הֲדֹרָם; probably of foreign derivation Hadoram, a son of Joktan, a...). Name in lineage or family context.

H2285.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H2285.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Ezr.2.46; only referred to as Hagab (חָגָב).
H2285.f: A temple servant who returned from Babylonian exile.
H2285.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H2284 (חָגָב); locust Chagab, one of the Nethinim

H2286.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H2286.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.45; referred to as Hagabah (חֲגָבָה), or Hagaba (חֲגָבָא).
H2286.f: A temple servant who returned from Babylonian exile.
H2286.meaning: or חֲגָבָה; feminine of H2285 (חָגָב); locust Chagaba or Chagabah, one of the Nethinim
H2286.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: or חֲגָבָה; feminine of H2285 (חָגָב); locust Chagaba or Chagabah, one...

H1904.d: Woman living at the time of the Patriarchs
H1904.s: A concubine living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.16.1; referred to as Hagar (הָגָר), or Hagar (Ἄγαρ); concubine of Abraham;  mother of Ishmael.
H1904.f: Sarah's Egyptian maidservant; mother of Ishmael.
H1904.meaning: Hitchcock: a stranger; one that fears. BehindTheName: Possibly means 'flight' in Hebrew.
H1904.significance: woman living at the time of the patriarchs. Name meaning: of uncertain (perhaps foreign) derivation Hagar, the mother of Ishmael

H2292.d: Prophet living at the time of Exile and Return
H2292.s: A prophet living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.5.1; referred to as Haggai (חַגַּי), or Haggai (Aramiac חַגַּי).
H2292.f: A prophet who encouraged the rebuilding of the temple.
H2292.meaning: From חָג (chag), feast. Haggai = festive. Prophet (Hag 1:1). Hitchcock: feast; solemnity. BehindTheName: From Hebrew חַגַּי meaning 'festive', from חָג (ḥag) 'festival'.
H2292.significance: “Consider your ways” (Hag 1:5); “the latter glory of this house shall be greater than the former” (Hag 2:9). Name (festive) as the one who called the people to rebuild and to hope.

H1419.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H1419.s: A priest living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.11.14; only referred to as Haggedolim (גָּדוֹל);father of Zabdiel.
H1419.f: A priest mentioned in Nehemiah's time.
H1419.meaning: or גָּדֹל; (shortened) from H1431 (גָּדַל) great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
H1419.significance: Returned priest. Name (or גָּדֹל; (shortened) from H1431 (גָּדַל) great (in any sense); hence...). Name fits cultic or priestly role.

H2291.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H2291.s: A man from the tribe of Gad living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.16; referred to as Haggi or Haggite (חַגִּי);  son of Gad; a brother of Ziphion, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arod and Areli.
H2291.f: Son of Gad, grandson of Jacob.
H2291.meaning: from H2287 (חָגַג); festive Chaggi, an Israelite; also (patronymically) a Chaggite, or...
H2291.significance: Son of Gad. Name (from H2287 (חָגַג); festive Chaggi, an Israelite; also (patronymically...). Name in lineage or family context.

H2293.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H2293.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.6.30; only referred to as Haggiah (חַגִּיָּה); a son of Shimea;  father of Asaiah.
H2293.significance: Son of Shimea. Name (from H2282 (חַג) and H3050 (יָהּ); festival of Jah Chaggijah, an Israe...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H2294.d: Woman living at the time of United Monarchy
H2294.s: A woman living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.3.4; only referred to as Haggith (חַגִּית); wife of David;  mother of Adonijah.
H2294.f: One of David's wives; mother of Adonijah.
H2294.significance: woman living at the time of united monarchy. Name meaning: feminine of H2291 (חַגִּי); festive Chaggith, a wife of David

H1905.d: Warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H1905.s: A warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.5.10; referred to as Hagri or Hagrite (הַגְרִי);  father of Mibhar.
H1905.f: A Gadite, father of Mibhar, one of David's mighty men.
H1905.meaning: or (prolonged) הַגְרִיאxlit Hagrîʼ corrected to Hagrîyʼ; perhaps patronymically from H1904...
H1905.significance: David's warrior. Name (or (prolonged) הַגְרִיאxlit Hagrîʼ corrected to Hagrîyʼ; perhaps patro...). Name fits martial or military role.

H6997.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H6997.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Ezr.8.12; only referred to as Hakkatan (קָטָן);  father of Johanan.
H6997.f: Father of Johanan, a leader who returned from Babylon.
H6997.significance: Returned leader. Name meaning: the same as H6996 (קָטָן); small Katan, an Israelite

H6976.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H6976.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.8; only referred to as Koz (קוֹץ);  son of Ashhur and Helah; a brother of Haahashtari, Zereth, Izhar and Ethnan;  half-brother of: Ahuzzam, Hepher and Temeni;  father of Anub, Zobebah, Harum and Jabez(?).
H6976.meaning: the same as H6975 (קוֹץ) Kots, the name of two Israelites
H6976.significance: Son of Ashhur. Name (the same as H6975 (קוֹץ) Kots, the name of two Israelites). Name in lineage or family context.

H2709.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H2709.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.51; only referred to as Hakupha (חֲקוּפָא).
H2709.f: A temple servant who returned from Babylonian exile.
H2709.meaning: Hitchcock: a commandment of the mouth
H2709.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: from an unused root probably meaning to bend; crooked Chakupha, one of...

H3873.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H3873.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Neh.3.12; only referred to as Hallohesh (הַלּוֹחֵשׁ);  father of Shallum.
H3873.f: Father of Shallum, a leader who helped repair Jerusalem's wall.
H3873.meaning: active participle of H3907 (לָחַשׁ); (the) enchanter Lochesh, an Israelite
H3873.significance: Returned builder. Name meaning: active participle of H3907 (לָחַשׁ); (the) enchanter Lochesh, an Israe...

H2526.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H2526.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.5.32; only referred to as Ham (חָם);  son of Noah; a brother of Shem and Japheth;  father of Canaan, Cush, Egypt and Put.
H2526.f: One of Noah's three sons, father of Canaan.
H2526.meaning: Hitchcock: hot; heat; brown. BehindTheName: Possibly means 'hot' or 'warm' in Hebrew.
H2526.significance: Son of Noah. Name (the same as H2525 (חָם); hot (from the tropical habitat) Cham, a son o...). Name in lineage or family context.

H2001.d: Persian living at the time of Exile and Return
H2001.s: A man of Persia living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Est.3.1; only referred to as Haman (הָמָן); a son of Hammedatha; husband of Zeresh;  father of Parshandatha, Dalphon, Aspatha, Poratha, Adalia, Aridatha, Parmashta, Arisai, Aridai, Vaizatha.
H2001.f: A Persian official who plotted to destroy the Jews.
H2001.significance: A Persian man. Name (of foreign derivation Haman, a Persian vizier). Name in lineage or family context.

H2577.s: People from Hamath(?) of the Canaanites, first mentioned at Gen.10.18; only referred to as Hamathites (חֲמָתִי); descended from Canaan along with Sidon, Heth, Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites, Hivites, Arkites, Sinites, Arvadites and Zemarites.
H2577.f: A Canaanite people group descended from Canaan.
H2577.meaning: patrial from H2574 (חֲמָת) a Chamathite or native of Chamath
H2577.significance: Canaanites. Name meaning: patrial from H2574 (חֲמָת) a Chamathite or native of Chamath

H2575.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H2575.s: A man from the tribe of Judah  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.55; only referred to as Hammath (חַמַּת);  father or founder of Rechabites.
H2575.f: A Kenite clan, descendants of Salma.
H2575.meaning: a variation for the first part of H2576 (חַמֹּת דֹּאר); hot springs Chammath, a place in Palestine
H2575.significance: Minor figure; name: a variation for the first part of H2576 (חַמֹּת דֹּאר); hot springs Chammath, a place in Palestine

H4099.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H4099.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Est.3.1; only referred to as Hammedatha (הַמְּדָתָא);  father of Haman.
H4099.f: The father of Haman, the enemy of the Jews.
H4099.meaning: Hitchcock: he that troubles the law
H4099.significance: Esther's opponent. Name meaning: of Persian origin Medatha, the father of Haman

H4428.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H4428.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at Jer.36.26; only referred to as Hammelech (הַמֶּלֶךְ);  father of Jerahmeel and Malchijah.  also translated "the king";
H4428.f: Father of Jerahmeel and Malchijah (or 'Malchiah'), officials during Jeremiah's time.
H4428.significance: Father of Jerahmeel. Name (from H4427 (מָלַךְ) a king). Name in lineage or family context.

H4447.d: Woman living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H4447.s: A woman from the tribe of Manasseh living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.18; only referred to as Hammolecheth (הַמֹּלֶכֶת);  daughter of Machir; a sister of Gilead, daughter of Machir, Peresh and Sheresh;  mother of Ishhod, Abiezer and Mahlah.
H4447.f: Sister of Gilead; mother of Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.
H4447.meaning: feminine active participle of H4427 (מָלַךְ); queen Moleketh, an Israelitess
H4447.significance: Minor figure; name: feminine active participle of H4427 (מָלַךְ); queen Moleketh, an Israelitess

H2536.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H2536.s: A man from the tribe of Simeon living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.26; only referred to as Hammuel (חַמּוּאֵל); a son of Mishma;  father of Zaccur.
H2536.f: Son of Mishma, a descendant of Simeon.
H2536.meaning: from H2535 (חַמָּה) and H410 (אֵל); anger of God Chammuel, an Israelite
H2536.significance: Son of Mishma. Name (from H2535 (חַמָּה) and H410 (אֵל); anger of God Chammuel, an Israelit...). Name in lineage or family context.

H2544.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H2544.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.33.19; referred to as Hamor (חֲמוֹר), or Hamor (Ἐμμόρ);  father of Shechem; founder of Shechem.
H2544.f: A Hivite prince, father of Shechem.
H2544.significance: Father of Shechem. Name (the same as H2543 (חֲמוֹר); donkey Chamor, a Canaanite). Name in lineage or family context.

H2538.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H2538.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.12; referred to as Hamul (חָמוּל), or Hamulite (חָמוּלִי);  son of Perez; a brother of Hezron.
H2538.f: Son of Perez, grandson of Judah.
H2538.significance: Son of Perez. Name (from H2550 (חָמַל); pitied Chamul, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H2537.d: Woman living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H2537.s: A woman living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.23.31; referred to as Hamutal (חֲמוּטַל); a daughter of Jeremiah; wife of Josiah;  mother of Jehoahaz and Zedekiah.
H2537.f: Mother of Jehoahaz and Zedekiah, kings of Judah.
H2537.meaning: Hitchcock: the shadow of his heat
H2537.significance: Daughter of Jeremiah. Name meaning: or חֲמִיטַל; from H2524 (חָם) and H2919 (טַל); father-in-law of dew Ch...

H2601.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H2601.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at Jer.32.7; only referred to as Hanamel (חֲנַמְאֵל); a son of Shallum.
H2601.f: Jeremiah's cousin, from whom he bought a field.
H2601.meaning: probably by orthographical variation for H2606 (חֲנַנְאֵל) Chanamel, an Israelite
H2601.significance: Son of Shallum. Name (probably by orthographical variation for H2606 (חֲנַנְאֵל) Chanamel, a...). Name in lineage or family context.

H2605.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H2605.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.23; only referred to as Hanan (חָנָן);  son of Shashak; a brother of Ishpan, Eber, Eliel, Abdon, Zichri, Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah, Iphdeiah and Penuel.
H2605.significance: Minor figure; name: from H2603 (חָנַן); favor Chanan, the name of seven Israelites

H2607.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H2607.s: A musician from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.25.4; only referred to as Hanani (חֲנָנִי);  son of Heman; a brother of Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.
H2607.f: A musician in the temple during David's reign.
H2607.significance: Son of Heman. Name (from H2603 (חָנַן); gracious Chanani, the name of six Israelites). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H2608.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H2608.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.3.19; only referred to as Hananiah (חֲנַנְיָ֫הוּ);  son of Zerubbabel; a brother of Meshullam, Shelomith, Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, Jushab-hesed and Abiud;  father of Pelatiah, Jeshaiah, Rephaiah, Arnan, Obadiah and Shecaniah.
H2608.f: Son of Zerubbabel, a descendant of King David.
H2608.meaning: Hitchcock: grace; mercy; gift of the Lord
H2608.significance: Son of Zerubbabel. Name (or חֲנַנְיָהוּ; from H2603 (חָנַן) and H3050 (יָהּ); Jah has favored C...). Name in lineage or family context.

H2584.d: Woman living at the time of United Monarchy
H2584.s: A woman living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.1.2; only referred to as Hannah (חַנָּה); wife of Elkanah;  mother of Samuel.
H2584.f: The mother of the prophet Samuel.
H2584.meaning: Hitchcock: gracious; merciful; he that gives. BehindTheName: From Hebrew חַנָּה (Ḥanna) meaning 'favour, grace'.
H2584.significance: woman living at the time of united monarchy. Name meaning: from H2603 (חָנַן); favored Channah, an Israelitess

H2592.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H2592.s: A man from the tribe of Asher living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.39; only referred to as Hanniel (חַנִּיאֵל);  son of Shual; a brother of Arah and Rizia.
H2592.f: A descendant of Asher, son of Ulla.
H2592.meaning: Hitchcock: grace or mercy of God
H2592.significance: Minor figure; name: from H2603 (חָנַן) and H410 (אֵל); favor of God Channiel, the name of two Israelites

H2586.d: King living at the time of United Monarchy
H2586.s: A king of the Ammonites living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.10.1; only referred to as Hanun (חָנוּן); a son of Nahash.
H2586.f: An Ammonite king who mistreated David's envoys.
H2586.significance: Ammonite king. Name (from H2603 (חָנַן); favored Chanun, the name of an Ammonite and of two...). Name in royal or ruling context.

H6483.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H6483.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.24.15; only referred to as Happizzez (פִּצֵּץ).
H6483.f: The head of the 18th priestly division.
H6483.meaning: from an unused root meaning to dissever; dispersive Pitstsets, a priest
H6483.significance: Minor figure; name: from an unused root meaning to dissever; dispersive Pitstsets, a priest

H2771.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H2771.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at 1Ch.2.46; only referred to as Haran (חָרָן);  son of Caleb and Ephah; a brother of Moza and Gazez;  half-brother of: Hur, Jesher, Shobab, Ardon, Mesha, Sheber, Tirhanah, Regem(?), Jotham(?), Geshan(?), Pelet(?), Ephah(?), Shaaph(?), Shaaph, Sheva and Achsah;  father of Gazez.
H2771.f: A descendant of Caleb, son of Caleb's concubine Ephah.
H2771.significance: Son of Caleb. Name (from H2787 (חָרַר); parched Charan, the name of a man and also of a pl...). Name in lineage or family context.

H2039.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H2039.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.11.26; only referred to as Haran (הָרָן);  son of Terah; a brother of Abraham, Nahor and Sarah;  father of Lot, Milcah and Iscah.
H2039.f: Son of Terah, brother of Abraham and father of Lot.
H2039.significance: Son of Terah. Name (perhaps from H2022 (הַר); mountaineer Haran, the name of two men). Name in lineage or family context.

H2043.s: A group of warriors from Harar or Harod (cf. 2Sa.23.11, 25), first mentioned at 2Sa.23.11; referred to as Hararites (הֲרָרִי), or Hararite (ארָרִֽי).
H2043.f: A group mentioned in the context of David's mighty men.
H2043.meaning: or הָרָרִי; (2 Samuel 23:11), or הָארָרִי; (2 Samuel 23:34, last clause [), apparently from...
H2043.significance: Family of warrior. Name (or הָרָרִי; (2 Samuel 23:11), or הָארָרִי; (2 Samuel 23:34, last claus...). Name fits martial or military role.

H2726.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H2726.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Est.7.9; only referred to as Harbona (חַרְבוֹנָא).
H2726.f: A eunuch who exposed Haman's plot to hang Mordecai.
