H4318.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H4318.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.9.12; referred to as Micah (מִיכָה), or Mica (KJV= Micha, NIV= Mika)  (מִיכָא); a son of Mephibosheth;  father of Pithon, Melech, Tarea and Ahaz.
H4318.f: Son of Mephibosheth, grandson of Jonathan.
H4318.meaning: From מִי (mi), who, + כָּמוֹ (kamo), like. Micah = who is like (Yah). Prophet (Mic 1:1). Hitchcock: poor; humble. BehindTheName: From Hebrew מִיכָה (Mikha), short form of Micaiah, meaning 'who is like Yahweh?'.
H4318.significance: Prophet of Bethlehem (Mic 5:2); “who is like God?” (Mic 7:18). Name as the question that points to the one from Bethlehem.

H4321.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H4321.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at Jer.36.11; only referred to as Micaiah (מִיכָֽיְהוּ); a son of Gemariah.
H4321.f: Son of Gemariah, reported Baruch's reading of Jeremiah's scroll.
H4321.meaning: Hitchcock: who is like to God?
H4321.significance: Son of Gemariah. Name (or מִכָיְהוּ; (Jeremiah 36:11), abbreviated form for H4322 (מִיכָיָהוּ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H4322.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H4322.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ch.17.7; only referred to as Micaiah (מִיכָיָ֫הוּ).
H4322.f: A Levite sent by Jehoshaphat to teach the Law.
H4322.meaning: Hitchcock: who is like to God?
H4322.significance: Minor figure; name: for H4320 (מִיכָיָה) Mikajah, the name of an Israelite and an Israelitess

H4320.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H4320.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.22.12; referred to as Micaiah (מִיכָיָה), or Micah (מִיכָה);  father of Achbor.
H4320.f: A Levite sent by King Josiah to inquire of the Lord.
H4320.meaning: Hitchcock: who is like to God?
H4320.significance: Father of Achbor. Name (from H4310 (מִי) and (the prefix derivative from) H3588 (כִּי) and H30...). Name in lineage or family context.

H4317.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H4317.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ch.21.2; only referred to as Michael (מִיכָאֵל);  son of Jehoshaphat; a brother of Jehoram, Azariah, Jehiel, Zechariah, Azariahu and Shephatiah.
H4317.f: A son of King Jehoshaphat of Judah.
H4317.meaning: BehindTheName: From Hebrew מִיכָאֵל (Mikhaʾel) meaning 'who is like God?'.
H4317.significance: Minor figure; name: from H4310 (מִי) and (the prefix derivative from) H3588 (כִּי) and H410 (אֵל); who (is) like...

H4324.d: Woman living at the time of United Monarchy
H4324.s: A woman from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.14.49; only referred to as Michal (מִיכַל);  daughter of Saul and Ahinoam; wife of David and Palti; a sister of Jonathan, Abinadab, Malchi-shua and Merab;  half-sister of: Ish-bosheth, Armoni and Mephibosheth.
H4324.f: Daughter of Saul; wife of David.
H4324.significance: Saul's daughter. Name meaning: apparently the same as H4323 (מִיכָל); revulet Mikal, Saul's daughter

H4381.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H4381.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at 1Ch.9.8; only referred to as Michri (מִכְרִי);  father of Uzzi.
H4381.f: A Benjamite who lived in Jerusalem.
H4381.significance: Father of Uzzi. Name (from H4376 (מָכַר); salesman Mikri, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H4080.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H4080.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.25.2; only referred to as Midian (מִדְיָן);  son of Abraham and Keturah;  half-brother of: Ishmael and Isaac; a brother of Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Ishbak and Shuah;  father of Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida and Eldaah.
H4080.f: Son of Abraham and Keturah; father of the Midianites.
H4080.significance: Son of Abraham. Name (the same as H4079 (מִדְיָן) Midjan, a son of Abraham; also his country...). Name in lineage or family context.

H4326.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H4326.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Ezr.10.25; only referred to as Mijamin (מִיָּמִן).
H4326.f: An Israelite who married a foreign woman.
H4326.significance: Minor figure; name: a form for H4509 (מִנְיָמִין) Mijamin, the name of three Israelites

H4732.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H4732.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.8.32; only referred to as Mikloth (מִקְלוֹת);  son of Abiel and Maacah; a brother of Kish, Ner, Abdon, Zur, Baal, Nadab, Gedor, Ahio and Zecher;  father of Shimeah.
H4732.meaning: Hitchcock: little wants; little voices; looking downward
H4732.significance: Son of Abiel. Name ((or perhaps mik-kel-ohth') plural of (feminine) H4731 (מַקֵּל); rods M...). Name in lineage or family context.

H4737.d: Singer living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H4737.s: A musician living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.15.18; only referred to as Mikneiah (מִקְנֵיָ֫הוּ).
H4737.f: A Levite musician during David's reign.
H4737.meaning: from H4735 (מִקְנֶה) and H3050 (יָהּ); possession of Jah Miknejah, an Israelite
H4737.significance: A singer. Name meaning: from H4735 (מִקְנֶה) and H3050 (יָהּ); possession of Jah Miknejah, an ...

H4450.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H4450.s: A musician living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.12.36; only referred to as Milalai (מִֽלֲלַי);  son of Jonathan; a brother of Zechariah, Shemaiah, Azarel, Gilalai, Maai, Nethanel, Judah and Hanani.
H4450.f: A priest who participated in the dedication of Jerusalem's wall.
H4450.significance: Minor figure; name: from H4448 (מָלַל); talkative Milalai, an Israelite

H4435.d: Woman living at the time of the Patriarchs
H4435.s: A woman living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.11.29; only referred to as Milcah (מִלְכָּה);  daughter of Haran; a sister of Lot and Iscah; wife of Nahor;  mother of Uz, Buz, Kemuel, Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph and Bethuel.
H4435.significance: Sister of Lot. Name meaning: a form of H4436 (מַלְכָּה); queen Milcah, the name of a Hebrewess and ...

H4509.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H4509.s: A musician living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.12.41; only referred to as Miniamin (מִנְיָמִין).
H4509.f: A priest who played a trumpet in Nehemiah's time.
H4509.significance: Minor figure; name: from H4480 (מִן) and H3225 (יָמִין); from (the) right hand Minjamin, the name of two Israelites

H4813.d: Woman living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H4813.s: A woman from the tribe of Judah(?) living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.17; only referred to as Miriam (מִרְיָם);  daughter of Mered(?) and Bithiah; a sister of Shammai and Ishbah;  half-sister of: Jered(?), Heber(?) and Jekuthiel(?).
H4813.f: A descendant of Judah, mentioned in a genealogy.
H4813.meaning: Hitchcock: rebellion. BehindTheName: From Hebrew מִרְיָם, meaning uncertain.
H4813.significance: Minor figure; name: from H4805 (מְרִי); rebelliously Mirjam, the name of two Israelitesses

H4821.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H4821.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.10; only referred to as Mirmah (מִרְמָה);  son of Shaharaim and Hodesh; a brother of Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malcam, Jeuz, Sachia, Abitub and Elpaal.
H4821.f: A Benjamite mentioned in a genealogy.
H4821.meaning: the same as H4820 (מִרְמָה) Mirmah, an Israelite
H4821.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H4820 (מִרְמָה) Mirmah, an Israelite

H4332.d: Levite living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H4332.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Exo.6.22; only referred to as Mishael (מִישָׁאֵל);  son of Uzziel; a brother of Elizaphan, Sithri, Micah and Isshiah.
H4332.f: A Levite who helped remove the bodies of Nadab and Abihu.
H4332.meaning: Hitchcock: who is asked for or lent
H4332.significance: Son of Uzziel. Name (from H4310 (מִי) and H410 (אֵל) with the abbreviated form insep. relat...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H4936.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H4936.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.8.12; only referred to as Misham (מִשְׁעָם);  son of Elpaal; a brother of Eber, Shemed, Beriah, Shema, Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber, Ishmerai, Izliah and Jobab.
H4936.significance: Minor figure; name: apparently from H8159 (שָׁעָה); inspection Misham, an Israelite

H4927.d: Arabian living at the time of the Patriarchs
H4927.s: A man of the Arabs living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.25.14; only referred to as Mishma (מִשְׁמָע);  son of Ishmael; a brother of Nebaioth, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, Kedemah and Mahalath.
H4927.f: A son of Ishmael, Abraham's son.
H4927.significance: Son of Ishmael. Name (the same as H4926 (מִשְׁמָע) Mishma, the name of a son of Ishmael, and...). Name in lineage or family context.

H4925.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H4925.s: A warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.12.10; only referred to as Mishmannah (מִשְׁמַנָּה).
H4925.f: A Gadite warrior who joined David at Ziklag.
H4925.significance: Minor figure; name: from H8080 (שָׁמַן); fatness Mashmannah, an Israelite

H4954.s: People from Mishrait(?), only mentioned at 1Ch.2.53; only referred to as Mishraites (מִשְׁרָעִי).
H4954.f: A clan descended from Shobal, of the tribe of Judah.
H4954.significance: Minor figure; name: patrial from an unused noun from an unused root; probably meaning to stretch out; extension a...

H4558.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H4558.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.2; referred to as Mispar (מִסְפָּר), or Mispereth (מִסְפֶּרֶת).
H4558.f: One of the returnees from Babylonian exile.
H4558.meaning: Hitchcock: Mispereth, numbering; showing; increase of tribute
H4558.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: the same as H4457 (מֶלְקָח); number Mispar, an Israelite

H4981.s: A group of warriors from Mithn(?), only mentioned at 1Ch.11.43; only referred to as Mithnites (מִתְנִי).
H4981.f: The people of an unknown place or family.
H4981.meaning: probably patrial from an unused noun meaning slenderness a Mithnite, or inhabitant of Methen
H4981.significance: Minor figure; name: probably patrial from an unused noun meaning slenderness a Mithnite, or inhabitant of Methen

H4990.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H4990.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Ezr.4.7; only referred to as Mithredath (מִתְרְדָת).
H4990.f: A Persian official who opposed the rebuilding of Jerusalem.
H4990.significance: Minor figure; name: of Persian origin Mithredath, the name of two Persians

H4199.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H4199.s: A man of the Edomites living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.13; only referred to as Mizzah (מִזָּה);  son of Reuel; a brother of Nahath, Zerah and Shammah.
H4199.f: A grandson of Esau and a chief of Edom.
H4199.significance: An Edomite. Name (probably from an unused root meaning to faint with fear; terror Mizzah...). Name in lineage or family context.

G3416.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G3416.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Act.21.16; only referred to as Mnason (Μνάσων).
G3416.f: A Cypriot disciple who hosted Paul in Jerusalem.
G3416.meaning: Hitchcock: a diligent seeker; an exhorter
G3416.significance: Minor figure; name: of uncertain origin Mnason, a Christian

H4124.d: Moabite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H4124.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, only mentioned at Gen.19.37; only referred to as Moab (מוֹאָב); a son of Lot and his first daughter;  half-brother of Ben-ammi.
H4124.f: Son of Lot, born from an incestuous relationship.
H4124.significance: Minor figure; name: from a prolonged form of the prepositional prefix m-and H1 (אָב); from (her (the mother's))...

H4140.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H4140.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.29; only referred to as Molid (מוֹלִיד);  son of Abishur and Abihail; a brother of Ahban.
H4140.f: Son of Abisur, of the tribe of Judah.
H4140.significance: Minor figure; name: from H3205 (יָלַד); genitor Molid, an Israelite

H4782.d: Esther's adversary living at the time of Exile and Return
H4782.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Est.2.5; only referred to as Mordecai (מׇרְדֳּכַי); a son of Jair.
H4782.f: Esther's cousin, a Jewish leader in the Persian court.
H4782.meaning: From מָרְדֳּכַי (Mordechai); possibly from Marduk (Babylonian god) or Hebrew “little man.” Mordecai = cousin of Esther (Est 2:5). Hitchcock: contrition; bitter; bruising. BehindTheName: From Hebrew מָרְדֳּכַי possibly from Akkadian Marduk.
H4782.significance: Refused to bow to Haman (Est 3:2); “for such a time as this” (Est 4:14). Exalted under Xerxes (Est 8:2). Name in the deliverance of the Jews in Persia.

H4872.d: Levite living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H4872.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Exo.2.10; referred to as Moses (KJV= Moses) (מֹשֶׁה), or Moses (Aramiac מֹשֶׁה), or Moses (=LXX, KJV= Manasseh) (מְנַשֶּׁה), or Moses (Μωϋσῆς, Μωσῆς);  son of Amram and Jochebed; a brother of Aaron and Miriam; husband of Zipporah;  father of Gershom and Eliezer.
H4872.meaning: Hebrew מֹשֶׁה (Moshe); Egyptian element—“drawn out” (Ex 2:10). Possibly also Hebrew מָשָׁה (mashah), draw out. Hitchcock: taken out; drawn forth. BehindTheName: From Hebrew מֹשֶׁה (Moshe), possibly Egyptian in origin, traditionally 'drawn out' (Ex 2:10).
H4872.significance: Deliverer and lawgiver; type of Christ as prophet (Deut 18:15) and mediator. Drawn out of the water—Israel drawn out of Egypt. His face shone (Ex 34:29); the law’s glory points to the greater Prophet.

G4074.d: Apostle living at the time of the New Testament
G4074.s: An apostle living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Mat.4.18; referred to as Peter (Πέτρος), or Simon (Σίμων), or Simeon (Συμεών), or Cephas (Κηφᾶς), or Bar-Jonah (KJV= Bar-Jona, NIV= "son of Jonah") (Βαριωνᾶς);  son of John; a brother of Andrew.
G4074.meaning: Greek Πέτρος (Petros); from πέτρα (petra), rock. Peter = rock. Apostle (Matt 16:18). Hitchcock: a rock or stone. BehindTheName: From Greek Πέτρος (Petros) meaning 'stone'.
G4074.significance: Cephas; confessor (“You are the Christ”) and foundation of the church. Denied three times, restored three times (John 21). Name (rock) as the one on whom Christ builds.

H4162.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H4162.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.46; only referred to as Moza (מוֹצָא);  son of Caleb and Ephah; a brother of Haran and Gazez;  half-brother of: Hur, Jesher, Shobab, Ardon, Mesha, Sheber, Tirhanah, Regem(?), Jotham(?), Geshan(?), Pelet(?), Ephah(?), Shaaph(?), Shaaph, Sheva and Achsah.
H4162.f: Son of Caleb by his concubine Ephah
H4162.meaning: the same as H4161 (מוֹצָא) Motsa, the name of two Israelites
H4162.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H4161 (מוֹצָא) Motsa, the name of two Israelites

H4649.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H4649.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.21; referred to as Muppim (מֻפִּים), or Shephupham (KJV, NIV= Shupham)  (שְׁפוּפָם), or Shephuphan (שְׁפוּפָן), or Shuphamite (שׁוּפָמִי);  son of Benjamin; a brother of Bela, Becher, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ahiram, Rosh, Huppim, Ard, Ahiram and Jediael.
H4649.meaning: Hitchcock: out of the mouth; covering
H4649.significance: man living at the time of egypt and wilderness. Name (a plural apparently from H5130 (נוּף); wavings Muppim, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H4187.d: Levite living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H4187.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Exo.6.19; referred to as Mushi (מוּשִׁי), or Mushite (מוּשִׁי);  son of Merari; a brother of Mahli and Jaaziah;  father of Mahli, Eder and Jerimoth.
H4187.f: A Levite, son of Merari, and head of a clan.
H4187.meaning: Hitchcock: he that touches, that withdraws or takes away
H4187.significance: Son of Merari. Name (or מֻשִּׁי; from H4184 (מוּשׁ); sensitive Mushi, a Levite). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H5277.s: A man from the tribe of Judah  living before Israel's Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.15; only referred to as Naam (נָ֑עַם);  son of Caleb; a brother of Achsah, Iru and Elah.
H5277.f: Son of Caleb, from the tribe of Judah.
H5277.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5276 (נָעֵם); pleasure Naam, an Israelite

H5279.d: Woman living at the time before the Flood
H5279.s: A woman living at the time before the Flood, only mentioned at Gen.4.22; only referred to as Naamah (נַעֲמָה);  daughter of Lamech and Zillah; a sister of Jabal, Jubal, Tubal-cain;  According to some traditions, wife of Noah and mother of Shem, Ham and Japheth.
H5279.f: Daughter of Lamech and Zillah, sister of Tubal-cain.
H5279.significance: Minor figure; name: feminine of H5277 (נַעַם); pleasantness Naamah, the name of an antediluvian woman, of an...

H5283.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5283.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.26.40; referred to as Naaman (נַעֲמָן), or Naamite (נַעֲמִי);  son of Bela; a brother of Ard, Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, Iri, Addar, Gera, Abihud, Abishua and Ahoah.
H5283.f: Grandson of Benjamin, head of the Naamite clan.
H5283.significance: Son of Bela. Name (the same as H5282 (נַעֲמָן) Naaman, the name of an Israelite and of a ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5284.s: People from Naamath(?), first mentioned at Job.2.11; only referred to as Naamathites (נַעֲמָתִי).
H5284.f: The people group of Zophar, Job's friend.
H5284.meaning: patrial from a place corresponding in name (but not identical) with H5279 (נַעֲמָה) a...
H5284.significance: people from naamath(?). Name meaning: patrial from a place corresponding in name (but not identical) with H5...

H5292.d: Woman living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5292.s: A woman from the tribe of Judah  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.4.5; only referred to as Naarah (נַעֲרָה); wife of Ashhur;  mother of Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni and Haahashtari.
H5292.f: Wife of Ashhur, the founder of Tekoa.
H5292.significance: From  Judah(?). Name meaning: the same as H5291 (נַעֲרָה) Naarah, the name of an Israelitess, and of...

H5293.d: Warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5293.s: A warrior living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.11.37; only referred to as Naarai (נַעֲרַי); a son of Ezbai.
H5293.f: One of David's mighty warriors, son of Ezbai.
H5293.meaning: from H5288 (נַעַר); youthful Naarai, an Israelite
H5293.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5288 (נַעַר); youthful Naarai, an Israelite

H5037.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H5037.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.25.3; only referred to as Nabal (נָבָל); husband of Abigail.
H5037.f: Wealthy Carmelite; husband of Abigail. He was known for foolishness.
H5037.significance: man living at the time of united monarchy. Name meaning: the same as H5036 (נָבָל); dolt Nabal, an Israelite

H5022.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5022.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ki.21.1; only referred to as Naboth (נָבוֹת).
H5022.f: Jezreelite vineyard owner, unjustly killed by Ahab and Jezebel.
H5022.significance: man living at the time of divided monarchy. Name meaning: feminine plural from the same as H5011 (נֹב); fruits Naboth, an Israel...

H5225.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H5225.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.6.6; referred to as Nacon (נָכוֹן), or Chidon (NIV= Kidon)  (כִּידֹן).
H5225.f: Threshing floor where Uzzah touched the ark.
H5225.meaning: from H3559 (כּוּן); prepared Nakon, probably an Israelite
H5225.significance: man living at the time of the patriarchs. Name meaning: from H3559 (כּוּן); prepared Nakon, probably an Israelite

H5070.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H5070.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.8.30; only referred to as Nadab (נָדָב);  son of Abiel and Maacah; a brother of Kish, Ner, Abdon, Zur, Baal, Gedor, Ahio, Zecher and Mikloth.
H5070.f: Son of Abiel, from the tribe of Benjamin.
H5070.meaning: Hitchcock: free and voluntary gift; prince
H5070.significance: Son of Abiel. Name (from H5068 (נָדַב); liberal Nadab, the name of four Israelites). Name in lineage or family context.

G3477.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
G3477.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Luk.3.25; only referred to as Naggai (Ναγγαί); a son of Maath;  father of Esli.
G3477.meaning: probably of Hebrew origin (compare H05052) Nangæ (i.e. perhaps Nogach), an Israelite
G3477.significance: Son of Maath. Name (probably of Hebrew origin (compare H05052) Nangæ (i.e. perhaps Nogach)...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5163.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5163.s: A man from the tribe of Judah(?) living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.19; only referred to as Naham (נַ֫חַם); a brother of Hodiah.
H5163.f: Brother of Hodiah who married Ishbar.
H5163.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5162 (נָחַם); consolation Nacham, an Israelite

H5167.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H5167.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.7.7; only referred to as Nahamani (נַחֲמָנִי).
H5167.f: One who returned from Babylonian exile with Zerubbabel.
H5167.meaning: from H5162 (נָחַם); consolatory Nachamani, an Israelite
H5167.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5162 (נָחַם); consolatory Nachamani, an Israelite

H5171.d: Warrior living at the time of United Monarchy
H5171.s: A warrior living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.23.37; only referred to as Naharai (נַחֲרַי).
H5171.f: One of David's mighty men, Joab's armor-bearer.
H5171.significance: David's warrior. Name (or נַחְרַי; from the same as H5170 (נַחַר); snorer Nacharai or Nachrai...). Name fits martial or military role.

H5176.d: Woman living at the time of United Monarchy
H5176.s: A woman living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Sa.17.25; only referred to as Nahash (נָחָשׁ);  wife of Jesse;  mother of David, Eliab, Abinadab, Shimeah, Nethanel, Raddai, Ozem, Zeruiah, Abigail(?) and Elihu.
H5176.f: Father of Abigail and Zeruiah, David's sisters.
H5176.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H5175 (נָחָשׁ) Nachash, the name of two persons apparently non-Israelite

H5184.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H5184.s: A man of the Edomites living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.13; only referred to as Nahath (נַ֫חַת);  son of Reuel; a brother of Zerah, Shammah and Mizzah.
H5184.f: A descendant of Esau, a chief of Edom.
H5184.significance: An Edomite. Name (the same as H5183 (נַחַת); quiet Nachath, the name of an Edomite and o...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5147.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5147.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.13.14; only referred to as Nahbi (נַחְבִּי); a son of Vophsi.
H5147.f: The spy from the tribe of Naphtali.
H5147.significance: Minor figure; name: from H2247 (חָבָה); occult Nachbi, an Israelite

H5152.d: Abraham's brother living at the time of the Patriarchs
H5152.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.11.26; only referred to as Nahor (נָחוֹר);  son of Terah; a brother of Abraham, Haran and Sarah; husband of Milcah and Reumah;  father of Uz, Buz, Kemuel, Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, Bethuel, Tebah, Gaham, Tahash and Maacah.
H5152.f: Son of Terah, Abraham's brother; father of Bethuel.
H5152.significance: Abraham's brother. Name (from the same as H5170 (נַחַר); snorer Nochor, the name of the grandfa...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5177.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Exo.6.23; referred to as Nahshon (נַחְשׁוֹן), or Nahshon (KJV= Naasson)  (Ναασσών);  son of Amminadab; a brother of Elisheba;  father of Salmon.
H5177.f: Son of Amminadab, leader of Judah, ancestor of David.
H5177.significance: Son of Amminadab. Name (from H5172 (נָחַשׁ); enchanter Nachshon, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

G3486.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
G3486.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Luk.3.25; only referred to as Nahum (Ναούμ); a son of Esli;  father of Amos.
G3486.significance: Son of Esli. Name (of Hebrew origin (H05151) Naum (i.e. Nachum), an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H5151.d: Prophet living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5151.s: A prophet living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at Nam.1.1; only referred to as Nahum (נַחוּם).
H5151.f: Old Testament prophet, author of the Book of Nahum.
H5151.meaning: From נָחַם (nacham), comfort. Nahum = comfort. Prophet (Nah 1:1). Hitchcock: comforter; penitent
H5151.significance: Vision concerning Nineveh (Nah 1:1); “the Lord is slow to anger” (Nah 1:3). Name (comfort) as the one who spoke comfort to Judah—and judgment to the oppressor.

H5281.s: A woman living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Rut.1.2; referred to as Naomi (נׇעֳמִי), or Mara (מָרָא); wife of Elimelech;  mother of Mahlon and Chilion.
H5281.meaning: From נֹעַם (noam), pleasantness. Naomi = my pleasantness. Mother-in-law of Ruth (Ruth 1:2). Hitchcock: beautiful; agreeable. BehindTheName: From Hebrew נָעֳמִי (Noʿomi) meaning 'pleasantness'.
H5281.significance: “Call me Mara [bitter], for the Almighty has dealt bitterly with me” (Ruth 1:20). Returned with Ruth; Boaz became kinsman-redeemer. Name (pleasant) vs. grief—yet redemption at the end.

H5305.d: Arabian living at the time of the Patriarchs
H5305.s: A man of the Arabs living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.25.15; only referred to as Naphish (נָפִישׁ);  son of Ishmael; a brother of Nebaioth, Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam, Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Kedemah and Mahalath.
H5305.f: Son of Ishmael, defeated by Reubenites, Gadites, and Manassites.
H5305.meaning: Hitchcock: the soul; he that rests, refreshes himself, or respires
H5305.significance: Son of Ishmael. Name (from H5314 (נָפַשׁ); refreshed Naphish, a son of Ishmael, and his post...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5321.d: Jacob's son living at the time of the Patriarchs
H5321.s: A man who founded the tribe of Naphtali  living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.30.8; referred to as Naphtali (נַפְתָּלִי), or Naphtali (KJV= Nephtali)  (Νεφθαλείμ);  son of Israel and Bilhah; a brother of Dan;  half-brother of: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Gad, Asher, Issachar, Zebulun, Dinah, Joseph and Benjamin;  father of Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer and Shillem.
H5321.f: Son of Jacob, founder of the tribe of Naphtali.
H5321.meaning: Hitchcock: that struggles or fights. BehindTheName: From Hebrew נַפְתָּלִי meaning 'my struggle'.
H5321.significance: Son of Israel. Name (from H6617 (פָּתַל); my wrestling Naphtali, a son of Jacob, with the t...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5320.s: People from Naphtuh(?) of the Egyptians, first mentioned at Gen.10.13; only referred to as Naphtuhim (נַפְתֻּחִים); descended from Egypt along with Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Pathrusim, Casluhim and Caphtorim.
H5320.f: Descendants of Mizraim, son of Ham
H5320.meaning: plural of foreign origin, Naphtuchim, an Egyptian tribe
H5320.significance: Early nation. Name meaning: plural of foreign origin, Naphtuchim, an Egyptian tribe

G3488.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G3488.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Rom.16.11; only referred to as Narcissus (Νάρκισσος).
G3488.f: Christian in Rome with a household
G3488.significance: Minor figure; name: a flower of the same name, from (stupefaction, as a "narcotic") Narcissus, a Roman

G3482.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G3482.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Jhn.1.45; only referred to as Nathanael (Ναθαναήλ).
G3482.f: Disciple of Jesus, from Cana in Galilee.
G3482.meaning: Hitchcock: the gift of God. BehindTheName: From Hebrew נְתַנְאֵל meaning 'God has given'.
G3482.significance: man living at the time of the new testament. Name meaning: of Hebrew origin (H05417) Nathanaël (i.e. Nathanel), an Israelite and ...

H5419.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5419.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ki.23.11; only referred to as Nathan-melech (נְתַן־מֶ֫לֶךְ).
H5419.f: A court official during King Josiah's reign.
H5419.meaning: Hitchcock: the gift of the king, or of counsel
H5419.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5414 (נָתַן) and H4428 (מֶלֶךְ); given of (the) king Nethan-Melek, an Israelite

H5294.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5294.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.3.22; only referred to as Neariah (נְעַרְיָה);  son of Shemaiah; a brother of Hattush, Igal, Bariah and Shaphat;  father of Elioenai, Hizkiah and Azrikam.
H5294.f: Descendant of David, son of Shemaiah.
H5294.significance: Son of Shemaiah. Name (from H5288 (נַעַר) and H3050 (יָהּ); servant of Jah Nearjah, the name ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5109.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H5109.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.10.19; only referred to as Nebai (נוֹבָ֑י).
H5109.f: A leader who sealed the covenant with Nehemiah.
H5109.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5108 (נוֹב); fruitful Nobai, an Israelite

H5032.d: Arabian living at the time of the Patriarchs
H5032.s: A man of the Arabs living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.25.13; only referred to as Nebaioth (נְבָיוֹת);  son of Ishmael; a brother of Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam, Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, Kedemah and Mahalath.
H5032.f: Firstborn son of Ishmael; father of a tribe.
H5032.significance: Son of Ishmael. Name (or נְבָיֹת; feminine plural from H5107 (נוּב); fruitfulnesses Nebajoth...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5028.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H5028.s: A man of the Kingdom of Israel, living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ki.11.26; only referred to as Nebat (נְבָט); husband of Zeruah;  father of Jeroboam.
H5028.f: Father of Jeroboam, the first king of Israel.
H5028.significance: Father of Jeroboam. Name (from H5027 (נָבַט); regard Nebat, the father of Jeroboam I). Name in lineage or family context.

H5019.d: Emperor living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5019.s: An emperor of Babylon living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.24.1; referred to as Nebuchadnezzar (נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר, נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר), or Nebuchadnezzar (KJV= Nebuchadrezzar)  (Aramiac נְבוּכַדְרֶאצַּר, נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר);  father of Belshazzar.
H5019.meaning: Hitchcock: Nebuchadrezzar, tears and groans of judgment. BehindTheName: From Akkadian Nabu-kudurri-usur meaning 'Nabu protect the crown'.
H5019.significance: emperor living at the time of divided monarchy. Name meaning: or נְבֻּכַדְנֶאצַּר; (2 Kings 24:1,10), or נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר; (Esther 2:...

H8310.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H8310.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at Jer.39.3; only referred to as Nebu-sar-sekim (שַׂרְסְכִים).
H8310.meaning: of foreign derivation Sarsekim, a Babylonian general
H8310.significance: Minor figure; name: of foreign derivation Sarsekim, a Babylonian general

H5021.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5021.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at Jer.39.13; only referred to as Nebushazban (נְבוּשַׁזְבָּן).
H5021.f: Babylonian official during the fall of Jerusalem.
H5021.meaning: of foreign derivation Nebushazban, Nebuchadnezzar's chief eunuch
H5021.significance: Minor figure; name: of foreign derivation Nebushazban, Nebuchadnezzar's chief eunuch

H5018.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5018.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.25.8; only referred to as Nebuzaradan (נְבוּזַרְאֲדָן).
H5018.f: Babylonian captain of the guard during Jerusalem's fall.
H5018.meaning: of foreign origin Nebuzaradan, a Babylonian general
H5018.significance: man living at the time of divided monarchy. Name meaning: of foreign origin Nebuzaradan, a Babylonian general

H5224.d: Pharaoh living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5224.s: A Pharaoh of Egypt living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Ki.23.29; referred to as Neco (נְכוֹ), or Pharaoh/ Neco (KJV= Pharaoh-nechoh, NIV= Pharaoh Necho)  (פַּרְעֹה נְכוֹ), or Pharaoh/ Neco (KJV= Pharaoh-nechoh, NIV= Pharaoh Necho)  (פַּרְעֹה נְכֹה), or Pharaoh (פַּרְעֹה).
H5224.meaning: probably of Egyptian origin Neko, an Egyptian king
H5224.significance: pharaoh living at the time of divided monarchy. Name meaning: probably of Egyptian origin Neko, an Egyptian king

H5072.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5072.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.3.18; only referred to as Nedabiah (נְדַבְיָה);  son of Shealtiel(?); a brother of Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah and Hoshama.
H5072.f: Descendant of King Jeconiah of Judah
H5072.meaning: Hitchcock: prince or vow of the Lord
H5072.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5068 (נָדַב) and H3050 (יָהּ); largess of Jah Nedabjah, an Israelite

H5161.s: People from Nehelm(?), first mentioned at Jer.29.24; only referred to as Nehelamite (נֶחֱלָמִי).
H5161.f: Hometown of the false prophet Shemaiah
H5161.significance: people from nehel(?). Name meaning: apparently a patronymic from an unused name (apparently passive partic...

H5166.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H5166.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Neh.1.1; only referred to as Nehemiah (נְחֶמְיָה);  son of Hacaliah; a brother of Hanani.
H5166.f: Governor of Judah, rebuilt Jerusalem's walls.
H5166.meaning: Hitchcock: consolation; repentance of the Lord. BehindTheName: From Hebrew נְחֶמְיָה meaning 'Yahweh comforts'.
H5166.significance: Returned leader. Name (from H5162 (נָחַם) and H3050 (יָהּ); consolation of Jah Nechemjah, the...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5179.d: Woman living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5179.s: A woman living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ki.24.8; only referred to as Nehushta (נְחֻשְׁתָּא); a daughter of Elnathan; wife of Jehoiakim;  mother of Jehoiachin.
H5179.f: Mother of King Jehoiachin of Judah.
H5179.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5178 (נְחֹשֶׁת); copper Nechushta, an Israelitess

H5353.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H5353.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.48; only referred to as Nekoda (נְקוֹדָא).
H5353.f: A family of temple servants who returned from exile.
H5353.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: feminine of H5348 (נָקֹד) (in the figurative sense of marked); distinc...

H5241.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5241.s: A man from the tribe of Reuben living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.26.9; only referred to as Nemuel (נְמוּאֵל);  son of Eliab; a brother of Dathan and Abiram.
H5241.f: Son of Eliab, from the tribe of Reuben.
H5241.significance: Minor figure; name: apparently for H3223 (יְמוּאֵל) Nemuel, the name of two Israelites

H5298.d: David's son living at the time of United Monarchy
H5298.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.5.15; only referred to as Nepheg (נֶ֫פֶג);  son of David; a brother of Amnon, Chileab, Absalom, Adonijah, Shephatiah, Ithream, Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon, Ibhar, Elishua, Japhia, Elishama, Eliada, Eliphelet, Tamar, Elpelet, Nogah and Jerimoth.
H5298.f: Son of King David, born in Jerusalem.
H5298.significance: David's son. Name (from an unused root probably meaning to spring forth; a sprout Nepheg,...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5303.s: People from Nephil(?), first mentioned at Gen.6.4; only referred to as Nephilim (נְפִלִים).
H5303.f: Mysterious giants mentioned in the pre-flood and post-flood eras.
H5303.meaning: or נְפִל; from H5307 (נָפַל) properly, a feller, i.e. a bully or tyrant
H5303.significance: people from nephil(?). Name meaning: or נְפִל; from H5307 (נָפַל) properly, a feller, i.e. a bully or tyran...

H5300.s: People from Nephus(?), first mentioned at Ezr.2.50; referred to as Nephushesim (נְפִישְׁסִים, נפיסים), or Nephisim (=Ketiv. Qere, KJV, NIV= Nephussim) (נְפִיסִים).
H5300.f: Family of temple servants who returned from exile.
H5300.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: for H5304 (נְפִיסִים) Nephushesim, a Temple-servant

H5369.d: Saul's uncle living at the time of United Monarchy
H5369.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.14.50; only referred to as Ner (נֵר);  son of Abiel and Maacah; a brother of Kish, Abdon, Zur, Baal, Nadab, Gedor, Ahio, Zecher and Mikloth;  father of Abner;  uncle of Saul.
H5369.f: Father of Abner, King Saul's commander.
H5369.significance: Abner's father. Name (the same as H5216 (נִיר); lamp Ner, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

G3517.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G3517.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Rom.16.15; only referred to as Nereus (Νηρεύς).
G3517.f: A Christian in Rome greeted by Paul.
G3517.significance: Minor figure; name: apparently from a derivative of the base of G3491 (ναῦς) (meaning wet) Nereus, a Christian

H5371.d: Babylonian official of Samgar living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5371.s: A man from Babylon, living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at Jer.39.3a; only referred to as Nergal-sar-ezer (נֵרְגַּל שַׁרְאֶ֫צֶר).
H5371.meaning: from H5370 (נֵרְגַּל) and H8272 (שַׁרְאֶצֶר) Nergal-Sharetser, the name of two Babylonians
H5371.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5370 (נֵרְגַּל) and H8272 (שַׁרְאֶצֶר) Nergal-Sharetser, the name of two Babylonians

G3518.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
G3518.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Luk.3.27; only referred to as Neri (Νηρί); a son of Melchi;  father of Shealtiel.
G3518.significance: Son of Melchi. Name (of Hebrew origin (H05374) Neri (i.e. Nerijah), an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H5374.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5374.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at Jer.32.12; only referred to as Neriah (נֵרִיָהוּ); a son of Mahseiah;  father of Baruch, Seraiah.
H5374.meaning: Hitchcock: light; lamp of the Lord
H5374.significance: Son of Mahseiah. Name (or נֵרִיָּהוּ; from H5216 (נִיר) and H3050 (יָהּ); light of Jah Nerija...). Name in lineage or family context.

G3505.d: Emperor living at the time of the New Testament
G3505.s: An emperor of Rome living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Php.4.22; referred to as Nero (Νέρων), or Caesar (Καῖσαρ).
G3505.meaning: of Latin origin Neron (i.e. Nero), a Roman emperor
G3505.significance: Roman Emperor. Name meaning: of Latin origin Neron (i.e. Nero), a Roman emperor

H5417.d: David's brother living at the time of United Monarchy
H5417.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.14; only referred to as Nethanel (נְתַנְאֵל);  son of Jesse; a brother of David, Eliab, Abinadab, Shimeah, Raddai, Ozem, Zeruiah, Abigail(?) and Elihu.
H5417.meaning: from H5414 (נָתַן) and H410 (אֵל); given of God Nethanel, the name of ten Israelites
H5417.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5414 (נָתַן) and H410 (אֵל); given of God Nethanel, the name of ten Israelites

H5418.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5418.s: A musician from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.25.2; only referred to as Nethaniah (נְתַנְיָ֫הוּ);  son of Asaph; a brother of Zaccur, Joseph and Asharelah.
H5418.f: Musician in David's time, descended from Asaph
H5418.meaning: Hitchcock: the gift of the Lord
H5418.significance: Son of Asaph. Name (or נְתַנְיָהוּ; from H5414 (נָתַן) and H3050 (יָהּ); given of Jah Neth...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H5335.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H5335.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.54; only referred to as Neziah (נְצִיחַ).
H5335.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: from H5329 (נָצַח); conspicuous Netsiach, a Temple-servant

G3527.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G3527.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Act.6.5; only referred to as Nicanor (Νικάνωρ).
G3527.significance: Minor figure; name: probably from G3528 (νικάω) victorious; Nicanor, a Christian

G3530.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G3530.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Jhn.3.1; only referred to as Nicodemus (Νικόδημος).
G3530.meaning: Greek Νικόδημος (Nikodemos); from νίκη (nike), victory, + δῆμος (demos), people. Nicodemus = victory of the people. Pharisee (John 3:1). BehindTheName: From Greek Νικόδημος meaning 'victory of the people'.
G3530.significance: Came by night (John 3:2); “how can a man be born again?” (John 3:4). Brought myrrh and aloes for Jesus’ burial (John 19:39). Name (victory of the people) as the one who came to the true Victory.

G3532.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G3532.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Act.6.5; only referred to as Nicolaus (Νικόλαος).
G3532.meaning: from G3534 (νῖκος) and G2994 (Λαοδικεύς) victorious over the people; Nicolaus, a heretic
G3532.significance: Minor figure; name: from G3534 (νῖκος) and G2994 (Λαοδικεύς) victorious over the people; Nicolaus, a heretic

H5248.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H5248.s: A warrior living at the time before the Flood, first mentioned at Gen.10.8; only referred to as Nimrod (נִמְרֹד);  son of Cush; a brother of Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah and Sabteca.
H5248.meaning: Hitchcock: rebellion (but probably an unknown Assyrian word)
H5248.significance: Son of Cush. Name (or נִמְרֹד; probably of foreign origin Nimrod, a son of Cush). Name in lineage or family context.

H5250.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5250.s: A man of the Kingdom of Israel, living at the time of Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ki.19.16; only referred to as Nimshi (נִמְשִׁי);  father of Jehoshaphat.
H5250.significance: Father of Jehoshaphat. Name (probably from H4871 (מָשָׁה); extricated Nimshi, the (grand-) father o...). Name in lineage or family context.

H5129.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H5129.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Ezr.8.33; only referred to as Noadiah (נוֹעַדְיָה); a son of Binnui.
H5129.meaning: Hitchcock: witness, or ornament, of the Lord
H5129.significance: Minor figure; name: from H3259 (יָעַד) and H3050 (יָהּ); convened of Jah Noadjah, the name of an Israelite, and a...

H5146.d: Flood survivor living at the time before the Flood
H5146.s: Flood survivor living at the time before the Flood, first mentioned at Gen.5.29; referred to as Noah (KJV= Noah)  (נֹחַ), or Noah (KJV= Noe)  (Νῶε);  husband of Naamah(?); a son of Lamech;  father of Shem, Ham and Japheth.
H5146.meaning: From נוֹחַ (Noach), rest. Noah = rest. Son of Lamech; preserved through the flood (Gen 6–9). Hitchcock: repose; consolation | that quavers or totters (Zelophehad's daughter). BehindTheName: From Hebrew נֹחַ (Noaḥ) meaning 'rest, comfort'.
H5146.significance: Preacher of righteousness (2 Pet 2:5); type of salvation and new creation. The ark as type of Christ—refuge from judgment. Covenant of the bow (Gen 9:13).

H5270.d: Woman living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5270.s: A woman from the tribe of Manasseh living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.26.33; only referred to as Noah (נֹעָה);  daughter of Zelophehad; a sister of Mahlah, Hoglah, Milcah and Tirzah.
H5270.meaning: Hitchcock: repose; consolation | that quavers or totters (Zelophehad's daughter). BehindTheName: From Hebrew נֹחַ (Noaḥ) meaning 'rest, comfort'.
H5270.significance: Sister of Mahlah. Name meaning: from H5128 (נוּעַ); movement Noah, an Israelitess

H5025.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5025.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.32.42; only referred to as Nobah (נֹ֫בַח).
H5025.significance: Minor figure; name: from H5024 (נָבַח); a bark Nobach, the name of an Israelite, and of a place East of the Jordan

H5052.d: David's son living at the time of United Monarchy
H5052.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.3.7; only referred to as Nogah (נֹ֫גַהּ);  son of David; a brother of Amnon, Chileab, Absalom, Adonijah, Shephatiah, Ithream, Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon, Ibhar, Elishua, Nepheg, Japhia, Elishama, Eliada, Eliphelet, Tamar, Elpelet and Jerimoth.
H5052.significance: David's son. Name (the same as H5051 (נֹגַהּ) Nogah, a son of David). Name in lineage or family context.

H5126.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5126.s: A man from the tribe of Ephraim living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Exo.33.11; only referred to as Nun (נוּן); a son of Elishama;  father of Joshua.
H5126.significance: Father of Joshua. Name (or נוֹן; (1 Chronicles 7:27), from H5125 (נוּן); perpetuity, Nun or No...). Name in lineage or family context.

G3564.d: Woman living at the time of the New Testament
G3564.s: A woman living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Col.4.15; only referred to as Nympha (Νυμφᾶς).
G3564.f: Hosted a church in her house
G3564.meaning: probably contracted for a compound of G3565 (νύμφη) and G1435 (δῶρον) nymph-given (i.e. -born);...
G3564.significance: Minor figure; name: probably contracted for a compound of G3565 (νύμφη) and G1435 (δῶρον) nymph-given (i.e. -born);...

H5662.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5662.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.3.21; only referred to as Obadiah (עֹבַדְיָ֫הוּ);  son of Hananiah; a brother of Pelatiah, Jeshaiah, Rephaiah, Arnan and Shecaniah.
H5662.meaning: From עָבַד (avad), serve, + יָהּ (Yah). Obadiah = servant of Yah. Prophet (Obad 1:1). Hitchcock: servant of the Lord. BehindTheName: From Hebrew עֹבַדְיָה meaning 'serving Yahweh'.
H5662.significance: Vision concerning Edom (Obad 1:1); “the day of the Lord is near” (Obad 1:15). Name (servant of Yah) as the one who spoke judgment on the brother who did not serve.

H5745.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H5745.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.10.28; referred to as Obal (עוֹבָל), or Obal (KJV= Ebal)  (עֵיבָל);  son of Joktan; a brother of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah, Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah, Abimael, Sheba, Ophir, Havilah and Jobab.
H5745.significance: Son of Joktan. Name (of foreign derivation Obal, a son of Joktan). Name in lineage or family context.

H5744.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5744.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.26.7; only referred to as Obed (עוֹבֵד);  son of Shemaiah; a brother of Othni, Rephael, Elzabad, Elihu and Semachiah.
H5744.meaning: Hitchcock: a servant; workman. BehindTheName: From Hebrew עוֹבֵד meaning 'serving, worshipping'.
H5744.significance: Minor figure; name: active participle of H5647 (עָבַד); serving Obed, the name of five Israelites

H5654.d: Singer living at the time of United Monarchy
H5654.s: A musician from the tribe of Levi living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.6.10; referred to as Obed-edom (עֹבֵד אֱדוֹם), or Shimei (שִׁמְעִי);  son of Jeduthun; a brother of Mattithiah, Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah and Hashabiah;  father of Shemaiah, Jehozabad, Joah, Sachar, Nethanel, Ammiel, Issachar and Peullethai.
H5654.significance: A Singer. Name (from the active participle of H5647 (עָבַד) and H123 (אֱדֹם); worker o...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0179.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0179.s: A man living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.27.30; only referred to as Obil (אוֹבִיל).
H0179.meaning: Hitchcock: that weeps; who deserves to be bewailed
H0179.significance: Minor figure; name: probably from H56 (אָבַל); mournful Obil, an Ishmaelite

H5918.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5918.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.1.13; only referred to as Ochran (עׇכְרָן);  father of Pagiel.
H5918.meaning: from H5916 (עָכַר); muddler Okran, an Israelite
H5918.significance: Father of Pagiel. Name (from H5916 (עָכַר); muddler Okran, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H5752.d: Prophet living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H5752.s: A prophet living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Ch.28.9; only referred to as Oded (עֹדֵד).
H5752.f: Prophet who confronted victorious Israelite army
H5752.meaning: Hitchcock: to sustain, hold or lift up
H5752.significance: Minor figure; name: or עֹדֵד; from H5749 (עוּד); reiteration Oded, the name of two Israelites

H5747.d: King living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H5747.s: A king of Bashan living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.21.33; only referred to as Og (עוֹג).
H5747.f: King of Bashan, defeated by Israel
H5747.meaning: Hitchcock: a cake; bread baked in ashes
H5747.significance: King of Bashan. Name (probably from H5746 (עוּג); round Og, a king of Bashan). Name in royal or ruling context.

H0161.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0161.s: A man from the tribe of Simeon living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.10; only referred to as Ohad (אֹ֫הַד);  son of Simeon; a brother of Jemuel, Jamin, Jachin, Zerah and Shaul.
H0161.significance: Son of Simeon. Name (from an unused root meaning to be united; unity Ohad, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H0169.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H0169.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.3.20; only referred to as Ohel (אֹ֫הֶל);  son of Zerubbabel; a brother of Meshullam, Hananiah, Shelomith, Hashubah, Berechiah, Hasadiah, Jushab-hesed, Abiud.
H0169.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H168 (אֹהֶל) Ohel, an Israelite

H0170.d: Woman living at the time of Exile and Return
H0170.s: A woman living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezk.23.4; only referred to as Oholah (אׇהֳלָה); a sister of Oholibah.
H0170.meaning: From אֹהֶל (ohel), tent. Oholah = her tent. Ezekiel's name for Samaria (Ezek 23:4).
H0170.significance: Elder sister in the allegory of the two adulterous sisters (Ezek 23); Samaria. Name (her tent) as Israel's dwelling corrupted by idolatry.

H0171.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0171.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Exo.31.6; only referred to as Oholiab (אׇהֳלִיאָב); a son of Ahisamach.
H0171.meaning: From אֹהֶל (ohel) + אָב (av). Oholiab = father's tent. Son of Ahisamach; craftsman for the tabernacle (Ex 31:6).
H0171.significance: Bezalel's partner in building the tabernacle; name (father's tent) fits the one who builds the dwelling of God.

H0172.d: Woman living at the time of Exile and Return
H0172.s: A woman living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezk.23.4; only referred to as Oholibah (אׇהֳלִיבָה); a sister of Oholah.
H0172.meaning: From אֹהֶל (ohel). Oholibah = my tent is in her. Ezekiel's name for Jerusalem (Ezek 23:4).
H0172.significance: Younger sister in Ezek 23; Jerusalem. Name (my tent in her) as the city where God's tent dwells—yet she played the harlot.

H0173.d: Woman living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0173.s: A woman living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.2; only referred to as Oholibamah (אׇהֳלִיבָמָה); a daughter of Anah; wife of Esau;  mother of Jeush, Jalam and Korah.
H0173.meaning: from H168 (אֹהֶל) and H1116 (בָּמָה); tent of (the) height Oholibamah, a wife of Esau
H0173.significance: Daughter of Anah. Name meaning: from H168 (אֹהֶל) and H1116 (בָּמָה); tent of (the) height Oholibamah,...

G3652.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G3652.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Rom.16.15; only referred to as Olympas (Ὀλυμπᾶς).
G3652.significance: Minor figure; name: probably a contraction from (Olympian-bestowed, i.e. heaven-descended) Olympas, a Christian

H0201.d: Edomite living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0201.s: A man of the Edomites living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.36.11; only referred to as Omar (אוֹמָר);  son of Eliphaz; a brother of Teman, Zepho, Gatam, Kenaz, Amalek and Korah.
H0201.f: Son of Eliphaz, grandson of Esau
H0201.significance: An Edomite. Name (from H559 (אָמַר); talkative Omar, a grandson of Esau). Name in lineage or family context.

H6018.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H6018.s: A man from the tribe of Benjamin living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at 1Ch.7.8; only referred to as Omri (עׇמְרִי);  son of Becher; a brother of Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth and Alemeth.
H6018.significance: Minor figure; name: from H6014 (עָמַר); heaping Omri, an Israelite

H0203.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0203.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.16.1; only referred to as On (אוֹן); a son of Peleth.
H0203.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H202 (אוֹן) On, an Israelite

H0208.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0208.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ch.2.26; only referred to as Onam (אוֹנָם);  son of Jerahmeel and Atarah; a brother of Ram, Bunah, Oren, Ozem and Ahijah;  father of Shammai and Jada.
H0208.f: Descendant of Judah, son of Jerahmeel
H0208.significance: Son of Jerahmeel. Name (a variation of H209 (אוֹנָן); strong Onam, the name of an Edomite and ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H0209.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H0209.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.38.4; only referred to as Onan (אוֹנָן);  son of Judah and Bath-shua ; a brother of Er and Shelah;  half-brother of: Perez and Zerah.
H0209.meaning: From אוֹן (on), strength. Onan = vigor. Son of Judah (Gen 38:4).
H0209.significance: Refused to raise seed for his brother (Gen 38:9); God struck him down. Name (strength) vs. act—withheld strength; type of the one who refuses the duty of the kinsman.

G3682.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G3682.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Col.4.9; referred to as Onesimus (Ὀνήσιμος).
G3682.significance: man living at the time of the new testament. Name meaning: from G3685 (ὀνίνημι) profitable; Onesimus, a Christian

G3683.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G3683.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at 2Ti.1.16; only referred to as Onesiphorus (Ὀνησίφορος).
G3683.significance: man living at the time of the new testament. Name meaning: from a derivative of G3685 (ὀνίνημι) and G5411 (φόρος) profit-bearer; ...

H0211.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs
H0211.s: A man living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.10.29; only referred to as Ophir (אוֹפִיר);  son of Joktan; a brother of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah, Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah, Obal, Abimael, Sheba, Havilah and Jobab.
H0211.significance: Son of Joktan. Name (or (shortened) אֹפִיר; and אוֹפִר; of uncertain derivation Ophir, the ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H6084.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H6084.s: A man from the tribe of Judah  living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.4.14; only referred to as Ophrah (עׇפְרָה); a son of Meonothai.
H6084.significance: Minor figure; name: feminine of H6082 (עֹפֶר); female fawn Ophrah, the name of an Israelite and of two places in...

H6159.s: A man living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jdg.7.25; only referred to as Oreb (עֹרֵב).
H6159.significance: man living before israel's monarchy. Name meaning: or עוֹרֵב; the same as H6158 (עֹרֵב) Oreb, the name of a Midianite and...

H0767.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0767.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.25; only referred to as Oren (אֹ֫רֶן);  son of Jerahmeel; a brother of Ram, Bunah, Ozem, Ahijah and Onam.
H0767.meaning: the same as H766 (אֹרֶן) Oren, an Israelite
H0767.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H766 (אֹרֶן) Oren, an Israelite

H0771.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H0771.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.24.16; referred to as Ornan (אׇרְנָן), or Araunah (=Qere. Ketiv= Ornah) or Araunah (=Qere. Ketiv= Arania) (אֲרַוְנָה).
H0771.significance: man living at the time of united monarchy. Name meaning: probably from H766 (אֹרֶן); strong Ornan, a Jebusite

H6204.s: A woman of the Moabites living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Rut.1.4; only referred to as Orpah (עׇרְפָּה); wife of Chilion.
H6204.significance: Moabite woman. Name meaning: feminine of H6203 (עֹרֶף); mane Orpah, a Moabites

H0620.d: King living at the time of Exile and Return
H0620.s: A king of Assyria living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Ezr.4.10; only referred to as Osnappar (אָֽסְנַפַּר).
H0620.f: Assyrian king who settled people in Samaria
H0620.meaning: of foreign derivation Osnappar, an Assyrian king
H0620.significance: Minor figure; name: of foreign derivation Osnappar, an Assyrian king

H6273.d: Levite living at the time of Divided Monarchy
H6273.s: A man from the tribe of Levi living at the time of Divided Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.26.7; only referred to as Othni (עׇתְנִי);  son of Shemaiah; a brother of Rephael, Obed, Elzabad, Elihu and Semachiah.
H6273.f: Son of Shemaiah, gatekeeper of the ark
H6273.significance: Minor figure; name: from an unused root meaning to force; forcible Othni, an Israelite

H6274.s: A Judge living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jos.15.17; only referred to as Othniel (עׇתְנִיאֵל);  son of Kenaz; a brother of Seraiah; husband of Achsah;  father of Hathath and Meonothai(?).
H6274.f: First judge of Israel, Caleb's nephew
H6274.significance: A Judge. Name (from the same as H6273 (עׇתְנִי) and H410 (אֵל); force of God Othniel,...). Name in judicial or deliverer context.

H0684.d: David's brother living at the time of United Monarchy
H0684.s: A man from the tribe of Judah living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 1Ch.2.15; only referred to as Ozem (אֹ֫צֶם);  son of Jesse; a brother of David, Eliab, Abinadab, Shimeah, Nethanel, Raddai, Zeruiah, Abigail(?) and Elihu.
H0684.significance: Minor figure; name: from an unused root probably meaning to be strong; strength (i.e. strong) Otsem, the name of two...

H6474.d: Warrior living at the time of United Monarchy
H6474.s: A warrior living at the time of United Monarchy, only mentioned at 2Sa.23.35; only referred to as Paarai (פַּעֲרַי).
H6474.significance: Minor figure; name: from H6473 (פָּעַר); yawning Paarai, an Israelite

H6303.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H6303.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.44; only referred to as Padon (פָּדוֹן).
H6303.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: from H6299 (פָּדָה); ransom Padon, one of the Nethinim.

H6295.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H6295.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Num.1.13; only referred to as Pagiel (פַּגְעִיאֵל); a son of Ochran.
H6295.f: Leader of the tribe of Asher
H6295.meaning: Hitchcock: prevention, or prayer, of God
H6295.significance: Son of Ochran. Name (from H6294 (פֶּגַע) and H410 (אֵל); accident of God Pagiel, an Israeli...). Name in lineage or family context.

H6355.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H6355.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.6; only referred to as Pahath-moab (פַּ֫חַת מוֹאָב);  father of Jeshua, Joab.
H6355.f: Group of returnees from Babylonian exile
H6355.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: from H6354 (פַּחַת) and H4124 (מוֹאָב); pit of Moab Pachath-Moab, an I...

H6420.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H6420.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.3.25; only referred to as Palal (פָּלָל); a son of Uzai.
H6420.f: Son of Uzai, repaired Jerusalem's wall
H6420.significance: Minor figure; name: from H6419 (פָּלַל); judge Palal, an Israelite

H6396.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H6396.s: A man from the tribe of Reuben living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.46.9; referred to as Pallu (פַּלּוּא), or Palluite (פַּלֻּאִי);  son of Reuben; a brother of Hanoch, Hezron and Carmi;  father of Eliab.
H6396.f: Son of Reuben, ancestor of the Palluites
H6396.significance: Son of Reuben. Name (from H6395 (פָּלָה); distinguished Pallu, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H6406.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H6406.s: A man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Sa.25.44; referred to as Palti (פַּלְטִי), or Paltiel (פַּלְטִיאֵל); a son of Laish; husband of Michal.
H6406.significance: Saul's family. Name (from H6403 (פָּלַט); delivered Palti, the name of two Israelites). Name in lineage or family context.

H6409.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H6409.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.34.26; only referred to as Paltiel (פַּלְטִיאֵל); a son of Azzan.
H6409.f: Leader from Issachar, helped divide Canaan
H6409.meaning: Hitchcock: deliverance; or banishment, of God
H6409.significance: Minor figure; name: from the same as H6404 (פֶּלֶט) and H410 (אֵל); deliverance of God Paltiel, the name of two...

H6534.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H6534.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Est.9.9; only referred to as Parmashta (פַּרְמַשְׁתָּא);  son of Haman; a brother of Parshandatha, Dalphon, Aspatha, Poratha, Adalia, Aridatha, Arisai, Aridai and Vaizatha.
H6534.f: Son of Haman, killed by the Jews
H6534.significance: Minor figure; name: of Persian origin Parmashta, a son of Haman

G3937.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament
G3937.s: A man living at the time of the New Testament, only mentioned at Act.6.5; only referred to as Parmenas (Παρμενᾶς).
G3937.meaning: Hitchcock: that abides, or is permanent
G3937.significance: Minor figure; name: probably by contraction for (a derivative of a compound of G3844 (παρά) and G3306 (μένω))...

H6535.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness
H6535.s: A man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, only mentioned at Num.34.25; only referred to as Parnach (פַּרְנָךְ);  father of Elizaphan.
H6535.f: Father of Elizaphan, leader from Zebulun
H6535.meaning: Hitchcock: a bull striking, or struck
H6535.significance: Father of Elizaphan. Name (of uncertain derivation Parnak, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H6551.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return

G3969.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament

G3972.d: Apostle living at the time of the New Testament
G3972.s: An apostle living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Act.7.58; referred to as  Paul (KJV, NIV= Paul), Paul (Παῦλος), or Saul (Σαούλ), or Saul (Σαῦλος), or Saul (Σαῦλος).
G3972.meaning: Greek Παῦλος (Paulos); Latin Paulus = small. Apostle (Acts 13:9). Hitchcock: small; little. BehindTheName: From Latin Paulus meaning 'small, humble'.
G3972.significance: Apostle to the Gentiles; from persecutor to preacher (Acts 9). “Least of the apostles” (1 Cor 15:9)—name (small) fits his self-understanding and the grace given him.

H6369.significance: man living at the time of the patriarchs. Name meaning: apparently from H6310 (פֶּה) and H3605 (כֹּל); mouth of all Picol, a P...

G5376.meaning: Greek Φίλιππος (Philippos); from φίλος (philos), friend, + ἵππος (hippos), horse. Philip = lover of horses. Apostle (Matt 10:3); also the evangelist (Acts 8:5). Hitchcock: warlike; a lover of horses. BehindTheName: From Greek Φίλιππος meaning 'friend of horses'.
G5376.significance: Apostle; brought Nathanael to Jesus (John 1:43). Evangelist: baptized the Ethiopian (Acts 8:38). Name (lover of horses) as the one who ran to bring others to the King.

G5378.significance: Minor figure; name: from G5384 (φίλος) and G3056 (λόγος) fond of words, i.e. talkative (argumentative, learned,...

H6372.significance: A High Priest. Name (apparently from H6310 (פֶּה) and a variation of H5175 (נָחָשׁ); mouth ...). Name fits cultic or priestly role.

G5402.significance: woman living at the time of the new testament. Name meaning: feminine of (bright probably akin to the base of G5457 (φῶς)); Phœbe, ...

G5436.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament

G5436.f: Believer who deserted Paul in Asia
G5436.meaning: probably from G5343 (φεύγω) fugitive; Phygellus, an apostate Christian
G5436.significance: Minor figure; name: probably from G5343 (φεύγω) fugitive; Phygellus, an apostate Christian

G4091.d: Ruler living at the time of the New Testament
G4091.s: A ruler in Rome living at the time of the New Testament, first mentioned at Mat.27.2; referred to as Pilate (KJV= Pilate) (Πιλᾶτος), or Pontius (Πόντιος).

G4091.significance: Asked “What is truth?” (John 18:38); washed his hands (Matt 27:24). Delivered Jesus to be crucified. Name (armed) as the one with power—who could not see the truth.

H6394.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs

H6502.meaning: Hitchcock: a wild ass of them

H6462.significance: Minor figure; name: perhaps from H6461 (פָּסַס); dispersion Pispah, an Israelite

H6380.meaning: from the active participle (of the same form as the first word) feminine of an unused root...
H6380.significance: Returned from exile. Name meaning: from the active participle (of the same form as the first word) femini...

H6319.meaning: of Egyptian derivation Poti-Phera, an Egyptian
H6319.significance: Father of Asenath. Name (of Egyptian derivation Poti-Phera, an Egyptian). Name in lineage or family context.

G4252.meaning: Hitchcock: same as Prisca. BehindTheName: Roman name, diminutive of Prisca 'ancient'.
G4252.significance: woman living at the time of the new testament. Name meaning: diminutive of G4251 (Πρίσκα) Priscilla (i.e. little Prisca), a Christi...

H6312.significance: Son of Issachar. Name (or פֻּוָּה; from H6284 (פָּאָה); a blast Puah or Puvvah, the name of t...). Name in lineage or family context.

H6316.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs

H6316.meaning: of foreign origin Put, a son of Ham, also the name of his descendants or their region, and of a...
H6316.significance: Son of Ham. Name (of foreign origin Put, a son of Ham, also the name of his descendants ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H6336.s: People from Puth(?), only mentioned at 1Ch.2.53; only referred to as Puthites (פּוּתִי).

H6336.significance: Minor figure; name: patronymically from an unused name meaning a hinge a Puthite (collectively) or descendants of an...

G6077.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament

G6077.significance: Father of Sopater. Name (name). Name in lineage or family context.

G2890.d: Man living at the time of the New Testament

H7484.d: Man living at the time of the Patriarchs

H7484.significance: Son of Cush. Name (the same as H7483 (רַעְמָה) Ramah, the name of a grandson of Ham, and ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H7248.significance: man living at the time of divided monarchy. Name meaning: from H7227 (רַב) and a foreign word for a Magian; chief Magian Rab-Mag...

H7249.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy

H7262.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy

H7262.significance: Babylonian official. Name meaning: from H7227 (רַב) and H8248 (שָׁקָה); chief butler Rabshakeh, a Babylon...

H7354.d: Woman living at the time of the Patriarchs

H7354.meaning: From רָחֵל (rachel), ewe. Rachel = ewe. Wife of Jacob; mother of Joseph and Benjamin (Gen 29–35). Hitchcock: sheep. BehindTheName: From Hebrew רָחֵל (Raḥel) meaning 'ewe'.
H7354.significance: Beloved of Jacob; wept for children (Jer 31:15; Matt 2:18). Her tomb marks the way; her sons become the chief tribes. Type of the bride and of maternal grief.

H7288.d: David's brother living at the time of United Monarchy

H7288.f: One of David's brothers, son of Jesse
H7288.significance: Minor figure; name: intensive from H7287 (רָדָה); domineering Raddai, an Israelite

H7343.s: A woman living before Israel's Monarchy, first mentioned at Jos.2.1; referred to as Rahab (רָחָב), or Rahab (Ῥαάβ), or Rahab (KJV= Rachab)  (Ῥαχάβ);  mother of Boaz(?).
H7343.meaning: Hitchcock: proud; quarrelsome (applied to Egypt) | large; extended (name of a woman). BehindTheName: From Hebrew רָחָב (Raḥav) meaning 'broad, wide'.
H7343.significance: woman living before israel's monarchy. Name meaning: the same as H7342 (רָחָב); proud Rachab, a Canaanitess

H7357.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy

H7357.significance: Minor figure; name: the same as H7356 (רַחַם); pity Racham, an Israelite

H7552.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy

H7552.significance: Son of Hebron. Name (from H7551 (רָקַם); versi-color Rekem, the name of a place in Palestin...). Name in lineage or family context.

H7410.significance: man living at the time of united monarchy. Name (active participle of H7311 (רוּם); high Ram, the name of an Arabian an...). Name in lineage or family context.

H7435.s: People from Ramath(?), only mentioned at 1Ch.27.27; only referred to as Ramathites (רָמָתִי).

H7435.significance: Minor figure; name: patronymic of H7414 (רָמָה) a Ramathite or inhabitant of Ramah

H7422.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return

H7497.f: Ancestor of Philistine giants; his descendants fought against David's warriors.
H7497.meaning: or רָפָה; from H7495 (רָפָא) in the sense of invigorating a giant
H7497.significance: A gigantic man. Name meaning: or רָפָה; from H7495 (רָפָא) in the sense of invigorating a giant

H7498.significance: Saul's family. Name (or רָפָה; probably the same as H7497 (רָפָא); giant Rapha or Raphah, t...). Name in lineage or family context.

H7505.d: Man living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness

H7505.significance: Father of Palti. Name (passive participle of H7495 (רָפָא); cured Raphu, an Israelite). Name in lineage or family context.

H7211.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy

H7211.significance: Son of Micah. Name (from H7200 (רָאָה) and H3050 (יָהּ); Jah has seen Reajah, the name of ...). Name in lineage or family context.

H7254.d: King living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness

H7254.significance: king living at the time of egypt and wilderness. Name (the same as H7253 (רֶבַע) Reba, a Midianite). Name in royal or ruling context.

H7259.d: Woman living at the time of the Patriarchs
H7259.s: A woman living at the time of the Patriarchs, first mentioned at Gen.22.23; referred to as Rebekah (רִבְקָה), or Rebekah (Ῥεβέκκα);  daughter of Bethuel; a sister of Laban; wife of Isaac;  mother of Esau and Israel.

H7259.meaning: From רָבַק (ravaq), tie, bind. Rebekah = binding, noose. Wife of Isaac (Gen 24:15). Hitchcock: fat; fattened; a quarrel appeased. BehindTheName: From Hebrew רִבְקָה (Rivqa) possibly meaning 'to tie, to bind'.
H7259.significance: Chosen at the well (Gen 24:14); mother of Jacob and Esau. “Two nations in your womb” (Gen 25:23). Name (binding) as the one who bound the covenant to the chosen son.

H7394.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy

H7394.significance: Son of Hammath. Name (from H7392 (רָכַב); rider Rekab, the name of two Arabs and of two Isra...). Name in lineage or family context.

H7480.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return

H7480.significance: Returned leader. Name meaning: from H7477 (רָעַל) and H3050 (יָהּ); made to tremble (i.e. fearful) of...

H7276.d: Man living at the time of Divided Monarchy

H7276.meaning: Hitchcock: that stones or is stoned; purple
H7276.significance: Minor figure; name: from H7275 (רָגַם); stoneheap Regem, an Israelite

H7278.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return

H7278.f: A messenger sent to inquire of the Lord
H7278.meaning: from H7276 (רֶגֶם) and H4428 (מֶלֶךְ); king's heap Regem-Melek, an Israelite
H7278.significance: Minor figure; name: from H7276 (רֶגֶם) and H4428 (מֶלֶךְ); king's heap Regem-Melek, an Israelite

H7345.d: Levite living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness

H7345.significance: Son of Eliezer. Name (or רְחַבְיָהוּ; from H7337 (רָחַב) and H3050 (יָהּ); Jah has enlarged ...). Name in Levitical or temple service.

H7340.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
H7340.s: A man of Zobah living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.8.3; only referred to as Rehob (רְחוֹב);  father of Hadadezer.
H7340.f: Father of Hadadezer, king of Zobah
H7340.significance: David's opponent. Name meaning: or רְחוֹב; the same as H7339 (רְחֹב) Rechob, the name of a place in Sy...

H7346.d: King living at the time of United Monarchyand Divided Monarchy
H7346.s: A king of Judah living at the time of United Monarchyand Divided Monarchy, first mentioned at 1Ki.11.43; referred to as Rehoboam (רְחַבְעָם), or Rehoboam (KJV= Roboam) (Ῥοβοάμ);  son of Solomon and Naamah; a brother of Taphath and Basemath; husband of Maacah, Mahalath and Abihail;  father of Abijah, Jeush, Shemariah, Zaham, Attai, Ziza and Shelomith; founder of Tekoa.
H7346.meaning: Hitchcock: who sets the people at liberty
H7346.significance: King of Judah. Name (from H7337 (רָחַב) and H5971 (עַם); a people has enlarged Rechabam, an...). Name in royal or ruling context.

H7348.d: Man living at the time of Exile and Return
H7348.s: A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.3.17; only referred to as Rehum (רְחוּם); a son of Bani.

H7472.d: Man living at the time of United Monarchy
